35  @brief Implementations of expression classes

45 #include "llvmutil.h"
46 #ifndef _MSC_VER
47 #include <inttypes.h>

50 #define PRId64 "lld"
51 #endif
52 #ifndef PRIu64
53 #define PRIu64 "llu"
54 #endif

57 #include <set>
58 #include <stdio.h>

81 // Expr
82 
83 llvm::Value *
84 Expr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
85  // Expressions that can't provide an lvalue can just return NULL
86  return NULL;
87 }
88 
89 
90 const Type *
91 Expr::GetLValueType() const {
92  // This also only needs to be overrided by Exprs that implement the
93  // GetLValue() method.
94  return NULL;
95 }
96 
97 
98 llvm::Constant *
99 Expr::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
100  // The default is failure; just return NULL
101  return NULL;
102 }
103 
104 
105 Symbol *
106 Expr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
107  // Not all expressions can do this, so provide a generally-useful
108  // default implementation.
109  return NULL;
110 }
111 
112 
113 #if 0
114 /** If a conversion from 'fromAtomicType' to 'toAtomicType' may cause lost
115  precision, issue a warning. Don't warn for conversions to bool and
116  conversions between signed and unsigned integers of the same size.
117  */
118 static void
119 lMaybeIssuePrecisionWarning(const AtomicType *toAtomicType,
120  const AtomicType *fromAtomicType,
121  SourcePos pos, const char *errorMsgBase) {
122  switch (toAtomicType->basicType) {
123  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
124  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
125  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
126  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
127  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
128  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
129  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
130  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
131  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
132  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
133  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
134  if ((int)toAtomicType->basicType < (int)fromAtomicType->basicType &&
135  toAtomicType->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL &&
136  !(toAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT8 &&
137  fromAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8) &&
138  !(toAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT16 &&
139  fromAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16) &&
140  !(toAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT32 &&
141  fromAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32) &&
142  !(toAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT64 &&
143  fromAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64))
144  Warning(pos, "Conversion from type \"%s\" to type \"%s\" for %s"
145  " may lose information.",
146  fromAtomicType->GetString().c_str(), toAtomicType->GetString().c_str(),
147  errorMsgBase);
148  break;
149  default:
150  FATAL("logic error in lMaybeIssuePrecisionWarning()");
151  }
152 }
153 #endif
154 
155 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
156 
157 static Expr *
158 lArrayToPointer(Expr *expr) {
159  AssertPos(expr->pos, expr && CastType<ArrayType>(expr->GetType()));
160 
161  Expr *zero = new ConstExpr(AtomicType::UniformInt32, 0, expr->pos);
162  Expr *index = new IndexExpr(expr, zero, expr->pos);
163  Expr *addr = new AddressOfExpr(index, expr->pos);
164  addr = TypeCheck(addr);
165  Assert(addr != NULL);
166  addr = Optimize(addr);
167  Assert(addr != NULL);
168  return addr;
169 }
170 
171 
172 static bool
173 lIsAllIntZeros(Expr *expr) {
174  const Type *type = expr->GetType();
175  if (type == NULL || type->IsIntType() == false)
176  return false;
177 
178  ConstExpr *ce = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr);
179  if (ce == NULL)
180  return false;
181 
182  uint64_t vals[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
183  int count = ce->GetValues(vals);
184  if (count == 1)
185  return (vals[0] == 0);
186  else {
187  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
188  if (vals[i] != 0)
189  return false;
190  }
191  return true;
192 }
193 
194 
195 static bool
196 lDoTypeConv(const Type *fromType, const Type *toType, Expr **expr,
197  bool failureOk, const char *errorMsgBase, SourcePos pos) {
198  /* This function is way too long and complex. Is type conversion stuff
199  always this messy, or can this be cleaned up somehow? */
200  AssertPos(pos, failureOk || errorMsgBase != NULL);
201 
202  if (toType == NULL || fromType == NULL)
203  return false;
204 
205  // The types are equal; there's nothing to do
206  if (Type::Equal(toType, fromType))
207  return true;
208 
209  if (Type::Equal(fromType, AtomicType::Void)) {
210  if (!failureOk)
211  Error(pos, "Can't convert from \"void\" to \"%s\" for %s.",
212  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
213  return false;
214  }
215 
216  if (Type::Equal(toType, AtomicType::Void)) {
217  if (!failureOk)
218  Error(pos, "Can't convert type \"%s\" to \"void\" for %s.",
219  fromType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
220  return false;
221  }
222 
223  if (CastType<FunctionType>(fromType)) {
224  if (CastType<PointerType>(toType) != NULL) {
225  // Convert function type to pointer to function type
226  if (expr != NULL) {
227  Expr *aoe = new AddressOfExpr(*expr, (*expr)->pos);
228  if (lDoTypeConv(aoe->GetType(), toType, &aoe, failureOk,
229  errorMsgBase, pos)) {
230  *expr = aoe;
231  return true;
232  }
233  }
234  else
235  return lDoTypeConv(PointerType::GetUniform(fromType), toType, NULL,
236  failureOk, errorMsgBase, pos);
237  }
238  else {
239  if (!failureOk)
240  Error(pos, "Can't convert function type \"%s\" to \"%s\" for %s.",
241  fromType->GetString().c_str(),
242  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
243  return false;
244  }
245  }
246  if (CastType<FunctionType>(toType)) {
247  if (!failureOk)
248  Error(pos, "Can't convert from type \"%s\" to function type \"%s\" "
249  "for %s.", fromType->GetString().c_str(),
250  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
251  return false;
252  }
253 
254  if ((toType->GetSOAWidth() > 0 || fromType->GetSOAWidth() > 0) &&
255  Type::Equal(toType->GetAsUniformType(), fromType->GetAsUniformType()) &&
256  toType->GetSOAWidth() != fromType->GetSOAWidth()) {
257  if (!failureOk)
258  Error(pos, "Can't convert between types \"%s\" and \"%s\" with "
259  "different SOA widths for %s.", fromType->GetString().c_str(),
260  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
261  return false;
262  }
263 
264  const ArrayType *toArrayType = CastType<ArrayType>(toType);
265  const ArrayType *fromArrayType = CastType<ArrayType>(fromType);
266  const VectorType *toVectorType = CastType<VectorType>(toType);
267  const VectorType *fromVectorType = CastType<VectorType>(fromType);
268  const StructType *toStructType = CastType<StructType>(toType);
269  const StructType *fromStructType = CastType<StructType>(fromType);
270  const EnumType *toEnumType = CastType<EnumType>(toType);
271  const EnumType *fromEnumType = CastType<EnumType>(fromType);
272  const AtomicType *toAtomicType = CastType<AtomicType>(toType);
273  const AtomicType *fromAtomicType = CastType<AtomicType>(fromType);
274  const PointerType *fromPointerType = CastType<PointerType>(fromType);
275  const PointerType *toPointerType = CastType<PointerType>(toType);
276 
277  // Do this early, since for the case of a conversion like
278  // "float foo[10]" -> "float * uniform foo", we have what's seemingly
279  // a varying to uniform conversion (but not really)
280  if (fromArrayType != NULL && toPointerType != NULL) {
281  // can convert any array to a void pointer (both uniform and
282  // varying).
283  if (PointerType::IsVoidPointer(toPointerType))
284  goto typecast_ok;
285 
286  // array to pointer to array element type
287  const Type *eltType = fromArrayType->GetElementType();
288  if (toPointerType->GetBaseType()->IsConstType())
289  eltType = eltType->GetAsConstType();
290 
291  PointerType pt(eltType, toPointerType->GetVariability(),
292  toPointerType->IsConstType());
293  if (Type::Equal(toPointerType, &pt))
294  goto typecast_ok;
295  else {
296  if (!failureOk)
297  Error(pos, "Can't convert from incompatible array type \"%s\" "
298  "to pointer type \"%s\" for %s.",
299  fromType->GetString().c_str(),
300  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
301  return false;
302  }
303  }
304 
305  if (toType->IsUniformType() && fromType->IsVaryingType()) {
306  if (!failureOk)
307  Error(pos, "Can't convert from type \"%s\" to type \"%s\" for %s.",
308  fromType->GetString().c_str(), toType->GetString().c_str(),
309  errorMsgBase);
310  return false;
311  }
312 
313  if (fromPointerType != NULL) {
314  if (CastType<AtomicType>(toType) != NULL &&
315  toType->IsBoolType())
316  // Allow implicit conversion of pointers to bools
317  goto typecast_ok;
318 
319  if (toArrayType != NULL &&
320  Type::Equal(fromType->GetBaseType(), toArrayType->GetElementType())) {
321  // Can convert pointers to arrays of the same type
322  goto typecast_ok;
323  }
324  if (toPointerType == NULL) {
325  if (!failureOk)
326  Error(pos, "Can't convert between from pointer type "
327  "\"%s\" to non-pointer type \"%s\" for %s.",
328  fromType->GetString().c_str(),
329  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
330  return false;
331  }
332  else if (fromPointerType->IsSlice() == true &&
333  toPointerType->IsSlice() == false) {
334  if (!failureOk)
335  Error(pos, "Can't convert from pointer to SOA type "
336  "\"%s\" to pointer to non-SOA type \"%s\" for %s.",
337  fromPointerType->GetAsNonSlice()->GetString().c_str(),
338  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
339  return false;
340  }
341  else if (PointerType::IsVoidPointer(toPointerType)) {
342  // any pointer type can be converted to a void *
343  goto typecast_ok;
344  }
345  else if (PointerType::IsVoidPointer(fromPointerType) &&
346  expr != NULL &&
347  dynamic_cast<NullPointerExpr *>(*expr) != NULL) {
348  // and a NULL convert to any other pointer type
349  goto typecast_ok;
350  }
351  else if (!Type::Equal(fromPointerType->GetBaseType(),
352  toPointerType->GetBaseType()) &&
353  !Type::Equal(fromPointerType->GetBaseType()->GetAsConstType(),
354  toPointerType->GetBaseType())) {
355  if (!failureOk)
356  Error(pos, "Can't convert from pointer type \"%s\" to "
357  "incompatible pointer type \"%s\" for %s.",
358  fromPointerType->GetString().c_str(),
359  toPointerType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
360  return false;
361  }
362 
363  if (toType->IsVaryingType() && fromType->IsUniformType())
364  goto typecast_ok;
365 
366  if (toPointerType->IsSlice() == true &&
367  fromPointerType->IsSlice() == false)
368  goto typecast_ok;
369 
370  // Otherwise there's nothing to do
371  return true;
372  }
373 
374  if (toPointerType != NULL && fromAtomicType != NULL &&
375  fromAtomicType->IsIntType() && expr != NULL &&
376  lIsAllIntZeros(*expr)) {
377  // We have a zero-valued integer expression, which can also be
378  // treated as a NULL pointer that can be converted to any other
379  // pointer type.
380  Expr *npe = new NullPointerExpr(pos);
381  if (lDoTypeConv(PointerType::Void, toType, &npe,
382  failureOk, errorMsgBase, pos)) {
383  *expr = npe;
384  return true;
385  }
386  return false;
387  }
388 
389  // Need to check this early, since otherwise the [sic] "unbound"
390  // variability of SOA struct types causes things to get messy if that
391  // hasn't been detected...
392  if (toStructType && fromStructType &&
393  (toStructType->GetSOAWidth() != fromStructType->GetSOAWidth())) {
394  if (!failureOk)
395  Error(pos, "Can't convert between incompatible struct types \"%s\" "
396  "and \"%s\" for %s.", fromType->GetString().c_str(),
397  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
398  return false;
399  }
400 
401  // Convert from type T -> const T; just return a TypeCast expr, which
402  // can handle this
403  if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toType, fromType) &&
404  toType->IsConstType() == true &&
405  fromType->IsConstType() == false)
406  goto typecast_ok;
407 
408  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(fromType)) {
409  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(toType)) {
410  // Convert from a reference to a type to a const reference to a type;
411  // this is handled by TypeCastExpr
412  if (Type::Equal(toType->GetReferenceTarget(),
413  fromType->GetReferenceTarget()->GetAsConstType()))
414  goto typecast_ok;
415 
416  const ArrayType *atFrom =
417  CastType<ArrayType>(fromType->GetReferenceTarget());
418  const ArrayType *atTo =
419  CastType<ArrayType>(toType->GetReferenceTarget());
420 
421  if (atFrom != NULL && atTo != NULL &&
422  Type::Equal(atFrom->GetElementType(), atTo->GetElementType())) {
423  goto typecast_ok;
424  }
425  else {
426  if (!failureOk)
427  Error(pos, "Can't convert between incompatible reference types \"%s\" "
428  "and \"%s\" for %s.", fromType->GetString().c_str(),
429  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
430  return false;
431  }
432  }
433  else {
434  // convert from a reference T -> T
435  if (expr != NULL) {
436  Expr *drExpr = new RefDerefExpr(*expr, pos);
437  if (lDoTypeConv(drExpr->GetType(), toType, &drExpr, failureOk,
438  errorMsgBase, pos) == true) {
439  *expr = drExpr;
440  return true;
441  }
442  return false;
443  }
444  else
445  return lDoTypeConv(fromType->GetReferenceTarget(), toType, NULL,
446  failureOk, errorMsgBase, pos);
447  }
448  }
449  else if (CastType<ReferenceType>(toType)) {
450  // T -> reference T
451  if (expr != NULL) {
452  Expr *rExpr = new ReferenceExpr(*expr, pos);
453  if (lDoTypeConv(rExpr->GetType(), toType, &rExpr, failureOk,
454  errorMsgBase, pos) == true) {
455  *expr = rExpr;
456  return true;
457  }
458  return false;
459  }
460  else {
461  ReferenceType rt(fromType);
462  return lDoTypeConv(&rt, toType, NULL, failureOk, errorMsgBase, pos);
463  }
464  }
465  else if (Type::Equal(toType, fromType->GetAsNonConstType()))
466  // convert: const T -> T (as long as T isn't a reference)
467  goto typecast_ok;
468 
469  fromType = fromType->GetReferenceTarget();
470  toType = toType->GetReferenceTarget();
471  if (toArrayType && fromArrayType) {
472  if (Type::Equal(toArrayType->GetElementType(),
473  fromArrayType->GetElementType())) {
474  // the case of different element counts should have returned
475  // successfully earlier, yes??
476  AssertPos(pos, toArrayType->GetElementCount() != fromArrayType->GetElementCount());
477  goto typecast_ok;
478  }
479  else if (Type::Equal(toArrayType->GetElementType(),
480  fromArrayType->GetElementType()->GetAsConstType())) {
481  // T[x] -> const T[x]
482  goto typecast_ok;
483  }
484  else {
485  if (!failureOk)
486  Error(pos, "Array type \"%s\" can't be converted to type \"%s\" for %s.",
487  fromType->GetString().c_str(), toType->GetString().c_str(),
488  errorMsgBase);
489  return false;
490  }
491  }
492 
493  if (toVectorType && fromVectorType) {
494  // converting e.g. int<n> -> float<n>
495  if (fromVectorType->GetElementCount() != toVectorType->GetElementCount()) {
496  if (!failureOk)
497  Error(pos, "Can't convert between differently sized vector types "
498  "\"%s\" -> \"%s\" for %s.", fromType->GetString().c_str(),
499  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
500  return false;
501  }
502  goto typecast_ok;
503  }
504 
505  if (toStructType && fromStructType) {
506  if (!Type::Equal(toStructType->GetAsUniformType()->GetAsConstType(),
507  fromStructType->GetAsUniformType()->GetAsConstType())) {
508  if (!failureOk)
509  Error(pos, "Can't convert between different struct types "
510  "\"%s\" and \"%s\" for %s.", fromStructType->GetString().c_str(),
511  toStructType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
512  return false;
513  }
514  goto typecast_ok;
515  }
516 
517  if (toEnumType != NULL && fromEnumType != NULL) {
518  // No implicit conversions between different enum types
519  if (!Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toEnumType->GetAsUniformType(),
520  fromEnumType->GetAsUniformType())) {
521  if (!failureOk)
522  Error(pos, "Can't convert between different enum types "
523  "\"%s\" and \"%s\" for %s", fromEnumType->GetString().c_str(),
524  toEnumType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
525  return false;
526  }
527  goto typecast_ok;
528  }
529 
530  // enum -> atomic (integer, generally...) is always ok
531  if (fromEnumType != NULL) {
532  AssertPos(pos, toAtomicType != NULL || toVectorType != NULL);
533  goto typecast_ok;
534  }
535 
536  // from here on out, the from type can only be atomic something or
537  // other...
538  if (fromAtomicType == NULL) {
539  if (!failureOk)
540  Error(pos, "Type conversion from \"%s\" to \"%s\" for %s is not "
541  "possible.", fromType->GetString().c_str(),
542  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
543  return false;
544  }
545 
546  // scalar -> short-vector conversions
547  if (toVectorType != NULL &&
548  (fromType->GetSOAWidth() == toType->GetSOAWidth()))
549  goto typecast_ok;
550 
551  // ok, it better be a scalar->scalar conversion of some sort by now
552  if (toAtomicType == NULL) {
553  if (!failureOk)
554  Error(pos, "Type conversion from \"%s\" to \"%s\" for %s is "
555  "not possible", fromType->GetString().c_str(),
556  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
557  return false;
558  }
559 
560  if (fromType->GetSOAWidth() != toType->GetSOAWidth()) {
561  if (!failureOk)
562  Error(pos, "Can't convert between types \"%s\" and \"%s\" with "
563  "different SOA widths for %s.", fromType->GetString().c_str(),
564  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
565  return false;
566  }
567 
568  typecast_ok:
569  if (expr != NULL)
570  *expr = new TypeCastExpr(toType, *expr, pos);
571  return true;
572 }
573 
574 
575 bool
576 CanConvertTypes(const Type *fromType, const Type *toType,
577  const char *errorMsgBase, SourcePos pos) {
578  return lDoTypeConv(fromType, toType, NULL, errorMsgBase == NULL,
579  errorMsgBase, pos);
580 }
581 
582 
583 Expr *
584 TypeConvertExpr(Expr *expr, const Type *toType, const char *errorMsgBase) {
585  if (expr == NULL)
586  return NULL;
587 
588 #if 0
589  Debug(expr->pos, "type convert %s -> %s.", expr->GetType()->GetString().c_str(),
590  toType->GetString().c_str());
591 #endif
592 
593  const Type *fromType = expr->GetType();
594  Expr *e = expr;
595  if (lDoTypeConv(fromType, toType, &e, false, errorMsgBase,
596  expr->pos))
597  return e;
598  else
599  return NULL;
600 }
601 
602 
603 bool
604 PossiblyResolveFunctionOverloads(Expr *expr, const Type *type) {
605  FunctionSymbolExpr *fse = NULL;
606  const FunctionType *funcType = NULL;
607  if (CastType<PointerType>(type) != NULL &&
608  (funcType = CastType<FunctionType>(type->GetBaseType())) &&
609  (fse = dynamic_cast<FunctionSymbolExpr *>(expr)) != NULL) {
610  // We're initializing a function pointer with a function symbol,
611  // which in turn may represent an overloaded function. So we need
612  // to try to resolve the overload based on the type of the symbol
613  // we're initializing here.
614  std::vector<const Type *> paramTypes;
615  for (int i = 0; i < funcType->GetNumParameters(); ++i)
616  paramTypes.push_back(funcType->GetParameterType(i));
617 
618  if (fse->ResolveOverloads(expr->pos, paramTypes) == false)
619  return false;
620  }
621  return true;
622 }
623 
624 
625 
626 /** Utility routine that emits code to initialize a symbol given an
627  initializer expression.
628 
629  @param ptr Memory location of storage for the symbol's data
630  @param symName Name of symbol (used in error messages)
631  @param symType Type of variable being initialized
632  @param initExpr Expression for the initializer
633  @param ctx FunctionEmitContext to use for generating instructions
634  @param pos Source file position of the variable being initialized
635 */
636 void
637 InitSymbol(llvm::Value *ptr, const Type *symType, Expr *initExpr,
638  FunctionEmitContext *ctx, SourcePos pos) {
639  if (initExpr == NULL)
640  // leave it uninitialized
641  return;
642 
643  // See if we have a constant initializer a this point
644  llvm::Constant *constValue = initExpr->GetConstant(symType);
645  if (constValue != NULL) {
646  // It'd be nice if we could just do a StoreInst(constValue, ptr)
647  // at this point, but unfortunately that doesn't generate great
648  // code (e.g. a bunch of scalar moves for a constant array.) So
649  // instead we'll make a constant static global that holds the
650  // constant value and emit a memcpy to put its value into the
651  // pointer we have.
652  llvm::Type *llvmType = symType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
653  if (llvmType == NULL) {
654  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
655  return;
656  }
657 
658  if (Type::IsBasicType(symType))
659  ctx->StoreInst(constValue, ptr);
660  else {
661  llvm::Value *constPtr =
662  new llvm::GlobalVariable(*m->module, llvmType, true /* const */,
663  llvm::GlobalValue::InternalLinkage,
664  constValue, "const_initializer");
665  llvm::Value *size = g->target->SizeOf(llvmType,
666  ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
667  ctx->MemcpyInst(ptr, constPtr, size);
668  }
669 
670  return;
671  }
672 
673  // If the initializer is a straight up expression that isn't an
674  // ExprList, then we'll see if we can type convert it to the type of
675  // the variable.
676  if (dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(initExpr) == NULL) {
677  if (PossiblyResolveFunctionOverloads(initExpr, symType) == false)
678  return;
679  initExpr = TypeConvertExpr(initExpr, symType, "initializer");
680 
681  if (initExpr == NULL)
682  return;
683 
684  llvm::Value *initializerValue = initExpr->GetValue(ctx);
685  if (initializerValue != NULL)
686  // Bingo; store the value in the variable's storage
687  ctx->StoreInst(initializerValue, ptr);
688  return;
689  }
690 
691  // Atomic types and enums can be initialized with { ... } initializer
692  // expressions if they have a single element (except for SOA types,
693  // which are handled below).
694  if (symType->IsSOAType() == false && Type::IsBasicType(symType)) {
695  ExprList *elist = dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(initExpr);
696  if (elist != NULL) {
697  if (elist->exprs.size() == 1)
698  InitSymbol(ptr, symType, elist->exprs[0], ctx, pos);
699  else
700  Error(initExpr->pos, "Expression list initializers with "
701  "multiple values can't be used with type \"%s\".",
702  symType->GetString().c_str());
703  }
704  return;
705  }
706 
707  const ReferenceType *rt = CastType<ReferenceType>(symType);
708  if (rt) {
709  if (!Type::Equal(initExpr->GetType(), rt)) {
710  Error(initExpr->pos, "Initializer for reference type \"%s\" must have same "
711  "reference type itself. \"%s\" is incompatible.",
712  rt->GetString().c_str(), initExpr->GetType()->GetString().c_str());
713  return;
714  }
715 
716  llvm::Value *initializerValue = initExpr->GetValue(ctx);
717  if (initializerValue)
718  ctx->StoreInst(initializerValue, ptr);
719  return;
720  }
721 
722  // Handle initiailizers for SOA types as well as for structs, arrays,
723  // and vectors.
724  const CollectionType *collectionType = CastType<CollectionType>(symType);
725  if (collectionType != NULL || symType->IsSOAType()) {
726  int nElements = collectionType ? collectionType->GetElementCount() :
727  symType->GetSOAWidth();
728 
729  std::string name;
730  if (CastType<StructType>(symType) != NULL)
731  name = "struct";
732  else if (CastType<ArrayType>(symType) != NULL)
733  name = "array";
734  else if (CastType<VectorType>(symType) != NULL)
735  name = "vector";
736  else if (symType->IsSOAType())
737  name = symType->GetVariability().GetString();
738  else
739  FATAL("Unexpected CollectionType in InitSymbol()");
740 
741  // There are two cases for initializing these types; either a
742  // single initializer may be provided (float foo[3] = 0;), in which
743  // case all of the elements are initialized to the given value, or
744  // an initializer list may be provided (float foo[3] = { 1,2,3 }),
745  // in which case the elements are initialized with the
746  // corresponding values.
747  ExprList *exprList = dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(initExpr);
748  if (exprList != NULL) {
749  // The { ... } case; make sure we have the no more expressions
750  // in the ExprList as we have struct members
751  int nInits = exprList->exprs.size();
752  if (nInits > nElements) {
753  Error(initExpr->pos, "Initializer for %s type \"%s\" requires "
754  "no more than %d values; %d provided.", name.c_str(),
755  symType->GetString().c_str(), nElements, nInits);
756  return;
757  }
758 
759  // Initialize each element with the corresponding value from
760  // the ExprList
761  for (int i = 0; i < nElements; ++i) {
762  // For SOA types, the element type is the uniform variant
763  // of the underlying type
764  const Type *elementType =
765  collectionType ? collectionType->GetElementType(i) :
766  symType->GetAsUniformType();
767  if (elementType == NULL) {
768  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
769  return;
770  }
771 
772  llvm::Value *ep;
773  if (CastType<StructType>(symType) != NULL)
774  ep = ctx->AddElementOffset(ptr, i, NULL, "element");
775  else
776  ep = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(ptr, LLVMInt32(0), LLVMInt32(i),
777  PointerType::GetUniform(elementType),
778  "gep");
779 
780  if (i < nInits)
781  InitSymbol(ep, elementType, exprList->exprs[i], ctx, pos);
782  else {
783  // If we don't have enough initializer values, initialize the
784  // rest as zero.
785  llvm::Type *llvmType = elementType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
786  if (llvmType == NULL) {
787  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
788  return;
789  }
790 
791  llvm::Constant *zeroInit = llvm::Constant::getNullValue(llvmType);
792  ctx->StoreInst(zeroInit, ep);
793  }
794  }
795  }
796  else
797  Error(initExpr->pos, "Can't assign type \"%s\" to \"%s\".",
798  initExpr->GetType()->GetString().c_str(),
799  collectionType->GetString().c_str());
800  return;
801  }
802 
803  FATAL("Unexpected Type in InitSymbol()");
804 }
805 
806 
807 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
808 
809 /** Given an atomic or vector type, this returns a boolean type with the
810  same "shape". In other words, if the given type is a vector type of
811  three uniform ints, the returned type is a vector type of three uniform
812  bools. */
813 static const Type *
814 lMatchingBoolType(const Type *type) {
815  bool uniformTest = type->IsUniformType();
816  const AtomicType *boolBase = uniformTest ? AtomicType::UniformBool :
817  AtomicType::VaryingBool;
818  const VectorType *vt = CastType<VectorType>(type);
819  if (vt != NULL)
820  return new VectorType(boolBase, vt->GetElementCount());
821  else {
822  Assert(Type::IsBasicType(type));
823  return boolBase;
824  }
825 }
826 
827 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
828 // UnaryExpr
829 
830 static llvm::Constant *
831 lLLVMConstantValue(const Type *type, llvm::LLVMContext *ctx, double value) {
832  const AtomicType *atomicType = CastType<AtomicType>(type);
833  const EnumType *enumType = CastType<EnumType>(type);
834  const VectorType *vectorType = CastType<VectorType>(type);
835  const PointerType *pointerType = CastType<PointerType>(type);
836 
837  // This function is only called with, and only works for atomic, enum,
838  // and vector types.
839  Assert(atomicType != NULL || enumType != NULL || vectorType != NULL ||
840  pointerType != NULL);
841 
842  if (atomicType != NULL || enumType != NULL) {
843  // If it's an atomic or enuemrator type, then figure out which of
844  // the llvmutil.h functions to call to get the corresponding
845  // constant and then call it...
846  bool isUniform = type->IsUniformType();
847  AtomicType::BasicType basicType = (enumType != NULL) ?
848  AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32 : atomicType->basicType;
849 
850  switch (basicType) {
851  case AtomicType::TYPE_VOID:
852  FATAL("can't get constant value for void type");
853  return NULL;
854  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
855  if (isUniform)
856  return (value != 0.) ? LLVMTrue : LLVMFalse;
857  else
858  return LLVMBoolVector(value != 0.);
859  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: {
860  int i = (int)value;
861  Assert((double)i == value);
862  return isUniform ? LLVMInt8(i) : LLVMInt8Vector(i);
863  }
864  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: {
865  unsigned int i = (unsigned int)value;
866  return isUniform ? LLVMUInt8(i) : LLVMUInt8Vector(i);
867  }
868  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: {
869  int i = (int)value;
870  Assert((double)i == value);
871  return isUniform ? LLVMInt16(i) : LLVMInt16Vector(i);
872  }
873  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: {
874  unsigned int i = (unsigned int)value;
875  return isUniform ? LLVMUInt16(i) : LLVMUInt16Vector(i);
876  }
877  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: {
878  int i = (int)value;
879  Assert((double)i == value);
880  return isUniform ? LLVMInt32(i) : LLVMInt32Vector(i);
881  }
882  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: {
883  unsigned int i = (unsigned int)value;
884  return isUniform ? LLVMUInt32(i) : LLVMUInt32Vector(i);
885  }
886  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
887  return isUniform ? LLVMFloat((float)value) :
888  LLVMFloatVector((float)value);
889  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: {
890  uint64_t i = (uint64_t)value;
891  Assert(value == (int64_t)i);
892  return isUniform ? LLVMUInt64(i) : LLVMUInt64Vector(i);
893  }
894  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: {
895  int64_t i = (int64_t)value;
896  Assert((double)i == value);
897  return isUniform ? LLVMInt64(i) : LLVMInt64Vector(i);
898  }
899  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
900  return isUniform ? LLVMDouble(value) : LLVMDoubleVector(value);
901  default:
902  FATAL("logic error in lLLVMConstantValue");
903  return NULL;
904  }
905  }
906  else if (pointerType != NULL) {
907  Assert(value == 0);
908  if (pointerType->IsUniformType())
909  return llvm::Constant::getNullValue(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType);
910  else
911  return llvm::Constant::getNullValue(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerVectorType);
912  }
913  else {
914  // For vector types, first get the LLVM constant for the basetype with
915  // a recursive call to lLLVMConstantValue().
916  const Type *baseType = vectorType->GetBaseType();
917  llvm::Constant *constElement = lLLVMConstantValue(baseType, ctx, value);
918  llvm::Type *llvmVectorType = vectorType->LLVMType(ctx);
919 
920  // Now create a constant version of the corresponding LLVM type that we
921  // use to represent the VectorType.
922  // FIXME: this is a little ugly in that the fact that ispc represents
923  // uniform VectorTypes as LLVM VectorTypes and varying VectorTypes as
924  // LLVM ArrayTypes leaks into the code here; it feels like this detail
925  // should be better encapsulated?
926  if (baseType->IsUniformType()) {
927  llvm::VectorType *lvt =
928  llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::VectorType>(llvmVectorType);
929  Assert(lvt != NULL);
930  std::vector<llvm::Constant *> vals;
931  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < lvt->getNumElements(); ++i)
932  vals.push_back(constElement);
933  return llvm::ConstantVector::get(vals);
934  }
935  else {
936  llvm::ArrayType *lat =
937  llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ArrayType>(llvmVectorType);
938  Assert(lat != NULL);
939  std::vector<llvm::Constant *> vals;
940  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < lat->getNumElements(); ++i)
941  vals.push_back(constElement);
942  return llvm::ConstantArray::get(lat, vals);
943  }
944  }
945 }
946 
947 
948 static llvm::Value *
949 lMaskForSymbol(Symbol *baseSym, FunctionEmitContext *ctx) {
950  if (baseSym == NULL)
951  return ctx->GetFullMask();
952 
953  if (CastType<PointerType>(baseSym->type) != NULL ||
954  CastType<ReferenceType>(baseSym->type) != NULL)
955  // FIXME: for pointers, we really only want to do this for
956  // dereferencing the pointer, not for things like pointer
957  // arithmetic, when we may be able to use the internal mask,
958  // depending on context...
959  return ctx->GetFullMask();
960 
961  llvm::Value *mask = (baseSym->parentFunction == ctx->GetFunction() &&
962  baseSym->storageClass != SC_STATIC) ?
963  ctx->GetInternalMask() : ctx->GetFullMask();
964  return mask;
965 }
966 
967 
968 /** Store the result of an assignment to the given location.
969  */
970 static void
971 lStoreAssignResult(llvm::Value *value, llvm::Value *ptr, const Type *valueType,
972  const Type *ptrType, FunctionEmitContext *ctx,
973  Symbol *baseSym) {
974  Assert(baseSym == NULL ||
975  baseSym->varyingCFDepth <= ctx->VaryingCFDepth());
976  if (!g->opt.disableMaskedStoreToStore &&
977  !g->opt.disableMaskAllOnOptimizations &&
978  baseSym != NULL &&
979  baseSym->varyingCFDepth == ctx->VaryingCFDepth() &&
980  baseSym->storageClass != SC_STATIC &&
981  CastType<ReferenceType>(baseSym->type) == NULL &&
982  CastType<PointerType>(baseSym->type) == NULL) {
983  // If the variable is declared at the same varying control flow
984  // depth as where it's being assigned, then we don't need to do any
985  // masking but can just do the assignment as if all the lanes were
986  // known to be on. While this may lead to random/garbage values
987  // written into the lanes that are off, by definition they will
988  // never be accessed, since those lanes aren't executing, and won't
989  // be executing at this scope or any other one before the variable
990  // goes out of scope.
991  ctx->StoreInst(value, ptr, LLVMMaskAllOn, valueType, ptrType);
992  }
993  else {
994  ctx->StoreInst(value, ptr, lMaskForSymbol(baseSym, ctx), valueType, ptrType);
995  }
996 }
997 
998 
999 /** Utility routine to emit code to do a {pre,post}-{inc,dec}rement of the
1000  given expresion.
1001  */
1002 static llvm::Value *
1003 lEmitPrePostIncDec(UnaryExpr::Op op, Expr *expr, SourcePos pos,
1004  FunctionEmitContext *ctx) {
1005  const Type *type = expr->GetType();
1006  if (type == NULL)
1007  return NULL;
1008 
1009  // Get both the lvalue and the rvalue of the given expression
1010  llvm::Value *lvalue = NULL, *rvalue = NULL;
1011  const Type *lvalueType = NULL;
1012  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(type) != NULL) {
1013  lvalueType = type;
1014  type = type->GetReferenceTarget();
1015  lvalue = expr->GetValue(ctx);
1016 
1017  Expr *deref = new RefDerefExpr(expr, expr->pos);
1018  rvalue = deref->GetValue(ctx);
1019  }
1020  else {
1021  lvalue = expr->GetLValue(ctx);
1022  lvalueType = expr->GetLValueType();
1023  rvalue = expr->GetValue(ctx);
1024  }
1025 
1026  if (lvalue == NULL) {
1027  // If we can't get a lvalue, then we have an error here
1028  const char *prepost = (op == UnaryExpr::PreInc ||
1029  op == UnaryExpr::PreDec) ? "pre" : "post";
1030  const char *incdec = (op == UnaryExpr::PreInc ||
1031  op == UnaryExpr::PostInc) ? "increment" : "decrement";
1032  Error(pos, "Can't %s-%s non-lvalues.", prepost, incdec);
1033  return NULL;
1034  }
1035 
1036  // Emit code to do the appropriate addition/subtraction to the
1037  // expression's old value
1038  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
1039  llvm::Value *binop = NULL;
1040  int delta = (op == UnaryExpr::PreInc || op == UnaryExpr::PostInc) ? 1 : -1;
1041 
1042  std::string opName = rvalue->getName().str();
1043  if (op == UnaryExpr::PreInc || op == UnaryExpr::PostInc)
1044  opName += "_plus1";
1045  else
1046  opName += "_minus1";
1047 
1048  if (CastType<PointerType>(type) != NULL) {
1049  const Type *incType = type->IsUniformType() ? AtomicType::UniformInt32 :
1050  AtomicType::VaryingInt32;
1051  llvm::Constant *dval = lLLVMConstantValue(incType, g->ctx, delta);
1052  binop = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(rvalue, dval, type, opName.c_str());
1053  }
1054  else {
1055  llvm::Constant *dval = lLLVMConstantValue(type, g->ctx, delta);
1056  if (type->IsFloatType())
1057  binop = ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::FAdd, rvalue,
1058  dval, opName.c_str());
1059  else
1060  binop = ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Add, rvalue,
1061  dval, opName.c_str());
1062  }
1063 
1064  // And store the result out to the lvalue
1065  Symbol *baseSym = expr->GetBaseSymbol();
1066  lStoreAssignResult(binop, lvalue, type, lvalueType, ctx, baseSym);
1067 
1068  // And then if it's a pre increment/decrement, return the final
1069  // computed result; otherwise return the previously-grabbed expression
1070  // value.
1071  return (op == UnaryExpr::PreInc || op == UnaryExpr::PreDec) ? binop : rvalue;
1072 }
1073 
1074 
1075 
1076 /** Utility routine to emit code to negate the given expression.
1077  */
1078 static llvm::Value *
1079 lEmitNegate(Expr *arg, SourcePos pos, FunctionEmitContext *ctx) {
1080  const Type *type = arg->GetType();
1081  llvm::Value *argVal = arg->GetValue(ctx);
1082  if (type == NULL || argVal == NULL)
1083  return NULL;
1084 
1085  // Negate by subtracting from zero...
1086  llvm::Value *zero = lLLVMConstantValue(type, g->ctx, 0.);
1087  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
1088  if (type->IsFloatType())
1089  return ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::FSub, zero, argVal,
1090  LLVMGetName(argVal, "_negate"));
1091  else {
1092  AssertPos(pos, type->IsIntType());
1093  return ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Sub, zero, argVal,
1094  LLVMGetName(argVal, "_negate"));
1095  }
1096 }
1097 
1098 
1099 UnaryExpr::UnaryExpr(Op o, Expr *e, SourcePos p)
1100  : Expr(p), op(o) {
1101  expr = e;
1102 }
1103 
1104 
1105 llvm::Value *
1106 UnaryExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
1107  if (expr == NULL)
1108  return NULL;
1109 
1110  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
1111 
1112  switch (op) {
1113  case PreInc:
1114  case PreDec:
1115  case PostInc:
1116  case PostDec:
1117  return lEmitPrePostIncDec(op, expr, pos, ctx);
1118  case Negate:
1119  return lEmitNegate(expr, pos, ctx);
1120  case LogicalNot: {
1121  llvm::Value *argVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
1122  return ctx->NotOperator(argVal, LLVMGetName(argVal, "_logicalnot"));
1123  }
1124  case BitNot: {
1125  llvm::Value *argVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
1126  return ctx->NotOperator(argVal, LLVMGetName(argVal, "_bitnot"));
1127  }
1128  default:
1129  FATAL("logic error");
1130  return NULL;
1131  }
1132 }
1133 
1134 
1135 const Type *
1136 UnaryExpr::GetType() const {
1137  if (expr == NULL)
1138  return NULL;
1139 
1140  const Type *type = expr->GetType();
1141  if (type == NULL)
1142  return NULL;
1143 
1144  // For all unary expressions besides logical not, the returned type is
1145  // the same as the source type. Logical not always returns a bool
1146  // type, with the same shape as the input type.
1147  switch (op) {
1148  case PreInc:
1149  case PreDec:
1150  case PostInc:
1151  case PostDec:
1152  case Negate:
1153  case BitNot:
1154  return type;
1155  case LogicalNot:
1156  return lMatchingBoolType(type);
1157  default:
1158  FATAL("error");
1159  return NULL;
1160  }
1161 }
1162 
1163 
1164 template <typename T> static Expr *
1165 lOptimizeBitNot(ConstExpr *constExpr, const Type *type, SourcePos pos) {
1166  T v[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
1167  int count = constExpr->GetValues(v);
1168  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
1169  v[i] = ~v[i];
1170  return new ConstExpr(type, v, pos);
1171 }
1172 
1173 
1174 Expr *
1175 UnaryExpr::Optimize() {
1176  ConstExpr *constExpr = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr);
1177  // If the operand isn't a constant, then we can't do any optimization
1178  // here...
1179  if (constExpr == NULL)
1180  return this;
1181 
1182  const Type *type = constExpr->GetType();
1183  bool isEnumType = CastType<EnumType>(type) != NULL;
1184 
1185  switch (op) {
1186  case PreInc:
1187  case PreDec:
1188  case PostInc:
1189  case PostDec:
1190  // this shouldn't happen--it's illegal to modify a contant value..
1191  // An error will be issued elsewhere...
1192  return this;
1193  case Negate: {
1194  if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::UniformInt64) ||
1195  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt64)) {
1196  int64_t v[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
1197  int count = constExpr->GetValues(v);
1198  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
1199  v[i] = -v[i];
1200  return new ConstExpr(type, v, pos);
1201  }
1202  else if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt64) ||
1203  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt64)) {
1204  uint64_t v[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
1205  int count = constExpr->GetValues(v);
1206  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
1207  v[i] = -v[i];
1208  return new ConstExpr(type, v, pos);
1209  }
1210  else {
1211  // For all the other types, it's safe to stuff whatever we have
1212  // into a double, do the negate as a double, and then return a
1213  // ConstExpr with the same type as the original...
1214  double v[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
1215  int count = constExpr->GetValues(v);
1216  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
1217  v[i] = -v[i];
1218  return new ConstExpr(constExpr, v);
1219  }
1220  }
1221  case BitNot: {
1222  if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::UniformInt8) ||
1223  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt8)) {
1224  return lOptimizeBitNot<int8_t>(constExpr, type, pos);
1225  }
1226  else if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt8) ||
1227  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt8)) {
1228  return lOptimizeBitNot<uint8_t>(constExpr, type, pos);
1229  }
1230  else if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::UniformInt16) ||
1231  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt16)) {
1232  return lOptimizeBitNot<int16_t>(constExpr, type, pos);
1233  }
1234  else if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt16) ||
1235  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt16)) {
1236  return lOptimizeBitNot<uint16_t>(constExpr, type, pos);
1237  }
1238  else if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::UniformInt32) ||
1239  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt32)) {
1240  return lOptimizeBitNot<int32_t>(constExpr, type, pos);
1241  }
1242  else if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt32) ||
1243  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt32) ||
1244  isEnumType == true) {
1245  return lOptimizeBitNot<uint32_t>(constExpr, type, pos);
1246  }
1247  else if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::UniformInt64) ||
1248  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt64)) {
1249  return lOptimizeBitNot<int64_t>(constExpr, type, pos);
1250  }
1251  else if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt64) ||
1252  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt64) ||
1253  isEnumType == true) {
1254  return lOptimizeBitNot<uint64_t>(constExpr, type, pos);
1255  }
1256  else
1257  FATAL("unexpected type in UnaryExpr::Optimize() / BitNot case");
1258  }
1259  case LogicalNot: {
1260  AssertPos(pos, Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::UniformBool) ||
1261  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::VaryingBool));
1262  bool v[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
1263  int count = constExpr->GetValues(v);
1264  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
1265  v[i] = !v[i];
1266  return new ConstExpr(type, v, pos);
1267  }
1268  default:
1269  FATAL("unexpected op in UnaryExpr::Optimize()");
1270  return NULL;
1271  }
1272 }
1273 
1274 
1275 Expr *
1276 UnaryExpr::TypeCheck() {
1277  const Type *type;
1278  if (expr == NULL || (type = expr->GetType()) == NULL)
1279  // something went wrong in type checking...
1280  return NULL;
1281 
1282  if (type->IsSOAType()) {
1283  Error(pos, "Can't apply unary operator to SOA type \"%s\".",
1284  type->GetString().c_str());
1285  return NULL;
1286  }
1287 
1288  if (op == PreInc || op == PreDec || op == PostInc || op == PostDec) {
1289  if (type->IsConstType()) {
1290  Error(pos, "Can't assign to type \"%s\" on left-hand side of "
1291  "expression.", type->GetString().c_str());
1292  return NULL;
1293  }
1294 
1295  if (type->IsNumericType())
1296  return this;
1297 
1298  const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(type);
1299  if (pt == NULL) {
1300  Error(expr->pos, "Can only pre/post increment numeric and "
1301  "pointer types, not \"%s\".", type->GetString().c_str());
1302  return NULL;
1303  }
1304 
1305  if (PointerType::IsVoidPointer(type)) {
1306  Error(expr->pos, "Illegal to pre/post increment \"%s\" type.",
1307  type->GetString().c_str());
1308  return NULL;
1309  }
1310  if (CastType<UndefinedStructType>(pt->GetBaseType())) {
1311  Error(expr->pos, "Illegal to pre/post increment pointer to "
1312  "undefined struct type \"%s\".", type->GetString().c_str());
1313  return NULL;
1314  }
1315 
1316  return this;
1317  }
1318 
1319  // don't do this for pre/post increment/decrement
1320  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(type)) {
1321  expr = new RefDerefExpr(expr, pos);
1322  type = expr->GetType();
1323  }
1324 
1325  if (op == Negate) {
1326  if (!type->IsNumericType()) {
1327  Error(expr->pos, "Negate not allowed for non-numeric type \"%s\".",
1328  type->GetString().c_str());
1329  return NULL;
1330  }
1331  }
1332  else if (op == LogicalNot) {
1333  const Type *boolType = lMatchingBoolType(type);
1334  expr = TypeConvertExpr(expr, boolType, "logical not");
1335  if (expr == NULL)
1336  return NULL;
1337  }
1338  else if (op == BitNot) {
1339  if (!type->IsIntType()) {
1340  Error(expr->pos, "~ operator can only be used with integer types, "
1341  "not \"%s\".", type->GetString().c_str());
1342  return NULL;
1343  }
1344  }
1345  return this;
1346 }
1347 
1348 
1349 int
1350 UnaryExpr::EstimateCost() const {
1351  if (dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr) != NULL)
1352  return 0;
1353 
1354  return COST_SIMPLE_ARITH_LOGIC_OP;
1355 }
1356 
1357 
1358 void
1359 UnaryExpr::Print() const {
1360  if (!expr || !GetType())
1361  return;
1362 
1363  printf("[ %s ] (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
1364  if (op == PreInc) printf("++");
1365  if (op == PreDec) printf("--");
1366  if (op == Negate) printf("-");
1367  if (op == LogicalNot) printf("!");
1368  if (op == BitNot) printf("~");
1369  printf("(");
1370  expr->Print();
1371  printf(")");
1372  if (op == PostInc) printf("++");
1373  if (op == PostDec) printf("--");
1374  printf(")");
1375  pos.Print();
1376 }
1377 
1378 
1379 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1380 // BinaryExpr
1381 
1382 static const char *
1383 lOpString(BinaryExpr::Op op) {
1384  switch (op) {
1385  case BinaryExpr::Add: return "+";
1386  case BinaryExpr::Sub: return "-";
1387  case BinaryExpr::Mul: return "*";
1388  case BinaryExpr::Div: return "/";
1389  case BinaryExpr::Mod: return "%";
1390  case BinaryExpr::Shl: return "<<";
1391  case BinaryExpr::Shr: return ">>";
1392  case BinaryExpr::Lt: return "<";
1393  case BinaryExpr::Gt: return ">";
1394  case BinaryExpr::Le: return "<=";
1395  case BinaryExpr::Ge: return ">=";
1396  case BinaryExpr::Equal: return "==";
1397  case BinaryExpr::NotEqual: return "!=";
1398  case BinaryExpr::BitAnd: return "&";
1399  case BinaryExpr::BitXor: return "^";
1400  case BinaryExpr::BitOr: return "|";
1401  case BinaryExpr::LogicalAnd: return "&&";
1402  case BinaryExpr::LogicalOr: return "||";
1403  case BinaryExpr::Comma: return ",";
1404  default:
1405  FATAL("unimplemented case in lOpString()");
1406  return "";
1407  }
1408 }
1409 
1410 
1411 /** Utility routine to emit the binary bitwise operator corresponding to
1412  the given BinaryExpr::Op.
1413 */
1414 static llvm::Value *
1415 lEmitBinaryBitOp(BinaryExpr::Op op, llvm::Value *arg0Val,
1416  llvm::Value *arg1Val, bool isUnsigned,
1417  FunctionEmitContext *ctx) {
1418  llvm::Instruction::BinaryOps inst;
1419  switch (op) {
1420  case BinaryExpr::Shl: inst = llvm::Instruction::Shl; break;
1421  case BinaryExpr::Shr:
1422  if (isUnsigned)
1423  inst = llvm::Instruction::LShr;
1424  else
1425  inst = llvm::Instruction::AShr;
1426  break;
1427  case BinaryExpr::BitAnd: inst = llvm::Instruction::And; break;
1428  case BinaryExpr::BitXor: inst = llvm::Instruction::Xor; break;
1429  case BinaryExpr::BitOr: inst = llvm::Instruction::Or; break;
1430  default:
1431  FATAL("logic error in lEmitBinaryBitOp()");
1432  return NULL;
1433  }
1434 
1435  return ctx->BinaryOperator(inst, arg0Val, arg1Val, "bitop");
1436 }
1437 
1438 
1439 static llvm::Value *
1440 lEmitBinaryPointerArith(BinaryExpr::Op op, llvm::Value *value0,
1441  llvm::Value *value1, const Type *type0,
1442  const Type *type1, FunctionEmitContext *ctx,
1443  SourcePos pos) {
1444  const PointerType *ptrType = CastType<PointerType>(type0);
1445 
1446  switch (op) {
1447  case BinaryExpr::Add:
1448  // ptr + integer
1449  return ctx->GetElementPtrInst(value0, value1, ptrType, "ptrmath");
1450  break;
1451  case BinaryExpr::Sub: {
1452  if (CastType<PointerType>(type1) != NULL) {
1453  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(type0, type1));
1454 
1455  if (ptrType->IsSlice()) {
1456  llvm::Value *p0 = ctx->ExtractInst(value0, 0);
1457  llvm::Value *p1 = ctx->ExtractInst(value1, 0);
1458  const Type *majorType = ptrType->GetAsNonSlice();
1459  llvm::Value *majorDelta =
1460  lEmitBinaryPointerArith(op, p0, p1, majorType, majorType,
1461  ctx, pos);
1462 
1463  int soaWidth = ptrType->GetBaseType()->GetSOAWidth();
1464  AssertPos(pos, soaWidth > 0);
1465  llvm::Value *soaScale = LLVMIntAsType(soaWidth,
1466  majorDelta->getType());
1467 
1468  llvm::Value *majorScale =
1469  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Mul, majorDelta,
1470  soaScale, "major_soa_scaled");
1471 
1472  llvm::Value *m0 = ctx->ExtractInst(value0, 1);
1473  llvm::Value *m1 = ctx->ExtractInst(value1, 1);
1474  llvm::Value *minorDelta =
1475  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Sub, m0, m1,
1476  "minor_soa_delta");
1477 
1478  ctx->MatchIntegerTypes(&majorScale, &minorDelta);
1479  return ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Add, majorScale,
1480  minorDelta, "soa_ptrdiff");
1481  }
1482 
1483  // ptr - ptr
1484  if (ptrType->IsUniformType()) {
1485  value0 = ctx->PtrToIntInst(value0);
1486  value1 = ctx->PtrToIntInst(value1);
1487  }
1488 
1489  // Compute the difference in bytes
1490  llvm::Value *delta =
1491  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Sub, value0, value1,
1492  "ptr_diff");
1493 
1494  // Now divide by the size of the type that the pointer
1495  // points to in order to return the difference in elements.
1496  llvm::Type *llvmElementType =
1497  ptrType->GetBaseType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
1498  llvm::Value *size = g->target->SizeOf(llvmElementType,
1499  ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
1500  if (ptrType->IsVaryingType())
1501  size = ctx->SmearUniform(size);
1502 
1503  if (g->target->is32Bit() == false &&
1504  g->opt.force32BitAddressing == true) {
1505  // If we're doing 32-bit addressing math on a 64-bit
1506  // target, then trunc the delta down to a 32-bit value.
1507  // (Thus also matching what will be a 32-bit value
1508  // returned from SizeOf above.)
1509  if (ptrType->IsUniformType())
1510  delta = ctx->TruncInst(delta, LLVMTypes::Int32Type,
1511  "trunc_ptr_delta");
1512  else
1513  delta = ctx->TruncInst(delta, LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType,
1514  "trunc_ptr_delta");
1515  }
1516 
1517  // And now do the actual division
1518  return ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::SDiv, delta, size,
1519  "element_diff");
1520  }
1521  else {
1522  // ptr - integer
1523  llvm::Value *zero = lLLVMConstantValue(type1, g->ctx, 0.);
1524  llvm::Value *negOffset =
1525  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Sub, zero, value1,
1526  "negate");
1527  // Do a GEP as ptr + -integer
1528  return ctx->GetElementPtrInst(value0, negOffset, ptrType,
1529  "ptrmath");
1530  }
1531  }
1532  default:
1533  FATAL("Logic error in lEmitBinaryArith() for pointer type case");
1534  return NULL;
1535  }
1536 
1537 }
1538 
1539 /** Utility routine to emit binary arithmetic operator based on the given
1540  BinaryExpr::Op.
1541 */
1542 static llvm::Value *
1543 lEmitBinaryArith(BinaryExpr::Op op, llvm::Value *value0, llvm::Value *value1,
1544  const Type *type0, const Type *type1,
1545  FunctionEmitContext *ctx, SourcePos pos) {
1546  const PointerType *ptrType = CastType<PointerType>(type0);
1547 
1548  if (ptrType != NULL)
1549  return lEmitBinaryPointerArith(op, value0, value1, type0, type1,
1550  ctx, pos);
1551  else {
1552  AssertPos(pos, Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type0, type1));
1553 
1554  llvm::Instruction::BinaryOps inst;
1555  bool isFloatOp = type0->IsFloatType();
1556  bool isUnsignedOp = type0->IsUnsignedType();
1557 
1558  const char *opName = NULL;
1559  switch (op) {
1560  case BinaryExpr::Add:
1561  opName = "add";
1562  inst = isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FAdd : llvm::Instruction::Add;
1563  break;
1564  case BinaryExpr::Sub:
1565  opName = "sub";
1566  inst = isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FSub : llvm::Instruction::Sub;
1567  break;
1568  case BinaryExpr::Mul:
1569  opName = "mul";
1570  inst = isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FMul : llvm::Instruction::Mul;
1571  break;
1572  case BinaryExpr::Div:
1573  opName = "div";
1574  if (type0->IsVaryingType() && !isFloatOp)
1575  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Division with varying integer types is "
1576  "very inefficient.");
1577  inst = isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FDiv :
1578  (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::Instruction::UDiv : llvm::Instruction::SDiv);
1579  break;
1580  case BinaryExpr::Mod:
1581  opName = "mod";
1582  if (type0->IsVaryingType() && !isFloatOp)
1583  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Modulus operator with varying types is "
1584  "very inefficient.");
1585  inst = isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FRem :
1586  (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::Instruction::URem : llvm::Instruction::SRem);
1587  break;
1588  default:
1589  FATAL("Invalid op type passed to lEmitBinaryArith()");
1590  return NULL;
1591  }
1592 
1593  return ctx->BinaryOperator(inst, value0, value1, LLVMGetName(opName, value0, value1));
1594  }
1595 }
1596 
1597 
1598 /** Utility routine to emit a binary comparison operator based on the given
1599  BinaryExpr::Op.
1600  */
1601 static llvm::Value *
1602 lEmitBinaryCmp(BinaryExpr::Op op, llvm::Value *e0Val, llvm::Value *e1Val,
1603  const Type *type, FunctionEmitContext *ctx, SourcePos pos) {
1604  bool isFloatOp = type->IsFloatType();
1605  bool isUnsignedOp = type->IsUnsignedType();
1606 
1607  llvm::CmpInst::Predicate pred;
1608  const char *opName = NULL;
1609  switch (op) {
1610  case BinaryExpr::Lt:
1611  opName = "less";
1612  pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_ULT :
1613  (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_ULT : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_SLT);
1614  break;
1615  case BinaryExpr::Gt:
1616  opName = "greater";
1617  pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_UGT :
1618  (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_UGT : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_SGT);
1619  break;
1620  case BinaryExpr::Le:
1621  opName = "lessequal";
1622  pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_ULE :
1623  (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_ULE : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_SLE);
1624  break;
1625  case BinaryExpr::Ge:
1626  opName = "greaterequal";
1627  pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_UGE :
1628  (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_UGE : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_SGE);
1629  break;
1630  case BinaryExpr::Equal:
1631  opName = "equal";
1632  pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_UEQ : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_EQ;
1633  break;
1634  case BinaryExpr::NotEqual:
1635  opName = "notequal";
1636  pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_UNE : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE;
1637  break;
1638  default:
1639  FATAL("error in lEmitBinaryCmp()");
1640  return NULL;
1641  }
1642 
1643  llvm::Value *cmp = ctx->CmpInst(isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FCmp :
1644  llvm::Instruction::ICmp,
1645  pred, e0Val, e1Val,
1646  LLVMGetName(opName, e0Val, e1Val));
1647  // This is a little ugly: CmpInst returns i1 values, but we use vectors
1648  // of i32s for varying bool values; type convert the result here if
1649  // needed.
1650  if (type->IsVaryingType())
1651  cmp = ctx->I1VecToBoolVec(cmp);
1652 
1653  return cmp;
1654 }
1655 
1656 
1657 BinaryExpr::BinaryExpr(Op o, Expr *a, Expr *b, SourcePos p)
1658  : Expr(p), op(o) {
1659  arg0 = a;
1660  arg1 = b;
1661 }
1662 
1663 Expr *lCreateBinaryOperatorCall(const BinaryExpr::Op bop,
1664  Expr *a0, Expr *a1,
1665  const SourcePos &sp)
1666 {
1667  if ((a0 == NULL) || (a1 == NULL)) {
1668  return NULL;
1669  }
1670  Expr *arg0 = a0->TypeCheck();
1671  Expr *arg1 = a1->TypeCheck();
1672  if ((arg0 == NULL) || (arg1 == NULL)) {
1673  return NULL;
1674  }
1675  const Type *type0 = arg0->GetType();
1676  const Type *type1 = arg1->GetType();
1677 
1678  // If either operand is a reference, dereference it before we move
1679  // forward
1680  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(type0) != NULL) {
1681  arg0 = new RefDerefExpr(arg0, arg0->pos);
1682  type0 = arg0->GetType();
1683  }
1684  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(type1) != NULL) {
1685  arg1 = new RefDerefExpr(arg1, arg1->pos);
1686  type1 = arg1->GetType();
1687  }
1688  if ((type0 == NULL) || (type1 == NULL)) {
1689  return NULL;
1690  }
1691  if (CastType<StructType>(type0) != NULL ||
1692  CastType<StructType>(type1) != NULL) {
1693  std::string opName = std::string("operator") + lOpString(bop);
1694  std::vector<Symbol *> funs;
1695  m->symbolTable->LookupFunction(opName.c_str(), &funs);
1696  if (funs.size() == 0) {
1697  Error(sp, "operator %s(%s, %s) is not defined.",
1698  opName.c_str(), (type0->GetString()).c_str(), (type1->GetString()).c_str());
1699  return NULL;
1700  }
1701  Expr *func = new FunctionSymbolExpr(opName.c_str(), funs, sp);
1702  ExprList *args = new ExprList(sp);
1703  args->exprs.push_back(arg0);
1704  args->exprs.push_back(arg1);
1705  Expr *opCallExpr = new FunctionCallExpr(func, args, sp);
1706  return opCallExpr;
1707  }
1708  return NULL;
1709 }
1710 
1711 
1712 Expr * MakeBinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Op o, Expr *a, Expr *b, SourcePos p) {
1713  Expr * op = lCreateBinaryOperatorCall(o, a, b, p);
1714  if (op != NULL) {
1715  return op;
1716  }
1717  op = new BinaryExpr(o, a, b, p);
1718  return op;
1719 }
1720 
1721 
1722 /** Emit code for a && or || logical operator. In particular, the code
1723  here handles "short-circuit" evaluation, where the second expression
1724  isn't evaluated if the value of the first one determines the value of
1725  the result.
1726 */
1727 llvm::Value *
1728 lEmitLogicalOp(BinaryExpr::Op op, Expr *arg0, Expr *arg1,
1729  FunctionEmitContext *ctx, SourcePos pos) {
1730 
1731  const Type *type0 = arg0->GetType(), *type1 = arg1->GetType();
1732  if (type0 == NULL || type1 == NULL) {
1733  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
1734  return NULL;
1735  }
1736 
1737  // There is overhead (branches, etc.), to short-circuiting, so if the
1738  // right side of the expression is a) relatively simple, and b) can be
1739  // safely executed with an all-off execution mask, then we just
1740  // evaluate both sides and then the logical operator in that case.
1741  // FIXME: not sure what we should do about vector types here...
1742  bool shortCircuit = (EstimateCost(arg1) > PREDICATE_SAFE_IF_STATEMENT_COST ||
1743  SafeToRunWithMaskAllOff(arg1) == false ||
1744  CastType<VectorType>(type0) != NULL ||
1745  CastType<VectorType>(type1) != NULL);
1746  if (shortCircuit == false) {
1747  // If one of the operands is uniform but the other is varying,
1748  // promote the uniform one to varying
1749  if (type0->IsUniformType() && type1->IsVaryingType()) {
1750  arg0 = TypeConvertExpr(arg0, AtomicType::VaryingBool, lOpString(op));
1751  AssertPos(pos, arg0 != NULL);
1752  }
1753  if (type1->IsUniformType() && type0->IsVaryingType()) {
1754  arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, AtomicType::VaryingBool, lOpString(op));
1755  AssertPos(pos, arg1 != NULL);
1756  }
1757 
1758  llvm::Value *value0 = arg0->GetValue(ctx);
1759  llvm::Value *value1 = arg1->GetValue(ctx);
1760  if (value0 == NULL || value1 == NULL) {
1761  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
1762  return NULL;
1763  }
1764 
1765  if (op == BinaryExpr::LogicalAnd)
1766  return ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, value0, value1,
1767  "logical_and");
1768  else {
1769  AssertPos(pos, op == BinaryExpr::LogicalOr);
1770  return ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Or, value0, value1,
1771  "logical_or");
1772  }
1773  }
1774 
1775  // Allocate temporary storage for the return value
1776  const Type *retType = Type::MoreGeneralType(type0, type1, pos, lOpString(op));
1777  llvm::Type *llvmRetType = retType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
1778  llvm::Value *retPtr = ctx->AllocaInst(llvmRetType, "logical_op_mem");
1779 
1780  llvm::BasicBlock *bbSkipEvalValue1 = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("skip_eval_1");
1781  llvm::BasicBlock *bbEvalValue1 = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("eval_1");
1782  llvm::BasicBlock *bbLogicalDone = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("logical_op_done");
1783 
1784  // Evaluate the first operand
1785  llvm::Value *value0 = arg0->GetValue(ctx);
1786  if (value0 == NULL) {
1787  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
1788  return NULL;
1789  }
1790 
1791  if (type0->IsUniformType()) {
1792  // Check to see if the value of the first operand is true or false
1793  llvm::Value *value0True =
1794  ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_EQ,
1795  value0, LLVMTrue);
1796 
1797  if (op == BinaryExpr::LogicalOr) {
1798  // For ||, if value0 is true, then we skip evaluating value1
1799  // entirely.
1800  ctx->BranchInst(bbSkipEvalValue1, bbEvalValue1, value0True);
1801 
1802  // If value0 is true, the complete result is true (either
1803  // uniform or varying)
1804  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbSkipEvalValue1);
1805  llvm::Value *trueValue = retType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTrue :
1806  LLVMMaskAllOn;
1807  ctx->StoreInst(trueValue, retPtr);
1808  ctx->BranchInst(bbLogicalDone);
1809  }
1810  else {
1811  AssertPos(pos, op == BinaryExpr::LogicalAnd);
1812 
1813  // Conversely, for &&, if value0 is false, we skip evaluating
1814  // value1.
1815  ctx->BranchInst(bbEvalValue1, bbSkipEvalValue1, value0True);
1816 
1817  // In this case, the complete result is false (again, either a
1818  // uniform or varying false).
1819  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbSkipEvalValue1);
1820  llvm::Value *falseValue = retType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMFalse :
1821  LLVMMaskAllOff;
1822  ctx->StoreInst(falseValue, retPtr);
1823  ctx->BranchInst(bbLogicalDone);
1824  }
1825 
1826  // Both || and && are in the same situation if the first operand's
1827  // value didn't resolve the final result: they need to evaluate the
1828  // value of the second operand, which in turn gives the value for
1829  // the full expression.
1830  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbEvalValue1);
1831  if (type1->IsUniformType() && retType->IsVaryingType()) {
1832  arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, AtomicType::VaryingBool, "logical op");
1833  AssertPos(pos, arg1 != NULL);
1834  }
1835 
1836  llvm::Value *value1 = arg1->GetValue(ctx);
1837  if (value1 == NULL) {
1838  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
1839  return NULL;
1840  }
1841  ctx->StoreInst(value1, retPtr);
1842  ctx->BranchInst(bbLogicalDone);
1843 
1844  // In all cases, we end up at the bbLogicalDone basic block;
1845  // loading the value stored in retPtr in turn gives the overall
1846  // result.
1847  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbLogicalDone);
1848  return ctx->LoadInst(retPtr);
1849  }
1850  else {
1851  // Otherwise, the first operand is varying... Save the current
1852  // value of the mask so that we can restore it at the end.
1853  llvm::Value *oldMask = ctx->GetInternalMask();
1854  llvm::Value *oldFullMask = ctx->GetFullMask();
1855 
1856  // Convert the second operand to be varying as well, so that we can
1857  // perform logical vector ops with its value.
1858  if (type1->IsUniformType()) {
1859  arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, AtomicType::VaryingBool, "logical op");
1860  AssertPos(pos, arg1 != NULL);
1861  type1 = arg1->GetType();
1862  }
1863 
1864  if (op == BinaryExpr::LogicalOr) {
1865  // See if value0 is true for all currently executing
1866  // lanes--i.e. if (value0 & mask) == mask. If so, we don't
1867  // need to evaluate the second operand of the expression.
1868  llvm::Value *value0AndMask =
1869  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, value0,
1870  oldFullMask, "op&mask");
1871  llvm::Value *equalsMask =
1872  ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_EQ,
1873  value0AndMask, oldFullMask, "value0&mask==mask");
1874  equalsMask = ctx->I1VecToBoolVec(equalsMask);
1875  llvm::Value *allMatch = ctx->All(equalsMask);
1876  ctx->BranchInst(bbSkipEvalValue1, bbEvalValue1, allMatch);
1877 
1878  // value0 is true for all running lanes, so it can be used for
1879  // the final result
1880  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbSkipEvalValue1);
1881  ctx->StoreInst(value0, retPtr);
1882  ctx->BranchInst(bbLogicalDone);
1883 
1884  // Otherwise, we need to valuate arg1. However, first we need
1885  // to set the execution mask to be (oldMask & ~a); in other
1886  // words, only execute the instances where value0 is false.
1887  // For the instances where value0 was true, we need to inhibit
1888  // execution.
1889  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbEvalValue1);
1890  ctx->SetInternalMaskAndNot(oldMask, value0);
1891 
1892  llvm::Value *value1 = arg1->GetValue(ctx);
1893  if (value1 == NULL) {
1894  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
1895  return NULL;
1896  }
1897 
1898  // We need to compute the result carefully, since vector
1899  // elements that were computed when the corresponding lane was
1900  // disabled have undefined values:
1901  // result = (value0 & old_mask) | (value1 & current_mask)
1902  llvm::Value *value1AndMask =
1903  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, value1,
1904  ctx->GetInternalMask(), "op&mask");
1905  llvm::Value *result =
1906  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Or, value0AndMask,
1907  value1AndMask, "or_result");
1908  ctx->StoreInst(result, retPtr);
1909  ctx->BranchInst(bbLogicalDone);
1910  }
1911  else {
1912  AssertPos(pos, op == BinaryExpr::LogicalAnd);
1913 
1914  // If value0 is false for all currently running lanes, the
1915  // overall result must be false: this corresponds to checking
1916  // if (mask & ~value0) == mask.
1917  llvm::Value *notValue0 = ctx->NotOperator(value0, "not_value0");
1918  llvm::Value *notValue0AndMask =
1919  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, notValue0,
1920  oldFullMask, "not_value0&mask");
1921  llvm::Value *equalsMask =
1922  ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_EQ,
1923  notValue0AndMask, oldFullMask, "not_value0&mask==mask");
1924  equalsMask = ctx->I1VecToBoolVec(equalsMask);
1925  llvm::Value *allMatch = ctx->All(equalsMask);
1926  ctx->BranchInst(bbSkipEvalValue1, bbEvalValue1, allMatch);
1927 
1928  // value0 was false for all running lanes, so use its value as
1929  // the overall result.
1930  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbSkipEvalValue1);
1931  ctx->StoreInst(value0, retPtr);
1932  ctx->BranchInst(bbLogicalDone);
1933 
1934  // Otherwise we need to evaluate value1, but again with the
1935  // mask set to only be on for the lanes where value0 was true.
1936  // For the lanes where value0 was false, execution needs to be
1937  // disabled: mask = (mask & value0).
1938  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbEvalValue1);
1939  ctx->SetInternalMaskAnd(oldMask, value0);
1940 
1941  llvm::Value *value1 = arg1->GetValue(ctx);
1942  if (value1 == NULL) {
1943  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
1944  return NULL;
1945  }
1946 
1947  // And as in the || case, we compute the overall result by
1948  // masking off the valid lanes before we AND them together:
1949  // result = (value0 & old_mask) & (value1 & current_mask)
1950  llvm::Value *value0AndMask =
1951  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, value0,
1952  oldFullMask, "op&mask");
1953  llvm::Value *value1AndMask =
1954  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, value1,
1955  ctx->GetInternalMask(), "value1&mask");
1956  llvm::Value *result =
1957  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, value0AndMask,
1958  value1AndMask, "or_result");
1959  ctx->StoreInst(result, retPtr);
1960  ctx->BranchInst(bbLogicalDone);
1961  }
1962 
1963  // And finally we always end up in bbLogicalDone, where we restore
1964  // the old mask and return the computed result
1965  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbLogicalDone);
1966  ctx->SetInternalMask(oldMask);
1967  return ctx->LoadInst(retPtr);
1968  }
1969 }
1970 
1971 
1972 /* Returns true if shifting right by the given amount will lead to
1973  inefficient code. (Assumes x86 target. May also warn inaccurately if
1974  later optimization simplify the shift amount more than we are able to
1975  see at this point.) */
1976 static bool
1977 lIsDifficultShiftAmount(Expr *expr) {
1978  // Uniform shifts (of uniform values) are no problem.
1979  if (expr->GetType()->IsVaryingType() == false)
1980  return false;
1981 
1982  ConstExpr *ce = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr);
1983  if (ce) {
1984  // If the shift is by a constant amount, *and* it's the same amount
1985  // in all vector lanes, we're in good shape.
1986  uint32_t amount[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
1987  int count = ce->GetValues(amount);
1988  for (int i = 1; i < count; ++i)
1989  if (amount[i] != amount[0])
1990  return true;
1991  return false;
1992  }
1993 
1994  TypeCastExpr *tce = dynamic_cast<TypeCastExpr *>(expr);
1995  if (tce && tce->expr) {
1996  // Finally, if the shift amount is given by a uniform value that's
1997  // been smeared out into a varying, we have the same shift for all
1998  // lanes and are also in good shape.
1999  return (tce->expr->GetType()->IsUniformType() == false);
2000  }
2001 
2002  return true;
2003 }
2004 
2005 
2006 llvm::Value *
2007 BinaryExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
2008  if (!arg0 || !arg1) {
2009  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
2010  return NULL;
2011  }
2012 
2013  // Handle these specially, since we want to short-circuit their evaluation...
2014  if (op == LogicalAnd || op == LogicalOr)
2015  return lEmitLogicalOp(op, arg0, arg1, ctx, pos);
2016 
2017  llvm::Value *value0 = arg0->GetValue(ctx);
2018  llvm::Value *value1 = arg1->GetValue(ctx);
2019  if (value0 == NULL || value1 == NULL) {
2020  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
2021  return NULL;
2022  }
2023 
2024  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
2025 
2026  switch (op) {
2027  case Add:
2028  case Sub:
2029  case Mul:
2030  case Div:
2031  case Mod:
2032  return lEmitBinaryArith(op, value0, value1, arg0->GetType(), arg1->GetType(),
2033  ctx, pos);
2034  case Lt:
2035  case Gt:
2036  case Le:
2037  case Ge:
2038  case Equal:
2039  case NotEqual:
2040  return lEmitBinaryCmp(op, value0, value1, arg0->GetType(), ctx, pos);
2041  case Shl:
2042  case Shr:
2043  case BitAnd:
2044  case BitXor:
2045  case BitOr: {
2046  if (op == Shr && lIsDifficultShiftAmount(arg1))
2047  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Shift right is inefficient for "
2048  "varying shift amounts.");
2049  return lEmitBinaryBitOp(op, value0, value1,
2050  arg0->GetType()->IsUnsignedType(), ctx);
2051  }
2052  case Comma:
2053  return value1;
2054  default:
2055  FATAL("logic error");
2056  return NULL;
2057  }
2058 }
2059 
2060 
2061 const Type *
2062 BinaryExpr::GetType() const {
2063  if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
2064  return NULL;
2065 
2066  const Type *type0 = arg0->GetType(), *type1 = arg1->GetType();
2067  if (type0 == NULL || type1 == NULL)
2068  return NULL;
2069 
2070  // If this hits, it means that our TypeCheck() method hasn't been
2071  // called before GetType() was called; adding two pointers is illegal
2072  // and will fail type checking and (int + ptr) should be canonicalized
2073  // into (ptr + int) by type checking.
2074  if (op == Add)
2075  AssertPos(pos, CastType<PointerType>(type1) == NULL);
2076 
2077  if (op == Comma)
2078  return arg1->GetType();
2079 
2080  if (CastType<PointerType>(type0) != NULL) {
2081  if (op == Add)
2082  // ptr + int -> ptr
2083  return type0;
2084  else if (op == Sub) {
2085  if (CastType<PointerType>(type1) != NULL) {
2086  // ptr - ptr -> ~ptrdiff_t
2087  const Type *diffType = (g->target->is32Bit() ||
2088  g->opt.force32BitAddressing) ?
2089  AtomicType::UniformInt32 : AtomicType::UniformInt64;
2090  if (type0->IsVaryingType() || type1->IsVaryingType())
2091  diffType = diffType->GetAsVaryingType();
2092  return diffType;
2093  }
2094  else
2095  // ptr - int -> ptr
2096  return type0;
2097  }
2098 
2099  // otherwise fall through for these...
2100  AssertPos(pos, op == Lt || op == Gt || op == Le || op == Ge ||
2101  op == Equal || op == NotEqual);
2102  }
2103 
2104  const Type *exprType = Type::MoreGeneralType(type0, type1, pos, lOpString(op));
2105  // I don't think that MoreGeneralType should be able to fail after the
2106  // checks done in BinaryExpr::TypeCheck().
2107  AssertPos(pos, exprType != NULL);
2108 
2109  switch (op) {
2110  case Add:
2111  case Sub:
2112  case Mul:
2113  case Div:
2114  case Mod:
2115  return exprType;
2116  case Lt:
2117  case Gt:
2118  case Le:
2119  case Ge:
2120  case Equal:
2121  case NotEqual:
2122  case LogicalAnd:
2123  case LogicalOr:
2124  return lMatchingBoolType(exprType);
2125  case Shl:
2126  case Shr:
2127  return type1->IsVaryingType() ? type0->GetAsVaryingType() : type0;
2128  case BitAnd:
2129  case BitXor:
2130  case BitOr:
2131  return exprType;
2132  case Comma:
2133  // handled above, so fall through here just in case
2134  default:
2135  FATAL("logic error in BinaryExpr::GetType()");
2136  return NULL;
2137  }
2138 }
2139 
2140 
2141 #define FOLD_OP(O, E) \
2142  case O: \
2143  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i) \
2144  result[i] = (v0[i] E v1[i]); \
2145  break
2146 
2147 #define FOLD_OP_REF(O, E, TRef) \
2148  case O: \
2149  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i) { \
2150  result[i] = (v0[i] E v1[i]); \
2151  TRef r = (TRef)v0[i] E (TRef)v1[i]; \
2152  if (result[i] != r) \
2153  Warning(pos, "Binary expression with type \"%s\" can't represent value.", \
2154  carg0->GetType()->GetString().c_str()); \
2155  } \
2156  break
2157 
2158 /** Constant fold the binary integer operations that aren't also applicable
2159  to floating-point types.
2160 */
2161 template <typename T, typename TRef> static ConstExpr *
2162 lConstFoldBinaryIntOp(BinaryExpr::Op op, const T *v0, const T *v1, ConstExpr *carg0,
2163  SourcePos pos) {
2164  T result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
2165  int count = carg0->Count();
2166 
2167  switch (op) {
2168  FOLD_OP_REF(BinaryExpr::Mod, %, TRef);
2169  FOLD_OP_REF(BinaryExpr::Shl, <<, TRef);
2170  FOLD_OP_REF(BinaryExpr::Shr, >>, TRef);
2171  FOLD_OP_REF(BinaryExpr::BitAnd, &, TRef);
2172  FOLD_OP_REF(BinaryExpr::BitXor, ^, TRef);
2173  FOLD_OP_REF(BinaryExpr::BitOr, |, TRef);
2174  default:
2175  return NULL;
2176  }
2177 
2178  return new ConstExpr(carg0->GetType(), result, carg0->pos);
2179 }
2180 
2181 
2182 /** Constant fold the binary logical ops.
2183  */
2184 template <typename T> static ConstExpr *
2185 lConstFoldBinaryLogicalOp(BinaryExpr::Op op, const T *v0, const T *v1,
2186  ConstExpr *carg0) {
2187  bool result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
2188  int count = carg0->Count();
2189 
2190  switch (op) {
2191  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Lt, <);
2192  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Gt, >);
2193  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Le, <=);
2194  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Ge, >=);
2195  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Equal, ==);
2196  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::NotEqual, !=);
2197  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::LogicalAnd, &&);
2198  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::LogicalOr, ||);
2199  default:
2200  return NULL;
2201  }
2202 
2203  const Type *rType = carg0->GetType()->IsUniformType() ?
2204  AtomicType::UniformBool : AtomicType::VaryingBool;
2205  return new ConstExpr(rType, result, carg0->pos);
2206 }
2207 
2208 
2209 /** Constant fold binary arithmetic ops.
2210  */
2211 template <typename T, typename TRef> static ConstExpr *
2212 lConstFoldBinaryArithOp(BinaryExpr::Op op, const T *v0, const T *v1, ConstExpr *carg0,
2213  SourcePos pos) {
2214  T result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
2215  int count = carg0->Count();
2216 
2217  switch (op) {
2218  FOLD_OP_REF(BinaryExpr::Add, +, TRef);
2219  FOLD_OP_REF(BinaryExpr::Sub, -, TRef);
2220  FOLD_OP_REF(BinaryExpr::Mul, *, TRef);
2221  case BinaryExpr::Div:
2222  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i) {
2223  if (v1[i] == 0) {
2224  Error(pos, "Division by zero encountered in expression.");
2225  result[i] = 0;
2226  }
2227  else
2228  result[i] = (v0[i] / v1[i]);
2229  }
2230  break;
2231  default:
2232  return NULL;
2233  }
2234 
2235  return new ConstExpr(carg0->GetType(), result, carg0->pos);
2236 }
2237 
2238 
2239 /** Constant fold the various boolean binary ops.
2240  */
2241 static ConstExpr *
2242 lConstFoldBoolBinaryOp(BinaryExpr::Op op, const bool *v0, const bool *v1,
2243  ConstExpr *carg0) {
2244  bool result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
2245  int count = carg0->Count();
2246 
2247  switch (op) {
2248  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::BitAnd, &);
2249  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::BitXor, ^);
2250  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::BitOr, |);
2251  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Lt, <);
2252  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Gt, >);
2253  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Le, <=);
2254  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Ge, >=);
2255  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Equal, ==);
2256  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::NotEqual, !=);
2257  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::LogicalAnd, &&);
2258  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::LogicalOr, ||);
2259  default:
2260  return NULL;
2261  }
2262 
2263  return new ConstExpr(carg0->GetType(), result, carg0->pos);
2264 }
2265 
2266 
2267 template <typename T> static Expr *
2268 lConstFoldBinaryFPOp(ConstExpr *constArg0, ConstExpr *constArg1,
2269  BinaryExpr::Op op, BinaryExpr *origExpr, SourcePos pos) {
2270  T v0[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
2271  constArg0->GetValues(v0);
2272  constArg1->GetValues(v1);
2273  ConstExpr *ret;
2274  if ((ret = lConstFoldBinaryArithOp<T, T>(op, v0, v1, constArg0, pos)) != NULL)
2275  return ret;
2276  else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinaryLogicalOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
2277  return ret;
2278  else
2279  return origExpr;
2280 }
2281 
2282 
2283 template <typename T, typename TRef> static Expr *
2284 lConstFoldBinaryIntOp(ConstExpr *constArg0, ConstExpr *constArg1,
2285  BinaryExpr::Op op, BinaryExpr *origExpr, SourcePos pos) {
2286  T v0[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
2287  constArg0->GetValues(v0);
2288  constArg1->GetValues(v1);
2289  ConstExpr *ret;
2290  if ((ret = lConstFoldBinaryArithOp<T, TRef>(op, v0, v1, constArg0, pos)) != NULL)
2291  return ret;
2292  else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinaryIntOp<T, TRef>(op, v0, v1, constArg0, pos)) != NULL)
2293  return ret;
2294  else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinaryLogicalOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
2295  return ret;
2296  else
2297  return origExpr;
2298 }
2299 
2300 
2301 /* Returns true if the given arguments (which are assumed to be the
2302  operands of a divide) represent a divide that can be performed by one of
2303  the __fast_idiv functions.
2304  */
2305 static bool
2306 lCanImproveVectorDivide(Expr *arg0, Expr *arg1, int *divisor) {
2307  const Type *type = arg0->GetType();
2308  if (!type)
2309  return false;
2310 
2311  // The value being divided must be an int8/16/32.
2312  if (!(Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt8) ||
2313  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt8) ||
2314  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt16) ||
2315  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt16) ||
2316  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt32) ||
2317  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt32)))
2318  return false;
2319 
2320  // The divisor must be the same compile-time constant value for all of
2321  // the vector lanes.
2322  ConstExpr *ce = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(arg1);
2323  if (!ce)
2324  return false;
2325  int64_t div[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
2326  int count = ce->GetValues(div);
2327  for (int i = 1; i < count; ++i)
2328  if (div[i] != div[0])
2329  return false;
2330  *divisor = div[0];
2331 
2332  // And finally, the divisor must be >= 2 and <128 (for 8-bit divides),
2333  // and <256 otherwise.
2334  if (*divisor < 2)
2335  return false;
2336  if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt8) ||
2337  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt8))
2338  return *divisor < 128;
2339  else
2340  return *divisor < 256;
2341 }
2342 
2343 
2344 Expr *
2345 BinaryExpr::Optimize() {
2346  if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
2347  return NULL;
2348 
2349  ConstExpr *constArg0 = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(arg0);
2350  ConstExpr *constArg1 = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(arg1);
2351 
2352  if (g->opt.fastMath) {
2353  // optimizations related to division by floats..
2354 
2355  // transform x / const -> x * (1/const)
2356  if (op == Div && constArg1 != NULL) {
2357  const Type *type1 = constArg1->GetType();
2358  if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type1, AtomicType::UniformFloat) ||
2359  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type1, AtomicType::VaryingFloat)) {
2360  float inv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
2361  int count = constArg1->GetValues(inv);
2362  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
