2363  inv[i] = 1.f / inv[i];
2364  Expr *einv = new ConstExpr(type1, inv, constArg1->pos);
2365  Expr *e = new BinaryExpr(Mul, arg0, einv, pos);
2366  e = ::TypeCheck(e);
2367  if (e == NULL)
2368  return NULL;
2369  return ::Optimize(e);
2370  }
2371  }
2372 
2373  // transform x / y -> x * rcp(y)
2374  if (op == Div) {
2375  const Type *type1 = arg1->GetType();
2376  if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type1, AtomicType::UniformFloat) ||
2377  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type1, AtomicType::VaryingFloat)) {
2378  // Get the symbol for the appropriate builtin
2379  std::vector<Symbol *> rcpFuns;
2380  m->symbolTable->LookupFunction("rcp", &rcpFuns);
2381  if (rcpFuns.size() > 0) {
2382  Expr *rcpSymExpr = new FunctionSymbolExpr("rcp", rcpFuns, pos);
2383  ExprList *args = new ExprList(arg1, arg1->pos);
2384  Expr *rcpCall = new FunctionCallExpr(rcpSymExpr, args,
2385  arg1->pos);
2386  rcpCall = ::TypeCheck(rcpCall);
2387  if (rcpCall == NULL)
2388  return NULL;
2389  rcpCall = ::Optimize(rcpCall);
2390  if (rcpCall == NULL)
2391  return NULL;
2392 
2393  Expr *ret = new BinaryExpr(Mul, arg0, rcpCall, pos);
2394  ret = ::TypeCheck(ret);
2395  if (ret == NULL)
2396  return NULL;
2397  return ::Optimize(ret);
2398  }
2399  else
2400  Warning(pos, "rcp() not found from stdlib. Can't apply "
2401  "fast-math rcp optimization.");
2402  }
2403  }
2404  }
2405 
2406  int divisor;
2407  if (op == Div && lCanImproveVectorDivide(arg0, arg1, &divisor)) {
2408  Debug(pos, "Improving vector divide by constant %d", divisor);
2409 
2410  std::vector<Symbol *> idivFuns;
2411  m->symbolTable->LookupFunction("__fast_idiv", &idivFuns);
2412  if (idivFuns.size() == 0) {
2413  Warning(pos, "Couldn't find __fast_idiv to optimize integer divide. "
2414  "Are you compiling with --nostdlib?");
2415  return this;
2416  }
2417 
2418  Expr *idivSymExpr = new FunctionSymbolExpr("__fast_idiv", idivFuns, pos);
2419  ExprList *args = new ExprList(arg0, pos);
2420  args->exprs.push_back(new ConstExpr(AtomicType::UniformInt32, divisor, arg1->pos));
2421  Expr *idivCall = new FunctionCallExpr(idivSymExpr, args, pos);
2422 
2423  idivCall = ::TypeCheck(idivCall);
2424  if (idivCall == NULL)
2425  return NULL;
2426 
2427  Assert(Type::EqualIgnoringConst(GetType(), idivCall->GetType()));
2428  idivCall = new TypeCastExpr(GetType(), idivCall, pos);
2429  return ::Optimize(idivCall);
2430  }
2431 
2432  // From here on out, we're just doing constant folding, so if both args
2433  // aren't constants then we're done...
2434  if (constArg0 == NULL || constArg1 == NULL)
2435  return this;
2436 
2437  AssertPos(pos, Type::EqualIgnoringConst(arg0->GetType(), arg1->GetType()));
2438  const Type *type = arg0->GetType()->GetAsNonConstType();
2439  if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformFloat) ||
2440  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingFloat)) {
2441  return lConstFoldBinaryFPOp<float>(constArg0, constArg1, op, this, pos);
2442  }
2443  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformDouble) ||
2444  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingDouble)) {
2445  return lConstFoldBinaryFPOp<double>(constArg0, constArg1, op, this, pos);
2446  }
2447  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformInt8) ||
2448  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt8)) {
2449  return lConstFoldBinaryIntOp<int8_t, int64_t>(constArg0, constArg1, op, this, pos);
2450  }
2451  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt8) ||
2452  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt8)) {
2453  return lConstFoldBinaryIntOp<uint8_t, uint64_t>(constArg0, constArg1, op, this, pos);
2454  }
2455  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformInt16) ||
2456  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt16)) {
2457  return lConstFoldBinaryIntOp<int16_t, int64_t>(constArg0, constArg1, op, this, pos);
2458  }
2459  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt16) ||
2460  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt16)) {
2461  return lConstFoldBinaryIntOp<uint16_t, uint64_t>(constArg0, constArg1, op, this, pos);
2462  }
2463  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformInt32) ||
2464  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt32)) {
2465  return lConstFoldBinaryIntOp<int32_t, int64_t>(constArg0, constArg1, op, this, pos);
2466  }
2467  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt32) ||
2468  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt32)) {
2469  return lConstFoldBinaryIntOp<uint32_t, uint64_t>(constArg0, constArg1, op, this, pos);
2470  }
2471  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformInt64) ||
2472  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt64)) {
2473  return lConstFoldBinaryIntOp<int64_t, int64_t>(constArg0, constArg1, op, this, pos);
2474  }
2475  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt64) ||
2476  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt64)) {
2477  return lConstFoldBinaryIntOp<uint64_t, uint64_t>(constArg0, constArg1, op, this, pos);
2478  }
2479  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformBool) ||
2480  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingBool)) {
2481  bool v0[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
2482  constArg0->GetValues(v0);
2483  constArg1->GetValues(v1);
2484  ConstExpr *ret;
2485  if ((ret = lConstFoldBoolBinaryOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
2486  return ret;
2487  else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinaryLogicalOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
2488  return ret;
2489  else
2490  return this;
2491  }
2492  else
2493  return this;
2494 }
2495 
2496 
2497 Expr *
2498 BinaryExpr::TypeCheck() {
2499  if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
2500  return NULL;
2501 
2502  const Type *type0 = arg0->GetType(), *type1 = arg1->GetType();
2503  if (type0 == NULL || type1 == NULL)
2504  return NULL;
2505 
2506  // If either operand is a reference, dereference it before we move
2507  // forward
2508  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(type0) != NULL) {
2509  arg0 = new RefDerefExpr(arg0, arg0->pos);
2510  type0 = arg0->GetType();
2511  AssertPos(pos, type0 != NULL);
2512  }
2513  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(type1) != NULL) {
2514  arg1 = new RefDerefExpr(arg1, arg1->pos);
2515  type1 = arg1->GetType();
2516  AssertPos(pos, type1 != NULL);
2517  }
2518 
2519  // Convert arrays to pointers to their first elements
2520  if (CastType<ArrayType>(type0) != NULL) {
2521  arg0 = lArrayToPointer(arg0);
2522  type0 = arg0->GetType();
2523  }
2524  if (CastType<ArrayType>(type1) != NULL) {
2525  arg1 = lArrayToPointer(arg1);
2526  type1 = arg1->GetType();
2527  }
2528 
2529  // Prohibit binary operators with SOA types
2530  if (type0->GetSOAWidth() > 0) {
2531  Error(arg0->pos, "Illegal to use binary operator %s with SOA type "
2532  "\"%s\".", lOpString(op), type0->GetString().c_str());
2533  return NULL;
2534  }
2535  if (type1->GetSOAWidth() > 0) {
2536  Error(arg1->pos, "Illegal to use binary operator %s with SOA type "
2537  "\"%s\".", lOpString(op), type1->GetString().c_str());
2538  return NULL;
2539  }
2540 
2541  const PointerType *pt0 = CastType<PointerType>(type0);
2542  const PointerType *pt1 = CastType<PointerType>(type1);
2543  if (pt0 != NULL && pt1 != NULL && op == Sub) {
2544  // Pointer subtraction
2545  if (PointerType::IsVoidPointer(type0)) {
2546  Error(pos, "Illegal to perform pointer arithmetic "
2547  "on \"%s\" type.", type0->GetString().c_str());
2548  return NULL;
2549  }
2550  if (PointerType::IsVoidPointer(type1)) {
2551  Error(pos, "Illegal to perform pointer arithmetic "
2552  "on \"%s\" type.", type1->GetString().c_str());
2553  return NULL;
2554  }
2555  if (CastType<UndefinedStructType>(pt0->GetBaseType())) {
2556  Error(pos, "Illegal to perform pointer arithmetic "
2557  "on undefined struct type \"%s\".", pt0->GetString().c_str());
2558  return NULL;
2559  }
2560  if (CastType<UndefinedStructType>(pt1->GetBaseType())) {
2561  Error(pos, "Illegal to perform pointer arithmetic "
2562  "on undefined struct type \"%s\".", pt1->GetString().c_str());
2563  return NULL;
2564  }
2565 
2566  const Type *t = Type::MoreGeneralType(type0, type1, pos, "-");
2567  if (t == NULL)
2568  return NULL;
2569 
2570  arg0 = TypeConvertExpr(arg0, t, "pointer subtraction");
2571  arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, t, "pointer subtraction");
2572  if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
2573  return NULL;
2574 
2575  return this;
2576  }
2577  else if (((pt0 != NULL || pt1 != NULL) && op == Add) ||
2578  (pt0 != NULL && op == Sub)) {
2579  // Handle ptr + int, int + ptr, ptr - int
2580  if (pt0 != NULL && pt1 != NULL) {
2581  Error(pos, "Illegal to add two pointer types \"%s\" and \"%s\".",
2582  pt0->GetString().c_str(), pt1->GetString().c_str());
2583  return NULL;
2584  }
2585  else if (pt1 != NULL) {
2586  // put in canonical order with the pointer as the first operand
2587  // for GetValue()
2588  std::swap(arg0, arg1);
2589  std::swap(type0, type1);
2590  std::swap(pt0, pt1);
2591  }
2592 
2593  AssertPos(pos, pt0 != NULL);
2594 
2595  if (PointerType::IsVoidPointer(pt0)) {
2596  Error(pos, "Illegal to perform pointer arithmetic "
2597  "on \"%s\" type.", pt0->GetString().c_str());
2598  return NULL;
2599  }
2600  if (CastType<UndefinedStructType>(pt0->GetBaseType())) {
2601  Error(pos, "Illegal to perform pointer arithmetic "
2602  "on undefined struct type \"%s\".", pt0->GetString().c_str());
2603  return NULL;
2604  }
2605 
2606  const Type *offsetType = g->target->is32Bit() ?
2607  AtomicType::UniformInt32 : AtomicType::UniformInt64;
2608  if (pt0->IsVaryingType())
2609  offsetType = offsetType->GetAsVaryingType();
2610  if (type1->IsVaryingType()) {
2611  arg0 = TypeConvertExpr(arg0, type0->GetAsVaryingType(),
2612  "pointer addition");
2613  offsetType = offsetType->GetAsVaryingType();
2614  AssertPos(pos, arg0 != NULL);
2615  }
2616 
2617  arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, offsetType, lOpString(op));
2618  if (arg1 == NULL)
2619  return NULL;
2620 
2621  return this;
2622  }
2623 
2624  switch (op) {
2625  case Shl:
2626  case Shr:
2627  case BitAnd:
2628  case BitXor:
2629  case BitOr: {
2630  // Must have integer or bool-typed operands for these bit-related
2631  // ops; don't do any implicit conversions from floats here...
2632  if (!type0->IsIntType() && !type0->IsBoolType()) {
2633  Error(arg0->pos, "First operand to binary operator \"%s\" must be "
2634  "an integer or bool.", lOpString(op));
2635  return NULL;
2636  }
2637  if (!type1->IsIntType() && !type1->IsBoolType()) {
2638  Error(arg1->pos, "Second operand to binary operator \"%s\" must be "
2639  "an integer or bool.", lOpString(op));
2640  return NULL;
2641  }
2642 
2643  if (op == Shl || op == Shr) {
2644  bool isVarying = (type0->IsVaryingType() ||
2645  type1->IsVaryingType());
2646  if (isVarying) {
2647  arg0 = TypeConvertExpr(arg0, type0->GetAsVaryingType(),
2648  "shift operator");
2649  if (arg0 == NULL)
2650  return NULL;
2651  type0 = arg0->GetType();
2652  }
2653  arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, type0, "shift operator");
2654  if (arg1 == NULL)
2655  return NULL;
2656  }
2657  else {
2658  const Type *promotedType = Type::MoreGeneralType(type0, type1, arg0->pos,
2659  "binary bit op");
2660  if (promotedType == NULL)
2661  return NULL;
2662 
2663  arg0 = TypeConvertExpr(arg0, promotedType, "binary bit op");
2664  arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, promotedType, "binary bit op");
2665  if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
2666  return NULL;
2667  }
2668  return this;
2669  }
2670  case Add:
2671  case Sub:
2672  case Mul:
2673  case Div:
2674  case Mod: {
2675  // Must be numeric type for these. (And mod is special--can't be float)
2676  if (!type0->IsNumericType() || (op == Mod && type0->IsFloatType())) {
2677  Error(arg0->pos, "First operand to binary operator \"%s\" is of "
2678  "invalid type \"%s\".", lOpString(op),
2679  type0->GetString().c_str());
2680  return NULL;
2681  }
2682  if (!type1->IsNumericType() || (op == Mod && type1->IsFloatType())) {
2683  Error(arg1->pos, "First operand to binary operator \"%s\" is of "
2684  "invalid type \"%s\".", lOpString(op),
2685  type1->GetString().c_str());
2686  return NULL;
2687  }
2688 
2689  const Type *promotedType = Type::MoreGeneralType(type0, type1,
2690  Union(arg0->pos, arg1->pos),
2691  lOpString(op));
2692  if (promotedType == NULL)
2693  return NULL;
2694 
2695  arg0 = TypeConvertExpr(arg0, promotedType, lOpString(op));
2696  arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, promotedType, lOpString(op));
2697  if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
2698  return NULL;
2699  return this;
2700  }
2701  case Lt:
2702  case Gt:
2703  case Le:
2704  case Ge:
2705  case Equal:
2706  case NotEqual: {
2707  const PointerType *pt0 = CastType<PointerType>(type0);
2708  const PointerType *pt1 = CastType<PointerType>(type1);
2709 
2710  // Convert '0' in expressions where the other expression is a
2711  // pointer type to a NULL pointer.
2712  if (pt0 != NULL && lIsAllIntZeros(arg1)) {
2713  arg1 = new NullPointerExpr(pos);
2714  type1 = arg1->GetType();
2715  pt1 = CastType<PointerType>(type1);
2716  }
2717  else if (pt1 != NULL && lIsAllIntZeros(arg0)) {
2718  arg0 = new NullPointerExpr(pos);
2719  type0 = arg1->GetType();
2720  pt0 = CastType<PointerType>(type0);
2721  }
2722 
2723  if (pt0 == NULL && pt1 == NULL) {
2724  if (!type0->IsBoolType() && !type0->IsNumericType()) {
2725  Error(arg0->pos,
2726  "First operand to operator \"%s\" is of "
2727  "non-comparable type \"%s\".", lOpString(op),
2728  type0->GetString().c_str());
2729  return NULL;
2730  }
2731  if (!type1->IsBoolType() && !type1->IsNumericType()) {
2732  Error(arg1->pos,
2733  "Second operand to operator \"%s\" is of "
2734  "non-comparable type \"%s\".", lOpString(op),
2735  type1->GetString().c_str());
2736  return NULL;
2737  }
2738  }
2739 
2740  const Type *promotedType =
2741  Type::MoreGeneralType(type0, type1, arg0->pos, lOpString(op));
2742  if (promotedType == NULL)
2743  return NULL;
2744 
2745  arg0 = TypeConvertExpr(arg0, promotedType, lOpString(op));
2746  arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, promotedType, lOpString(op));
2747  if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
2748  return NULL;
2749  return this;
2750  }
2751  case LogicalAnd:
2752  case LogicalOr: {
2753  // For now, we just type convert to boolean types, of the same
2754  // variability as the original types. (When generating code, it's
2755  // useful to have preserved the uniform/varying distinction.)
2756  const AtomicType *boolType0 = type0->IsUniformType() ?
2757  AtomicType::UniformBool : AtomicType::VaryingBool;
2758  const AtomicType *boolType1 = type1->IsUniformType() ?
2759  AtomicType::UniformBool : AtomicType::VaryingBool;
2760 
2761  const Type *destType0 = NULL, *destType1 = NULL;
2762  const VectorType *vtype0 = CastType<VectorType>(type0);
2763  const VectorType *vtype1 = CastType<VectorType>(type1);
2764  if (vtype0 && vtype1) {
2765  int sz0 = vtype0->GetElementCount(), sz1 = vtype1->GetElementCount();
2766  if (sz0 != sz1) {
2767  Error(pos, "Can't do logical operation \"%s\" between vector types of "
2768  "different sizes (%d vs. %d).", lOpString(op), sz0, sz1);
2769  return NULL;
2770  }
2771  destType0 = new VectorType(boolType0, sz0);
2772  destType1 = new VectorType(boolType1, sz1);
2773  }
2774  else if (vtype0 != NULL) {
2775  destType0 = new VectorType(boolType0, vtype0->GetElementCount());
2776  destType1 = new VectorType(boolType1, vtype0->GetElementCount());
2777  }
2778  else if (vtype1 != NULL) {
2779  destType0 = new VectorType(boolType0, vtype1->GetElementCount());
2780  destType1 = new VectorType(boolType1, vtype1->GetElementCount());
2781  }
2782  else {
2783  destType0 = boolType0;
2784  destType1 = boolType1;
2785  }
2786 
2787  arg0 = TypeConvertExpr(arg0, destType0, lOpString(op));
2788  arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, destType1, lOpString(op));
2789  if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
2790  return NULL;
2791  return this;
2792  }
2793  case Comma:
2794  return this;
2795  default:
2796  FATAL("logic error");
2797  return NULL;
2798  }
2799 }
2800 
2801 const Type *
2802 BinaryExpr::GetLValueType() const {
2803  const Type *t = GetType();
2804  if (CastType<PointerType>(t) != NULL) {
2805  // Are we doing something like (basePtr + offset)[...] = ...
2806  return t;
2807  }
2808  else {
2809  return NULL;
2810  }
2811 }
2812 
2813 int
2814 BinaryExpr::EstimateCost() const {
2815  if (dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(arg0) != NULL &&
2816  dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(arg1) != NULL)
2817  return 0;
2818 
2819  return (op == Div || op == Mod) ? COST_COMPLEX_ARITH_OP :
2820  COST_SIMPLE_ARITH_LOGIC_OP;
2821 }
2822 
2823 
2824 void
2825 BinaryExpr::Print() const {
2826  if (!arg0 || !arg1 || !GetType())
2827  return;
2828 
2829  printf("[ %s ] (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
2830  arg0->Print();
2831  printf(" %s ", lOpString(op));
2832  arg1->Print();
2833  printf(")");
2834  pos.Print();
2835 }
2836 
2837 
2838 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2839 // AssignExpr
2840 
2841 static const char *
2842 lOpString(AssignExpr::Op op) {
2843  switch (op) {
2844  case AssignExpr::Assign: return "assignment operator";
2845  case AssignExpr::MulAssign: return "*=";
2846  case AssignExpr::DivAssign: return "/=";
2847  case AssignExpr::ModAssign: return "%%=";
2848  case AssignExpr::AddAssign: return "+=";
2849  case AssignExpr::SubAssign: return "-=";
2850  case AssignExpr::ShlAssign: return "<<=";
2851  case AssignExpr::ShrAssign: return ">>=";
2852  case AssignExpr::AndAssign: return "&=";
2853  case AssignExpr::XorAssign: return "^=";
2854  case AssignExpr::OrAssign: return "|=";
2855  default:
2856  FATAL("Missing op in lOpstring");
2857  return "";
2858  }
2859 }
2860 
2861 /** Emit code to do an "assignment + operation" operator, e.g. "+=".
2862  */
2863 static llvm::Value *
2864 lEmitOpAssign(AssignExpr::Op op, Expr *arg0, Expr *arg1, const Type *type,
2865  Symbol *baseSym, SourcePos pos, FunctionEmitContext *ctx) {
2866  llvm::Value *lv = arg0->GetLValue(ctx);
2867  if (!lv) {
2868  // FIXME: I think this test is unnecessary and that this case
2869  // should be caught during typechecking
2870  Error(pos, "Can't assign to left-hand side of expression.");
2871  return NULL;
2872  }
2873  const Type *lvalueType = arg0->GetLValueType();
2874  const Type *resultType = arg0->GetType();
2875  if (lvalueType == NULL || resultType == NULL)
2876  return NULL;
2877 
2878  // Get the value on the right-hand side of the assignment+operation
2879  // operator and load the current value on the left-hand side.
2880  llvm::Value *rvalue = arg1->GetValue(ctx);
2881  llvm::Value *mask = lMaskForSymbol(baseSym, ctx);
2882  ctx->SetDebugPos(arg0->pos);
2883  llvm::Value *oldLHS = ctx->LoadInst(lv, mask, lvalueType);
2884  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
2885 
2886  // Map the operator to the corresponding BinaryExpr::Op operator
2887  BinaryExpr::Op basicop;
2888  switch (op) {
2889  case AssignExpr::MulAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Mul; break;
2890  case AssignExpr::DivAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Div; break;
2891  case AssignExpr::ModAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Mod; break;
2892  case AssignExpr::AddAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Add; break;
2893  case AssignExpr::SubAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Sub; break;
2894  case AssignExpr::ShlAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Shl; break;
2895  case AssignExpr::ShrAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Shr; break;
2896  case AssignExpr::AndAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::BitAnd; break;
2897  case AssignExpr::XorAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::BitXor; break;
2898  case AssignExpr::OrAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::BitOr; break;
2899  default:
2900  FATAL("logic error in lEmitOpAssign()");
2901  return NULL;
2902  }
2903 
2904  // Emit the code to compute the new value
2905  llvm::Value *newValue = NULL;
2906  switch (op) {
2907  case AssignExpr::MulAssign:
2908  case AssignExpr::DivAssign:
2909  case AssignExpr::ModAssign:
2910  case AssignExpr::AddAssign:
2911  case AssignExpr::SubAssign:
2912  newValue = lEmitBinaryArith(basicop, oldLHS, rvalue, type,
2913  arg1->GetType(), ctx, pos);
2914  break;
2915  case AssignExpr::ShlAssign:
2916  case AssignExpr::ShrAssign:
2917  case AssignExpr::AndAssign:
2918  case AssignExpr::XorAssign:
2919  case AssignExpr::OrAssign:
2920  newValue = lEmitBinaryBitOp(basicop, oldLHS, rvalue,
2921  arg0->GetType()->IsUnsignedType(), ctx);
2922  break;
2923  default:
2924  FATAL("logic error in lEmitOpAssign");
2925  return NULL;
2926  }
2927 
2928  // And store the result back to the lvalue.
2929  ctx->SetDebugPos(arg0->pos);
2930  lStoreAssignResult(newValue, lv, resultType, lvalueType, ctx, baseSym);
2931 
2932  return newValue;
2933 }
2934 
2935 
2936 AssignExpr::AssignExpr(AssignExpr::Op o, Expr *a, Expr *b, SourcePos p)
2937  : Expr(p), op(o) {
2938  lvalue = a;
2939  rvalue = b;
2940 }
2941 
2942 
2943 llvm::Value *
2944 AssignExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
2945  const Type *type = NULL;
2946  if (lvalue == NULL || rvalue == NULL || (type = GetType()) == NULL)
2947  return NULL;
2948 
2949  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
2950 
2951  Symbol *baseSym = lvalue->GetBaseSymbol();
2952 
2953  switch (op) {
2954  case Assign: {
2955  llvm::Value *ptr = lvalue->GetLValue(ctx);
2956  if (ptr == NULL) {
2957  Error(lvalue->pos, "Left hand side of assignment expression can't "
2958  "be assigned to.");
2959  return NULL;
2960  }
2961  const Type *ptrType = lvalue->GetLValueType();
2962  const Type *valueType = rvalue->GetType();
2963  if (ptrType == NULL || valueType == NULL) {
2964  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
2965  return NULL;
2966  }
2967 
2968  llvm::Value *value = rvalue->GetValue(ctx);
2969  if (value == NULL) {
2970  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
2971  return NULL;
2972  }
2973 
2974  ctx->SetDebugPos(lvalue->pos);
2975 
2976  lStoreAssignResult(value, ptr, valueType, ptrType, ctx, baseSym);
2977 
2978  return value;
2979  }
2980  case MulAssign:
2981  case DivAssign:
2982  case ModAssign:
2983  case AddAssign:
2984  case SubAssign:
2985  case ShlAssign:
2986  case ShrAssign:
2987  case AndAssign:
2988  case XorAssign:
2989  case OrAssign: {
2990  // This should be caught during type checking
2991  AssertPos(pos, !CastType<ArrayType>(type) &&
2992  !CastType<StructType>(type));
2993  return lEmitOpAssign(op, lvalue, rvalue, type, baseSym, pos, ctx);
2994  }
2995  default:
2996  FATAL("logic error in AssignExpr::GetValue()");
2997  return NULL;
2998  }
2999 }
3000 
3001 
3002 Expr *
3003 AssignExpr::Optimize() {
3004  if (lvalue == NULL || rvalue == NULL)
3005  return NULL;
3006  return this;
3007 }
3008 
3009 
3010 const Type *
3011 AssignExpr::GetType() const {
3012  return lvalue ? lvalue->GetType() : NULL;
3013 }
3014 
3015 
3016 /** Recursively checks a structure type to see if it (or any struct type
3017  that it holds) has a const-qualified member. */
3018 static bool
3019 lCheckForConstStructMember(SourcePos pos, const StructType *structType,
3020  const StructType *initialType) {
3021  for (int i = 0; i < structType->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
3022  const Type *t = structType->GetElementType(i);
3023  if (t->IsConstType()) {
3024  if (structType == initialType)
3025  Error(pos, "Illegal to assign to type \"%s\" due to element "
3026  "\"%s\" with type \"%s\".", structType->GetString().c_str(),
3027  structType->GetElementName(i).c_str(),
3028  t->GetString().c_str());
3029  else
3030  Error(pos, "Illegal to assign to type \"%s\" in type \"%s\" "
3031  "due to element \"%s\" with type \"%s\".",
3032  structType->GetString().c_str(),
3033  initialType->GetString().c_str(),
3034  structType->GetElementName(i).c_str(),
3035  t->GetString().c_str());
3036  return true;
3037  }
3038 
3039  const StructType *st = CastType<StructType>(t);
3040  if (st != NULL && lCheckForConstStructMember(pos, st, initialType))
3041  return true;
3042  }
3043  return false;
3044 }
3045 
3046 
3047 Expr *
3048 AssignExpr::TypeCheck() {
3049  if (lvalue == NULL || rvalue == NULL)
3050  return NULL;
3051 
3052  bool lvalueIsReference =
3053  CastType<ReferenceType>(lvalue->GetType()) != NULL;
3054  if (lvalueIsReference)
3055  lvalue = new RefDerefExpr(lvalue, lvalue->pos);
3056 
3057  if (PossiblyResolveFunctionOverloads(rvalue, lvalue->GetType()) == false) {
3058  Error(pos, "Unable to find overloaded function for function "
3059  "pointer assignment.");
3060  return NULL;
3061  }
3062 
3063  const Type *lhsType = lvalue->GetType();
3064  if (lhsType == NULL) {
3065  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
3066  return NULL;
3067  }
3068 
3069  if (lhsType->IsConstType()) {
3070  Error(lvalue->pos, "Can't assign to type \"%s\" on left-hand side of "
3071  "expression.", lhsType->GetString().c_str());
3072  return NULL;
3073  }
3074 
3075  if (CastType<PointerType>(lhsType) != NULL) {
3076  if (op == AddAssign || op == SubAssign) {
3077  if (PointerType::IsVoidPointer(lhsType)) {
3078  Error(pos, "Illegal to perform pointer arithmetic on \"%s\" "
3079  "type.", lhsType->GetString().c_str());
3080  return NULL;
3081  }
3082 
3083  const Type *deltaType = g->target->is32Bit() ? AtomicType::UniformInt32 :
3084  AtomicType::UniformInt64;
3085  if (lhsType->IsVaryingType())
3086  deltaType = deltaType->GetAsVaryingType();
3087  rvalue = TypeConvertExpr(rvalue, deltaType, lOpString(op));
3088  }
3089  else if (op == Assign)
3090  rvalue = TypeConvertExpr(rvalue, lhsType, "assignment");
3091  else {
3092  Error(lvalue->pos, "Assignment operator \"%s\" is illegal with pointer types.",
3093  lOpString(op));
3094  return NULL;
3095  }
3096  }
3097  else if (CastType<ArrayType>(lhsType) != NULL) {
3098  Error(lvalue->pos, "Illegal to assign to array type \"%s\".",
3099  lhsType->GetString().c_str());
3100  return NULL;
3101  }
3102  else
3103  rvalue = TypeConvertExpr(rvalue, lhsType, lOpString(op));
3104 
3105  if (rvalue == NULL)
3106  return NULL;
3107 
3108  if (lhsType->IsFloatType() == true &&
3109  (op == ShlAssign || op == ShrAssign || op == AndAssign ||
3110  op == XorAssign || op == OrAssign)) {
3111  Error(pos, "Illegal to use %s operator with floating-point "
3112  "operands.", lOpString(op));
3113  return NULL;
3114  }
3115 
3116  const StructType *st = CastType<StructType>(lhsType);
3117  if (st != NULL) {
3118  // Make sure we're not assigning to a struct that has a constant member
3119  if (lCheckForConstStructMember(pos, st, st))
3120  return NULL;
3121 
3122  if (op != Assign) {
3123  Error(lvalue->pos, "Assignment operator \"%s\" is illegal with struct "
3124  "type \"%s\".", lOpString(op), st->GetString().c_str());
3125  return NULL;
3126  }
3127  }
3128 
3129  return this;
3130 }
3131 
3132 
3133 int
3134 AssignExpr::EstimateCost() const {
3135  if (op == Assign)
3136  return COST_ASSIGN;
3137  if (op == DivAssign || op == ModAssign)
3138  return COST_ASSIGN + COST_COMPLEX_ARITH_OP;
3139  else
3140  return COST_ASSIGN + COST_SIMPLE_ARITH_LOGIC_OP;
3141 }
3142 
3143 
3144 void
3145 AssignExpr::Print() const {
3146  if (!lvalue || !rvalue || !GetType())
3147  return;
3148 
3149  printf("[%s] assign (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
3150  lvalue->Print();
3151  printf(" %s ", lOpString(op));
3152  rvalue->Print();
3153  printf(")");
3154  pos.Print();
3155 }
3156 
3157 
3158 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3159 // SelectExpr
3160 
3161 SelectExpr::SelectExpr(Expr *t, Expr *e1, Expr *e2, SourcePos p)
3162  : Expr(p) {
3163  test = t;
3164  expr1 = e1;
3165  expr2 = e2;
3166 }
3167 
3168 
3169 /** Emit code to select between two varying values based on a varying test
3170  value.
3171  */
3172 static llvm::Value *
3173 lEmitVaryingSelect(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *test,
3174  llvm::Value *expr1, llvm::Value *expr2,
3175  const Type *type) {
3176 #if 0 // !defined(LLVM_3_1)
3177  // Though it should be equivalent, this seems to cause non-trivial
3178  // performance regressions versus the below. This may be related to
3179  // http://llvm.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=16941.
3180  if (test->getType() != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType)
3181  test = ctx->TruncInst(test, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType);
3182  return ctx->SelectInst(test, expr1, expr2, "select");
3183 #else
3184  llvm::Value *resultPtr = ctx->AllocaInst(expr1->getType(), "selectexpr_tmp");
3185  // Don't need to worry about masking here
3186  ctx->StoreInst(expr2, resultPtr);
3187  // Use masking to conditionally store the expr1 values
3188  Assert(resultPtr->getType() ==
3189  PointerType::GetUniform(type)->LLVMType(g->ctx));
3190  ctx->StoreInst(expr1, resultPtr, test, type, PointerType::GetUniform(type));
3191  return ctx->LoadInst(resultPtr, "selectexpr_final");
3192 #endif // !LLVM_3_1
3193 }
3194 
3195 
3196 static void
3197 lEmitSelectExprCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *testVal,
3198  llvm::Value *oldMask, llvm::Value *fullMask,
3199  Expr *expr, llvm::Value *exprPtr) {
3200  llvm::BasicBlock *bbEval = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("select_eval_expr");
3201  llvm::BasicBlock *bbDone = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("select_done");
3202 
3203  // Check to see if the test was true for any of the currently executing
3204  // program instances.
3205  llvm::Value *testAndFullMask =
3206  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, testVal, fullMask,
3207  "test&mask");
3208  llvm::Value *anyOn = ctx->Any(testAndFullMask);
3209  ctx->BranchInst(bbEval, bbDone, anyOn);
3210 
3211  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbEval);
3212  llvm::Value *testAndMask =
3213  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, testVal, oldMask,
3214  "test&mask");
3215  ctx->SetInternalMask(testAndMask);
3216  llvm::Value *exprVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
3217  ctx->StoreInst(exprVal, exprPtr);
3218  ctx->BranchInst(bbDone);
3219 
3220  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbDone);
3221 }
3222 
3223 
3224 llvm::Value *
3225 SelectExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
3226  if (!expr1 || !expr2 || !test)
3227  return NULL;
3228 
3229  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
3230 
3231  const Type *testType = test->GetType()->GetAsNonConstType();
3232  // This should be taken care of during typechecking
3233  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(testType->GetBaseType(), AtomicType::UniformBool) ||
3234  Type::Equal(testType->GetBaseType(), AtomicType::VaryingBool));
3235 
3236  const Type *type = expr1->GetType();
3237 
3238  if (Type::Equal(testType, AtomicType::UniformBool)) {
3239  // Simple case of a single uniform bool test expression; we just
3240  // want one of the two expressions. In this case, we can be
3241  // careful to evaluate just the one of the expressions that we need
3242  // the value of so that if the other one has side-effects or
3243  // accesses invalid memory, it doesn't execute.
3244  llvm::Value *testVal = test->GetValue(ctx);
3245  llvm::BasicBlock *testTrue = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("select_true");
3246  llvm::BasicBlock *testFalse = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("select_false");
3247  llvm::BasicBlock *testDone = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("select_done");
3248  ctx->BranchInst(testTrue, testFalse, testVal);
3249 
3250  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(testTrue);
3251  llvm::Value *expr1Val = expr1->GetValue(ctx);
3252  // Note that truePred won't be necessarily equal to testTrue, in
3253  // case the expr1->GetValue() call changes the current basic block.
3254  llvm::BasicBlock *truePred = ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock();
3255  ctx->BranchInst(testDone);
3256 
3257  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(testFalse);
3258  llvm::Value *expr2Val = expr2->GetValue(ctx);
3259  // See comment above truePred for why we can't just assume we're in
3260  // the testFalse basic block here.
3261  llvm::BasicBlock *falsePred = ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock();
3262  ctx->BranchInst(testDone);
3263 
3264  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(testDone);
3265  llvm::PHINode *ret = ctx->PhiNode(expr1Val->getType(), 2, "select");
3266  ret->addIncoming(expr1Val, truePred);
3267  ret->addIncoming(expr2Val, falsePred);
3268  return ret;
3269  }
3270  else if (CastType<VectorType>(testType) == NULL) {
3271  // the test is a varying bool type
3272  llvm::Value *testVal = test->GetValue(ctx);
3273  AssertPos(pos, testVal->getType() == LLVMTypes::MaskType);
3274  llvm::Value *oldMask = ctx->GetInternalMask();
3275  llvm::Value *fullMask = ctx->GetFullMask();
3276 
3277  // We don't want to incur the overhead for short-circuit evaluation
3278  // for expressions that are both computationally simple and safe to
3279  // run with an "all off" mask.
3280  bool shortCircuit1 =
3281  (::EstimateCost(expr1) > PREDICATE_SAFE_IF_STATEMENT_COST ||
3282  SafeToRunWithMaskAllOff(expr1) == false);
3283  bool shortCircuit2 =
3284  (::EstimateCost(expr2) > PREDICATE_SAFE_IF_STATEMENT_COST ||
3285  SafeToRunWithMaskAllOff(expr2) == false);
3286 
3287  Debug(expr1->pos, "%sshort circuiting evaluation for select expr",
3288  shortCircuit1 ? "" : "Not ");
3289  Debug(expr2->pos, "%sshort circuiting evaluation for select expr",
3290  shortCircuit2 ? "" : "Not ");
3291 
3292  // Temporary storage to store the values computed for each
3293  // expression, if any. (These stay as uninitialized memory if we
3294  // short circuit around the corresponding expression.)
3295  llvm::Type *exprType =
3296  expr1->GetType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
3297  llvm::Value *expr1Ptr = ctx->AllocaInst(exprType);
3298  llvm::Value *expr2Ptr = ctx->AllocaInst(exprType);
3299 
3300  if (shortCircuit1)
3301  lEmitSelectExprCode(ctx, testVal, oldMask, fullMask, expr1,
3302  expr1Ptr);
3303  else {
3304  ctx->SetInternalMaskAnd(oldMask, testVal);
3305  llvm::Value *expr1Val = expr1->GetValue(ctx);
3306  ctx->StoreInst(expr1Val, expr1Ptr);
3307  }
3308 
3309  if (shortCircuit2) {
3310  llvm::Value *notTest = ctx->NotOperator(testVal);
3311  lEmitSelectExprCode(ctx, notTest, oldMask, fullMask, expr2,
3312  expr2Ptr);
3313  }
3314  else {
3315  ctx->SetInternalMaskAndNot(oldMask, testVal);
3316  llvm::Value *expr2Val = expr2->GetValue(ctx);
3317  ctx->StoreInst(expr2Val, expr2Ptr);
3318  }
3319 
3320  ctx->SetInternalMask(oldMask);
3321  llvm::Value *expr1Val = ctx->LoadInst(expr1Ptr);
3322  llvm::Value *expr2Val = ctx->LoadInst(expr2Ptr);
3323  return lEmitVaryingSelect(ctx, testVal, expr1Val, expr2Val, type);
3324  }
3325  else {
3326  // FIXME? Short-circuiting doesn't work in the case of
3327  // vector-valued test expressions. (We could also just prohibit
3328  // these and place the issue in the user's hands...)
3329  llvm::Value *testVal = test->GetValue(ctx);
3330  llvm::Value *expr1Val = expr1->GetValue(ctx);
3331  llvm::Value *expr2Val = expr2->GetValue(ctx);
3332 
3333  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
3334  const VectorType *vt = CastType<VectorType>(type);
3335  // Things that typechecking should have caught
3336  AssertPos(pos, vt != NULL);
3337  AssertPos(pos, CastType<VectorType>(testType) != NULL &&
3338  (CastType<VectorType>(testType)->GetElementCount() ==
3339  vt->GetElementCount()));
3340 
3341  // Do an element-wise select
3342  llvm::Value *result = llvm::UndefValue::get(type->LLVMType(g->ctx));
3343  for (int i = 0; i < vt->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
3344  llvm::Value *ti = ctx->ExtractInst(testVal, i);
3345  llvm::Value *e1i = ctx->ExtractInst(expr1Val, i);
3346  llvm::Value *e2i = ctx->ExtractInst(expr2Val, i);
3347  llvm::Value *sel = NULL;
3348  if (testType->IsUniformType())
3349  sel = ctx->SelectInst(ti, e1i, e2i);
3350  else
3351  sel = lEmitVaryingSelect(ctx, ti, e1i, e2i, vt->GetElementType());
3352  result = ctx->InsertInst(result, sel, i);
3353  }
3354  return result;
3355  }
3356 }
3357 
3358 
3359 const Type *
3360 SelectExpr::GetType() const {
3361  if (!test || !expr1 || !expr2)
3362  return NULL;
3363 
3364  const Type *testType = test->GetType();
3365  const Type *expr1Type = expr1->GetType();
3366  const Type *expr2Type = expr2->GetType();
3367 
3368  if (!testType || !expr1Type || !expr2Type)
3369  return NULL;
3370 
3371  bool becomesVarying = (testType->IsVaryingType() || expr1Type->IsVaryingType() ||
3372  expr2Type->IsVaryingType());
3373  // if expr1 and expr2 have different vector sizes, typechecking should fail...
3374  int testVecSize = CastType<VectorType>(testType) != NULL ?
3375  CastType<VectorType>(testType)->GetElementCount() : 0;
3376  int expr1VecSize = CastType<VectorType>(expr1Type) != NULL ?
3377  CastType<VectorType>(expr1Type)->GetElementCount() : 0;
3378  AssertPos(pos, !(testVecSize != 0 && expr1VecSize != 0 && testVecSize != expr1VecSize));
3379 
3380  int vectorSize = std::max(testVecSize, expr1VecSize);
3381  return Type::MoreGeneralType(expr1Type, expr2Type, Union(expr1->pos, expr2->pos),
3382  "select expression", becomesVarying, vectorSize);
3383 }
3384 
3385 
3386 template <typename T> Expr *
3387 lConstFoldSelect(const bool bv[], ConstExpr *constExpr1, ConstExpr *constExpr2,
3388  const Type *exprType, SourcePos pos) {
3389  T v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v2[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
3390  T result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
3391  int count = constExpr1->GetValues(v1);
3392  constExpr2->GetValues(v2);
3393  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
3394  result[i] = bv[i] ? v1[i] : v2[i];
3395  return new ConstExpr(exprType, result, pos);
3396 }
3397 
3398 
3399 Expr *
3400 SelectExpr::Optimize() {
3401  if (test == NULL || expr1 == NULL || expr2 == NULL)
3402  return NULL;
3403 
3404  ConstExpr *constTest = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(test);
3405  if (constTest == NULL)
3406  return this;
3407 
3408  // The test is a constant; see if we can resolve to one of the
3409  // expressions..
3410  bool bv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
3411  int count = constTest->GetValues(bv);
3412  if (count == 1)
3413  // Uniform test value; return the corresponding expression
3414  return (bv[0] == true) ? expr1 : expr2;
3415  else {
3416  // Varying test: see if all of the values are the same; if so, then
3417  // return the corresponding expression
3418  bool first = bv[0];
3419  bool mismatch = false;
3420  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
3421  if (bv[i] != first) {
3422  mismatch = true;
3423  break;
3424  }
3425  if (mismatch == false)
3426  return (bv[0] == true) ? expr1 : expr2;
3427 
3428  // Last chance: see if the two expressions are constants; if so,
3429  // then we can do an element-wise selection based on the constant
3430  // condition..
3431  ConstExpr *constExpr1 = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr1);
3432  ConstExpr *constExpr2 = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr2);
3433  if (constExpr1 == NULL || constExpr2 == NULL)
3434  return this;
3435 
3436  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(constExpr1->GetType(), constExpr2->GetType()));
3437  const Type *exprType = constExpr1->GetType()->GetAsNonConstType();
3438  AssertPos(pos, exprType->IsVaryingType());
3439 
3440  if (Type::Equal(exprType, AtomicType::VaryingInt8)) {
3441  return lConstFoldSelect<int8_t>(bv, constExpr1, constExpr2, exprType, pos);
3442  }
3443  else if (Type::Equal(exprType, AtomicType::VaryingUInt8)) {
3444  return lConstFoldSelect<uint8_t>(bv, constExpr1, constExpr2, exprType, pos);
3445  }
3446  else if (Type::Equal(exprType, AtomicType::VaryingInt16)) {
3447  return lConstFoldSelect<int16_t>(bv, constExpr1, constExpr2, exprType, pos);
3448  }
3449  else if (Type::Equal(exprType, AtomicType::VaryingUInt16)) {
3450  return lConstFoldSelect<uint16_t>(bv, constExpr1, constExpr2, exprType, pos);
3451  }
3452  else if (Type::Equal(exprType, AtomicType::VaryingInt32)) {
3453  return lConstFoldSelect<int32_t>(bv, constExpr1, constExpr2, exprType, pos);
3454  }
3455  else if (Type::Equal(exprType, AtomicType::VaryingUInt32)) {
3456  return lConstFoldSelect<uint32_t>(bv, constExpr1, constExpr2, exprType, pos);
3457  }
3458  else if (Type::Equal(exprType, AtomicType::VaryingInt64)) {
3459  return lConstFoldSelect<int64_t>(bv, constExpr1, constExpr2, exprType, pos);
3460  }
3461  else if (Type::Equal(exprType, AtomicType::VaryingUInt64)) {
3462  return lConstFoldSelect<uint64_t>(bv, constExpr1, constExpr2, exprType, pos);
3463  }
3464  else if (Type::Equal(exprType, AtomicType::VaryingFloat)) {
3465  return lConstFoldSelect<float>(bv, constExpr1, constExpr2, exprType, pos);
3466  }
3467  else if (Type::Equal(exprType, AtomicType::VaryingDouble)) {
3468  return lConstFoldSelect<bool>(bv, constExpr1, constExpr2, exprType, pos);
3469  }
3470  else if (Type::Equal(exprType, AtomicType::VaryingBool)) {
3471  return lConstFoldSelect<double>(bv, constExpr1, constExpr2, exprType, pos);
3472  }
3473 
3474  return this;
3475  }
3476 }
3477 
3478 
3479 Expr *
3480 SelectExpr::TypeCheck() {
3481  if (test == NULL || expr1 == NULL || expr2 == NULL)
3482  return NULL;
3483 
3484  const Type *type1 = expr1->GetType(), *type2 = expr2->GetType();
3485  if (!type1 || !type2)
3486  return NULL;
3487 
3488  if (const ArrayType *at1 = CastType<ArrayType>(type1)) {
3489  expr1 = TypeConvertExpr(expr1, PointerType::GetUniform(at1->GetBaseType()),
3490  "select");
3491  if (expr1 == NULL)
3492  return NULL;
3493  type1 = expr1->GetType();
3494  }
3495  if (const ArrayType *at2 = CastType<ArrayType>(type2)) {
3496  expr2 = TypeConvertExpr(expr2, PointerType::GetUniform(at2->GetBaseType()),
3497  "select");
3498  if (expr2 == NULL)
3499  return NULL;
3500  type2 = expr2->GetType();
3501  }
3502 
3503  const Type *testType = test->GetType();
3504  if (testType == NULL)
3505  return NULL;
3506  test = TypeConvertExpr(test, lMatchingBoolType(testType), "select");
3507  if (test == NULL)
3508  return NULL;
3509  testType = test->GetType();
3510 
3511  int testVecSize = CastType<VectorType>(testType) ?
3512  CastType<VectorType>(testType)->GetElementCount() : 0;
3513  const Type *promotedType =
3514  Type::MoreGeneralType(type1, type2, Union(expr1->pos, expr2->pos),
3515  "select expression", testType->IsVaryingType(), testVecSize);
3516  if (promotedType == NULL)
3517  return NULL;
3518 
3519  expr1 = TypeConvertExpr(expr1, promotedType, "select");
3520  expr2 = TypeConvertExpr(expr2, promotedType, "select");
3521  if (expr1 == NULL || expr2 == NULL)
3522  return NULL;
3523 
3524  return this;
3525 }
3526 
3527 
3528 int
3529 SelectExpr::EstimateCost() const {
3530  return COST_SELECT;
3531 }
3532 
3533 
3534 void
3535 SelectExpr::Print() const {
3536  if (!test || !expr1 || !expr2 || !GetType())
3537  return;
3538 
3539  printf("[%s] (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
3540  test->Print();
3541  printf(" ? ");
3542  expr1->Print();
3543  printf(" : ");
3544  expr2->Print();
3545  printf(")");
3546  pos.Print();
3547 }
3548 
3549 
3550 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3551 // FunctionCallExpr
3552 
3553 FunctionCallExpr::FunctionCallExpr(Expr *f, ExprList *a, SourcePos p,
3554  bool il, Expr *lce[3])
3555  : Expr(p), isLaunch(il) {
3556  func = f;
3557  args = a;
3558  if (lce != NULL)
3559  {
3560  launchCountExpr[0] = lce[0];
3561  launchCountExpr[1] = lce[1];
3562  launchCountExpr[2] = lce[2];
3563  }
3564  else
3565  launchCountExpr[0] = launchCountExpr[1] = launchCountExpr[2] = NULL;
3566 }
3567 
3568 
3569 static const FunctionType *
3570 lGetFunctionType(Expr *func) {
3571  if (func == NULL)
3572  return NULL;
3573 
3574  const Type *type = func->GetType();
3575  if (type == NULL)
3576  return NULL;
3577 
3578  const FunctionType *ftype = CastType<FunctionType>(type);
3579  if (ftype == NULL) {
3580  // Not a regular function symbol--is it a function pointer?
3581  if (CastType<PointerType>(type) != NULL)
3582  ftype = CastType<FunctionType>(type->GetBaseType());
3583  }
3584  return ftype;
3585 }
3586 
3587 
3588 llvm::Value *
3589 FunctionCallExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
3590  if (func == NULL || args == NULL)
3591  return NULL;
3592 
3593  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
3594 
3595  llvm::Value *callee = func->GetValue(ctx);
3596 
3597  if (callee == NULL) {
3598  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
3599  return NULL;
3600  }
3601 
3602  const FunctionType *ft = lGetFunctionType(func);
3603  AssertPos(pos, ft != NULL);
3604  bool isVoidFunc = Type::Equal(ft->GetReturnType(), AtomicType::Void);
3605 
3606  // Automatically convert function call args to references if needed.
3607  // FIXME: this should move to the TypeCheck() method... (but the
3608  // GetLValue call below needs a FunctionEmitContext, which is
3609  // problematic...)
3610  std::vector<Expr *> callargs = args->exprs;
3611  bool err = false;
3612 
3613  // Specifically, this can happen if there's an error earlier during
3614  // overload resolution.
3615  if ((int)callargs.size() > ft->GetNumParameters()) {
3616  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
3617  return NULL;
3618  }
3619 
3620  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < callargs.size(); ++i) {
3621  Expr *argExpr = callargs[i];
3622  if (argExpr == NULL)
3623  continue;
3624 
3625  const Type *paramType = ft->GetParameterType(i);
3626 
3627  const Type *argLValueType = argExpr->GetLValueType();
3628  if (argLValueType != NULL &&
3629  CastType<PointerType>(argLValueType) != NULL &&
3630  argLValueType->IsVaryingType() &&
3631  CastType<ReferenceType>(paramType) != NULL) {
3632  Error(argExpr->pos, "Illegal to pass a \"varying\" lvalue to a "
3633  "reference parameter of type \"%s\".",
3634  paramType->GetString().c_str());
3635  return NULL;
3636  }
3637 
3638  // Do whatever type conversion is needed
3639  argExpr = TypeConvertExpr(argExpr, paramType,
3640  "function call argument");
3641  if (argExpr == NULL)
3642  return NULL;
3643  callargs[i] = argExpr;
3644  }
3645  if (err)
3646  return NULL;
3647 
3648  // Fill in any default argument values needed.
3649  // FIXME: should we do this during type checking?
3650  for (int i = callargs.size(); i < ft->GetNumParameters(); ++i) {
3651  Expr *paramDefault = ft->GetParameterDefault(i);
3652  const Type *paramType = ft->GetParameterType(i);
3653  // FIXME: this type conv should happen when we create the function
3654  // type!
3655  Expr *d = TypeConvertExpr(paramDefault, paramType,
3656  "function call default argument");
3657  if (d == NULL)
3658  return NULL;
3659  callargs.push_back(d);
3660  }
3661 
3662  // Now evaluate the values of all of the parameters being passed.
3663  std::vector<llvm::Value *> argVals;
3664  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < callargs.size(); ++i) {
3665  Expr *argExpr = callargs[i];
3666  if (argExpr == NULL)
3667  // give up; we hit an error earlier
3668  return NULL;
3669 
3670  llvm::Value *argValue = argExpr->GetValue(ctx);
3671  if (argValue == NULL)
3672  // something went wrong in evaluating the argument's
3673  // expression, so give up on this
3674  return NULL;
3675 
3676  argVals.push_back(argValue);
3677  }
3678 
3679 
3680  llvm::Value *retVal = NULL;
3681  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
3682  if (ft->isTask) {
3683  AssertPos(pos, launchCountExpr[0] != NULL);
3684  llvm::Value *launchCount[3] =
3685  { launchCountExpr[0]->GetValue(ctx),
3686  launchCountExpr[1]->GetValue(ctx),
3687  launchCountExpr[2]->GetValue(ctx) };
3688 
3689  if (launchCount[0] != NULL)
3690  ctx->LaunchInst(callee, argVals, launchCount);
3691  }
3692  else
3693  retVal = ctx->CallInst(callee, ft, argVals,
3694  isVoidFunc ? "" : "calltmp");
3695 
3696  if (isVoidFunc)
3697  return NULL;
3698  else
3699  return retVal;
3700 }
3701 
3702 
3703 llvm::Value *
3704 FunctionCallExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
3705  if (GetLValueType() != NULL) {
3706  return GetValue(ctx);
3707  }
3708  else {
3709  // Only be a valid LValue type if the function
3710  // returns a pointer or reference.
3711  return NULL;
3712  }
3713 }
3714 
3715 
3716 bool FullResolveOverloads(Expr * func, ExprList * args,
3717  std::vector<const Type *> *argTypes,
3718  std::vector<bool> *argCouldBeNULL,
3719  std::vector<bool> *argIsConstant) {
3720  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < args->exprs.size(); ++i) {
3721  Expr *expr = args->exprs[i];
3722  if (expr == NULL)
3723  return false;
3724  const Type *t = expr->GetType();
3725  if (t == NULL)
3726  return false;
3727  argTypes->push_back(t);
3728  argCouldBeNULL->push_back(lIsAllIntZeros(expr) || dynamic_cast<NullPointerExpr *>(expr));
3729  argIsConstant->push_back(dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr) || dynamic_cast<NullPointerExpr *>(expr));
3730  }
3731  return true;
3732 }
3733 
3734 
3735 const Type *
3736 FunctionCallExpr::GetType() const {
3737  std::vector<const Type *> argTypes;
3738  std::vector<bool> argCouldBeNULL, argIsConstant;
3739  if (FullResolveOverloads(func, args, &argTypes, &argCouldBeNULL, &argIsConstant) == true) {
3740  FunctionSymbolExpr *fse = dynamic_cast<FunctionSymbolExpr *>(func);
3741  if (fse != NULL) {
3742  fse->ResolveOverloads(args->pos, argTypes, &argCouldBeNULL, &argIsConstant);
3743  }
3744  }
3745  const FunctionType *ftype = lGetFunctionType(func);
3746  return ftype ? ftype->GetReturnType() : NULL;
3747 }
3748 
3749 
3750 const Type *
3751 FunctionCallExpr::GetLValueType() const {
3752  const FunctionType *ftype = lGetFunctionType(func);
3753  if (ftype && (ftype->GetReturnType()->IsPointerType()
3754  || ftype->GetReturnType()->IsReferenceType())) {
3755  return ftype->GetReturnType();
3756  }
3757  else {
3758  // Only be a valid LValue type if the function
3759  // returns a pointer or reference.
3760  return NULL;
3761  }
3762 }
3763 
3764 
3765 Expr *
3766 FunctionCallExpr::Optimize() {
3767  if (func == NULL || args == NULL)
3768  return NULL;
3769  return this;
3770 }
3771 
3772 
3773 Expr *
3774 FunctionCallExpr::TypeCheck() {
3775  if (func == NULL || args == NULL)
3776  return NULL;
3777 
3778  std::vector<const Type *> argTypes;
3779  std::vector<bool> argCouldBeNULL, argIsConstant;
3780 
3781  if (FullResolveOverloads(func, args, &argTypes, &argCouldBeNULL, &argIsConstant) == false) {
3782  return NULL;
3783  }
3784 
3785  FunctionSymbolExpr *fse = dynamic_cast<FunctionSymbolExpr *>(func);
3786  if (fse != NULL) {
3787  // Regular function call
3788  if (fse->ResolveOverloads(args->pos, argTypes, &argCouldBeNULL,
3789  &argIsConstant) == false)
3790  return NULL;
3791 
3792  func = ::TypeCheck(fse);
3793  if (func == NULL)
3794  return NULL;
3795 
3796  const FunctionType *ft = CastType<FunctionType>(func->GetType());
3797  if (ft == NULL) {
3798  const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(func->GetType());
3799  ft = (pt == NULL) ? NULL :
3800  CastType<FunctionType>(pt->GetBaseType());
3801  }
3802 
3803  if (ft == NULL) {
3804  Error(pos, "Valid function name must be used for function call.");
3805  return NULL;
3806  }
3807 
3808  if (ft->isTask) {
3809  if (!isLaunch)
3810  Error(pos, "\"launch\" expression needed to call function "
3811  "with \"task\" qualifier.");
3812  for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++)
3813  {
3814  if (!launchCountExpr[k])
3815  return NULL;
3816 
3817  launchCountExpr[k] =
3818  TypeConvertExpr(launchCountExpr[k], AtomicType::UniformInt32,
3819  "task launch count");
3820  if (launchCountExpr[k] == NULL)
3821  return NULL;
3822  }
3823  }
3824  else {
3825  if (isLaunch) {
3826  Error(pos, "\"launch\" expression illegal with non-\"task\"-"
3827  "qualified function.");
3828  return NULL;
3829  }
3830  AssertPos(pos, launchCountExpr[0] == NULL);
3831  }
3832  }
3833  else {
3834  // Call through a function pointer
3835  const Type *fptrType = func->GetType();
3836  if (fptrType == NULL)
3837  return NULL;
3838 
3839  // Make sure we do in fact have a function to call
3840  const FunctionType *funcType;
3841  if (CastType<PointerType>(fptrType) == NULL ||
3842  (funcType = CastType<FunctionType>(fptrType->GetBaseType())) == NULL) {
3843  Error(func->pos, "Must provide function name or function pointer for "
3844  "function call expression.");
3845  return NULL;
3846  }
3847 
3848  // Make sure we don't have too many arguments for the function
3849  if ((int)argTypes.size() > funcType->GetNumParameters()) {
3850  Error(args->pos, "Too many parameter values provided in "
3851  "function call (%d provided, %d expected).",
3852  (int)argTypes.size(), funcType->GetNumParameters());
3853  return NULL;
3854  }
3855  // It's ok to have too few arguments, as long as the function's
3856  // default parameter values have started by the time we run out
3857  // of arguments
3858  if ((int)argTypes.size() < funcType->GetNumParameters() &&
3859  funcType->GetParameterDefault(argTypes.size()) == NULL) {
3860  Error(args->pos, "Too few parameter values provided in "
3861  "function call (%d provided, %d expected).",
3862  (int)argTypes.size(), funcType->GetNumParameters());
3863  return NULL;
3864  }
3865 
3866  // Now make sure they can all type convert to the corresponding
3867  // parameter types..
3868  for (int i = 0; i < (int)argTypes.size(); ++i) {
3869  if (i < funcType->GetNumParameters()) {
3870  // make sure it can type convert
3871  const Type *paramType = funcType->GetParameterType(i);
3872  if (CanConvertTypes(argTypes[i], paramType) == false &&
3873  !(argCouldBeNULL[i] == true &&
3874  CastType<PointerType>(paramType) != NULL)) {
3875  Error(args->exprs[i]->pos, "Can't convert argument of "
3876  "type \"%s\" to type \"%s\" for function call "
3877  "argument.", argTypes[i]->GetString().c_str(),
3878  paramType->GetString().c_str());
3879  return NULL;
3880  }
3881  }
3882  else
3883  // Otherwise the parameter default saves us. It should
3884  // be there for sure, given the check right above the
3885  // for loop.
3886  AssertPos(pos, funcType->GetParameterDefault(i) != NULL);
3887  }
3888 
3889  if (fptrType->IsVaryingType()) {
3890  const Type *retType = funcType->GetReturnType();
3891  if (Type::Equal(retType, AtomicType::Void) == false &&
3892  retType->IsUniformType()) {
3893  Error(pos, "Illegal to call a varying function pointer that "
3894  "points to a function with a uniform return type \"%s\".",
3895  funcType->GetReturnType()->GetString().c_str());
3896  return NULL;
3897  }
3898  }
3899  }
3900 
3901  if (func == NULL || args == NULL)
3902  return NULL;
3903  return this;
3904 }
3905 
3906 
3907 int
3908 FunctionCallExpr::EstimateCost() const {
3909  if (isLaunch)
3910  return COST_TASK_LAUNCH;
3911 
3912  const Type *type = func->GetType();
3913  if (type == NULL)
3914  return 0;
3915 
3916  const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(type);
3917  if (pt != NULL)
3918  type = type->GetBaseType();
3919  const FunctionType *ftype = CastType<FunctionType>(type);
3920 
3921  if (ftype->costOverride > -1)
3922  return ftype->costOverride;
3923 
3924  if (pt != NULL)
3925  return pt->IsUniformType() ? COST_FUNPTR_UNIFORM : COST_FUNPTR_VARYING;
3926  else
3927  return COST_FUNCALL;
3928 }
3929 
3930 
3931 void
3932 FunctionCallExpr::Print() const {
3933  if (!func || !args || !GetType())
3934  return;
3935 
3936  printf("[%s] funcall %s ", GetType()->GetString().c_str(),
3937  isLaunch ? "launch" : "");
3938  func->Print();
3939  printf(" args (");
3940  args->Print();
3941  printf(")");
3942  pos.Print();
3943 }
3944 
3945 
3946 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3947 // ExprList
3948 
3949 llvm::Value *
3950 ExprList::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
3951  FATAL("ExprList::GetValue() should never be called");
3952  return NULL;
3953 }
3954 
3955 
3956 const Type *
3957 ExprList::GetType() const {
3958  FATAL("ExprList::GetType() should never be called");
3959  return NULL;
3960 }
3961 
3962 
3963 ExprList *
3964 ExprList::Optimize() {
3965  return this;
3966 }
3967 
3968 
3969 ExprList *
3970 ExprList::TypeCheck() {
3971  return this;
3972 }
3973 
3974 
3975 llvm::Constant *
3976 ExprList::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
3977  if (exprs.size() == 1 &&
3978  (CastType<AtomicType>(type) != NULL ||
3979  CastType<EnumType>(type) != NULL ||
3980  CastType<PointerType>(type) != NULL))
3981  return exprs[0]->GetConstant(type);
3982 
3983  const CollectionType *collectionType = CastType<CollectionType>(type);
3984  if (collectionType == NULL)
3985  return NULL;
3986 
3987  std::string name;
3988  if (CastType<StructType>(type) != NULL)
3989  name = "struct";
3990  else if (CastType<ArrayType>(type) != NULL)
3991  name = "array";
3992  else if (CastType<VectorType>(type) != NULL)
3993  name = "vector";
3994  else
3995  FATAL("Unexpected CollectionType in ExprList::GetConstant()");
3996 
3997  if ((int)exprs.size() > collectionType->GetElementCount()) {
3998  Error(pos, "Initializer list for %s \"%s\" must have no more than %d "
3999  "elements (has %d).", name.c_str(),
4000  collectionType->GetString().c_str(),
4001  collectionType->GetElementCount(), (int)exprs.size());
4002  return NULL;
4003  }
4004 
4005  std::vector<llvm::Constant *> cv;
4006  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < exprs.size(); ++i) {
4007  if (exprs[i] == NULL)
4008  return NULL;
4009  const Type *elementType = collectionType->GetElementType(i);
4010 
4011  Expr *expr = exprs[i];
4012  if (dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(expr) == NULL) {
4013  // If there's a simple type conversion from the type of this
4014  // expression to the type we need, then let the regular type
4015  // conversion machinery handle it.
4016  expr = TypeConvertExpr(exprs[i], elementType, "initializer list");
4017  if (expr == NULL) {
4018  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4019  return NULL;
4020  }
4021  // Re-establish const-ness if possible
4022  expr = ::Optimize(expr);
4023  }
4024 
4025  llvm::Constant *c = expr->GetConstant(elementType);
4026  if (c == NULL)
4027  // If this list element couldn't convert to the right constant
4028  // type for the corresponding collection member, then give up.
4029  return NULL;
4030  cv.push_back(c);
4031  }
4032 
4033  // If there are too few, then treat missing ones as if they were zero
4034  for (int i = (int)exprs.size(); i < collectionType->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
4035  const Type *elementType = collectionType->GetElementType(i);
4036  if (elementType == NULL) {
4037  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4038  return NULL;
4039  }
4040 
4041  llvm::Type *llvmType = elementType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
4042  if (llvmType == NULL) {
4043  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4044  return NULL;
4045  }
4046 
4047  llvm::Constant *c = llvm::Constant::getNullValue(llvmType);
4048  cv.push_back(c);
4049  }
4050 
4051  if (CastType<StructType>(type) != NULL) {
4052  llvm::StructType *llvmStructType =
4053  llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::StructType>(collectionType->LLVMType(g->ctx));
4054  AssertPos(pos, llvmStructType != NULL);
4055  return llvm::ConstantStruct::get(llvmStructType, cv);
4056  }
4057  else {
4058  llvm::Type *lt = type->LLVMType(g->ctx);
4059  llvm::ArrayType *lat =
4060  llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ArrayType>(lt);
4061  if (lat != NULL)
4062  return llvm::ConstantArray::get(lat, cv);
4063  else {
4064  // uniform short vector type
4065  AssertPos(pos, type->IsUniformType() &&
4066  CastType<VectorType>(type) != NULL);
4067 
4068  llvm::VectorType *lvt =
4069  llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::VectorType>(lt);
4070  AssertPos(pos, lvt != NULL);
4071 
4072  // Uniform short vectors are stored as vectors of length
4073  // rounded up to the native vector width. So we add additional
4074  // undef values here until we get the right size.
4075  int vectorWidth = g->target->getNativeVectorWidth();
4076  const VectorType *vt = CastType<VectorType>(type);
4077  const AtomicType *bt = vt->GetElementType();
4078 
4079  if (Type::Equal(bt->GetAsUniformType(), AtomicType::UniformInt64) ||
4080  Type::Equal(bt->GetAsUniformType(), AtomicType::UniformUInt64) ||
4081  Type::Equal(bt->GetAsUniformType(), AtomicType::UniformDouble)) {
4082  // target.nativeVectorWidth should be in terms of 32-bit
4083  // values, so for the 64-bit guys, it takes half as many of
4084  // them to fill the native width
4085  vectorWidth /= 2;
4086  }
4087 
4088  while ((cv.size() % vectorWidth) != 0) {
4089  cv.push_back(llvm::UndefValue::get(lvt->getElementType()));
4090  }
4091 
4092  return llvm::ConstantVector::get(cv);
4093  }
4094  }
4095  return NULL;
4096 }
4097 
4098 
4099 int
4100 ExprList::EstimateCost() const {
4101  return 0;
4102 }
4103 
4104 
4105 void
4106 ExprList::Print() const {
4107  printf("expr list (");
4108  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < exprs.size(); ++i) {
4109  if (exprs[i] != NULL)
4110  exprs[i]->Print();
4111  printf("%s", (i == exprs.size() - 1) ? ")" : ", ");
4112  }
4113  pos.Print();
4114 }
4115 
4116 
4117 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4118 // IndexExpr
4119 
4120 IndexExpr::IndexExpr(Expr *a, Expr *i, SourcePos p)
4121  : Expr(p) {
4122  baseExpr = a;
4123  index = i;
4124  type = lvalueType = NULL;
4125 }
4126 
4127 
4128 /** When computing pointer values, we need to apply a per-lane offset when
4129  we have a varying pointer that is itself indexing into varying data.
4130  Consdier the following ispc code:
4131 
4132  uniform float u[] = ...;
4133  float v[] = ...;
4134  int index = ...;
4135  float a = u[index];
4136  float b = v[index];
4137 
4138  To compute the varying pointer that holds the addresses to load from
4139  for u[index], we basically just need to multiply index element-wise by
4140  sizeof(float) before doing the memory load. For v[index], we need to
4141  do the same scaling but also need to add per-lane offsets <0,
4142  sizeof(float), 2*sizeof(float), ...> so that the i'th lane loads the
4143  i'th of the varying values at its index value.
4144 
4145  This function handles figuring out when this additional offset is
4146  needed and then incorporates it in the varying pointer value.
4147  */
4148 static llvm::Value *
4149 lAddVaryingOffsetsIfNeeded(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *ptr,
4150  const Type *ptrRefType) {
4151  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(ptrRefType) != NULL)
4152  // References are uniform pointers, so no offsetting is needed
4153  return ptr;
4154 
4155  const PointerType *ptrType = CastType<PointerType>(ptrRefType);
4156  Assert(ptrType != NULL);
4157  if (ptrType->IsUniformType() || ptrType->IsSlice())
4158  return ptr;
4159 
4160  const Type *baseType = ptrType->GetBaseType();
4161  if (baseType->IsVaryingType() == false)
4162  return ptr;
4163 
4164  // must be indexing into varying atomic, enum, or pointer types
4165  if (Type::IsBasicType(baseType) == false)
4166  return ptr;
4167 
4168  // Onward: compute the per lane offsets.
4169  llvm::Value *varyingOffsets = ctx->ProgramIndexVector();
4170 
4171  // And finally add the per-lane offsets. Note that we lie to the GEP
4172  // call and tell it that the pointers are to uniform elements and not
4173  // varying elements, so that the offsets in terms of (0,1,2,...) will
4174  // end up turning into the correct step in bytes...
4175  const Type *uniformElementType = baseType->GetAsUniformType();
4176  const Type *ptrUnifType = PointerType::GetVarying(uniformElementType);
4177  return ctx->GetElementPtrInst(ptr, varyingOffsets, ptrUnifType);
4178 }
4179 
4180 
4181 /** Check to see if the given type is an array of or pointer to a varying
4182  struct type that in turn has a member with bound 'uniform' variability.
4183  Issue an error and return true if such a member is found.
4184  */
4185 static bool
4186 lVaryingStructHasUniformMember(const Type *type, SourcePos pos) {
4187  if (CastType<VectorType>(type) != NULL ||
4188  CastType<ReferenceType>(type) != NULL)
4189  return false;
4190 
4191  const StructType *st = CastType<StructType>(type);
4192  if (st == NULL) {
4193  const ArrayType *at = CastType<ArrayType>(type);
4194  if (at != NULL)
4195  st = CastType<StructType>(at->GetElementType());
4196  else {
4197  const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(type);
4198  if (pt == NULL)
4199  return false;
4200 
4201  st = CastType<StructType>(pt->GetBaseType());
4202  }
4203 
4204  if (st == NULL)
4205  return false;
4206  }
4207 
4208  if (st->IsVaryingType() == false)
4209  return false;
4210 
4211  for (int i = 0; i < st->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
4212  const Type *eltType = st->GetElementType(i);
4213  if (eltType == NULL) {
4214  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4215  continue;
4216  }
4217 
4218  if (CastType<StructType>(eltType) != NULL) {
4219  // We know that the enclosing struct is varying at this point,
4220  // so push that down to the enclosed struct before makign the
4221  // recursive call.
4222  eltType = eltType->GetAsVaryingType();
4223  if (lVaryingStructHasUniformMember(eltType, pos))
4224  return true;
4225  }
4226  else if (eltType->IsUniformType()) {
4227  Error(pos, "Gather operation is impossible due to the presence of "
4228  "struct member \"%s\" with uniform type \"%s\" in the "
4229  "varying struct type \"%s\".",
4230  st->GetElementName(i).c_str(), eltType->GetString().c_str(),
4231  st->GetString().c_str());
4232  return true;
4233  }
4234  }
4235 
4236  return false;
4237 }
4238 
4239 
4240 llvm::Value *
4241 IndexExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
4242  const Type *indexType, *returnType;
4243  if (baseExpr == NULL || index == NULL ||
4244  ((indexType = index->GetType()) == NULL) ||
4245  ((returnType = GetType()) == NULL)) {
4246  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4247  return NULL;
4248  }
4249 
4250  // If this is going to be a gather, make sure that the varying return
4251  // type can represent the result (i.e. that we don't have a bound
4252  // 'uniform' member in a varying struct...)
4253  if (indexType->IsVaryingType() &&
4254  lVaryingStructHasUniformMember(returnType, pos))
4255  return NULL;
4256 
4257  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
4258 
4259  llvm::Value *ptr = GetLValue(ctx);
4260  llvm::Value *mask = NULL;
4261  const Type *lvType = GetLValueType();
4262  if (ptr == NULL) {
4263  // We may be indexing into a temporary that hasn't hit memory, so
4264  // get the full value and stuff it into temporary alloca'd space so
4265  // that we can index from there...
4266  const Type *baseExprType = baseExpr->GetType();
4267  llvm::Value *val = baseExpr->GetValue(ctx);
4268  if (baseExprType == NULL || val == NULL) {
4269  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4270  return NULL;
4271  }
4272  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
4273  llvm::Value *tmpPtr = ctx->AllocaInst(baseExprType->LLVMType(g->ctx),
4274  "array_tmp");
4275  ctx->StoreInst(val, tmpPtr);
4276 
4277  // Get a pointer type to the underlying elements
4278  const SequentialType *st = CastType<SequentialType>(baseExprType);
4279  if (st == NULL) {
4280  Assert(m->errorCount > 0);
4281  return NULL;
4282  }
4283  lvType = PointerType::GetUniform(st->GetElementType());
4284 
4285  // And do the indexing calculation into the temporary array in memory
4286  ptr = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(tmpPtr, LLVMInt32(0), index->GetValue(ctx),
4287  PointerType::GetUniform(baseExprType));
4288  ptr = lAddVaryingOffsetsIfNeeded(ctx, ptr, lvType);
4289 
4290  mask = LLVMMaskAllOn;
4291  }
4292  else {
4293  Symbol *baseSym = GetBaseSymbol();
4294  if (dynamic_cast<FunctionCallExpr *>(baseExpr) == NULL &&
4295  dynamic_cast<BinaryExpr *>(baseExpr) == NULL) {
4296  // Don't check if we're doing a function call or pointer arith
4297  AssertPos(pos, baseSym != NULL);
4298  }
4299  mask = lMaskForSymbol(baseSym, ctx);
4300  }
4301 
4302  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
4303  return ctx->LoadInst(ptr, mask, lvType);
4304 }
4305 
4306 
4307 const Type *
4308 IndexExpr::GetType() const {
4309  if (type != NULL)
4310  return type;
4311 
4312  const Type *baseExprType, *indexType;
4313  if (!baseExpr || !index ||
4314  ((baseExprType = baseExpr->GetType()) == NULL) ||
4315  ((indexType = index->GetType()) == NULL))
4316  return NULL;
4317 
4318  const Type *elementType = NULL;
4319  const PointerType *pointerType = CastType<PointerType>(baseExprType);
4320  if (pointerType != NULL)
4321  // ptr[index] -> type that the pointer points to
4322  elementType = pointerType->GetBaseType();
4323  else {
4324  // sequential type[index] -> element type of the sequential type
4325  const SequentialType *sequentialType =
4326  CastType<SequentialType>(baseExprType->GetReferenceTarget());
4327  // Typechecking should have caught this...
4328  AssertPos(pos, sequentialType != NULL);
4329  elementType = sequentialType->GetElementType();
4330  }
4331 
4332  // If we're indexing into a sequence of SOA types, the result type is
4333  // actually the underlying type, as a uniform or varying. Get the
4334  // uniform variant of it for starters, then below we'll make it varying
4335  // if the index is varying.
4336  // (If we ever provide a way to index into SOA types and get an entire
4337  // SOA'd struct out of the array, then we won't want to do this in that
4338  // case..)
4339  if (elementType->IsSOAType())
4340  elementType = elementType->GetAsUniformType();
4341 
4342  // If either the index is varying or we're indexing into a varying
4343  // pointer, then the result type is the varying variant of the indexed
4344  // type.
4345  if (indexType->IsUniformType() &&
4346  (pointerType == NULL || pointerType->IsUniformType()))
4347  type = elementType;
4348  else
4349  type = elementType->GetAsVaryingType();
4350 
4351  return type;
4352 }
4353 
4354 
4355 Symbol *
4356 IndexExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
4357  return baseExpr ? baseExpr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
4358 }
4359 
4360 
4361 /** Utility routine that takes a regualr pointer (either uniform or
4362  varying) and returns a slice pointer with zero offsets.
4363  */
4364 static llvm::Value *
4365 lConvertToSlicePointer(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *ptr,
4366  const PointerType *slicePtrType) {
4367  llvm::Type *llvmSlicePtrType =
4368  slicePtrType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
4369  llvm::StructType *sliceStructType =
4370  llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::StructType>(llvmSlicePtrType);
4371  Assert(sliceStructType != NULL &&
4372  sliceStructType->getElementType(0) == ptr->getType());
4373 
4374  // Get a null-initialized struct to take care of having zeros for the
4375  // offsets
4376  llvm::Value *result = llvm::Constant::getNullValue(sliceStructType);
4377  // And replace the pointer in the struct with the given pointer
4378  return ctx->InsertInst(result, ptr, 0, LLVMGetName(ptr, "_slice"));
4379 }
4380 
4381 
4382 /** If the given array index is a compile time constant, check to see if it
4383  value/values don't go past the end of the array; issue a warning if
4384  so.
4385 */
4386 static void
4387 lCheckIndicesVersusBounds(const Type *baseExprType, Expr *index) {
4388  const SequentialType *seqType = CastType<SequentialType>(baseExprType);
4389  if (seqType == NULL)
4390  return;
4391 
4392  int nElements = seqType->GetElementCount();
4393  if (nElements == 0)
4394  // Unsized array...
4395  return;
4396 
4397  // If it's an array of soa<> items, then the number of elements to
4398  // worry about w.r.t. index values is the product of the array size and
4399  // the soa width.
4400  int soaWidth = seqType->GetElementType()->GetSOAWidth();
4401  if (soaWidth > 0)
4402  nElements *= soaWidth;
4403 
4404  ConstExpr *ce = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(index);
4405  if (ce == NULL)
4406  return;
4407 
4408  int32_t indices[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
4409  int count = ce->GetValues(indices);
4410  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i) {
4411  if (indices[i] < 0 || indices[i] >= nElements)
4412  Warning(index->pos, "Array index \"%d\" may be out of bounds for %d "
4413  "element array.", indices[i], nElements);
4414  }
4415 }
4416 
4417 
4418 /** Converts the given pointer value to a slice pointer if the pointer
4419  points to SOA'ed data.
4420 */
4421 static llvm::Value *
4422 lConvertPtrToSliceIfNeeded(FunctionEmitContext *ctx,
4423  llvm::Value *ptr, const Type **type) {
4424  Assert(*type != NULL);
4425  const PointerType *ptrType = CastType<PointerType>(*type);
4426  bool convertToSlice = (ptrType->GetBaseType()->IsSOAType() &&
4427  ptrType->IsSlice() == false);
4428  if (convertToSlice == false)
4429  return ptr;
4430 
4431  *type = ptrType->GetAsSlice();
4432  return lConvertToSlicePointer(ctx, ptr, ptrType->GetAsSlice());
4433 }
4434 
4435 
4436 llvm::Value *
4437 IndexExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
4438  const Type *baseExprType;
4439  if (baseExpr == NULL || index == NULL ||
4440  ((baseExprType = baseExpr->GetType()) == NULL)) {
4441  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4442  return NULL;
4443  }
4444 
4445  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
4446  llvm::Value *indexValue = index->GetValue(ctx);
4447  if (indexValue == NULL) {
4448  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4449  return NULL;
4450  }
4451 
4452  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
4453  if (CastType<PointerType>(baseExprType) != NULL) {
4454  // We're indexing off of a pointer
4455  llvm::Value *basePtrValue = baseExpr->GetValue(ctx);
4456  if (basePtrValue == NULL) {
4457  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4458  return NULL;
4459  }
4460  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
4461 
4462  // Convert to a slice pointer if we're indexing into SOA data
4463  basePtrValue = lConvertPtrToSliceIfNeeded(ctx, basePtrValue,
4464  &baseExprType);
4465 
4466  llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(basePtrValue, indexValue,
4467  baseExprType,
4468  LLVMGetName(basePtrValue, "_offset"));
4469  return lAddVaryingOffsetsIfNeeded(ctx, ptr, GetLValueType());
4470  }
4471 
4472  // Not a pointer: we must be indexing an array or vector (and possibly
4473  // a reference thereuponfore.)
4474  llvm::Value *basePtr = NULL;
4475  const PointerType *basePtrType = NULL;
4476  if (CastType<ArrayType>(baseExprType) ||
4477  CastType<VectorType>(baseExprType)) {
4478  basePtr = baseExpr->GetLValue(ctx);
4479  basePtrType = CastType<PointerType>(baseExpr->GetLValueType());
4480  if (baseExpr->GetLValueType()) AssertPos(pos, basePtrType != NULL);
4481  }
4482  else {
4483  baseExprType = baseExprType->GetReferenceTarget();
4484  AssertPos(pos, CastType<ArrayType>(baseExprType) ||
4485  CastType<VectorType>(baseExprType));
4486  basePtr = baseExpr->GetValue(ctx);
4487  basePtrType = PointerType::GetUniform(baseExprType);
4488  }
4489  if (!basePtr)
4490  return NULL;
4491 
4492  // If possible, check the index value(s) against the size of the array
4493  lCheckIndicesVersusBounds(baseExprType, index);
4494 
4495  // Convert to a slice pointer if indexing into SOA data
4496  basePtr = lConvertPtrToSliceIfNeeded(ctx, basePtr,
4497  (const Type **)&basePtrType);
4498 
4499  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
4500 
4501  // And do the actual indexing calculation..
4502  llvm::Value *ptr =
4503  ctx->GetElementPtrInst(basePtr, LLVMInt32(0), indexValue,
4504  basePtrType, LLVMGetName(basePtr, "_offset"));
4505  return lAddVaryingOffsetsIfNeeded(ctx, ptr, GetLValueType());
4506 }
4507 
4508 
4509 const Type *
4510 IndexExpr::GetLValueType() const {
4511  if (lvalueType != NULL)
4512  return lvalueType;
4513 
4514  const Type *baseExprType, *baseExprLValueType, *indexType;
4515  if (baseExpr == NULL || index == NULL ||
4516  ((baseExprType = baseExpr->GetType()) == NULL) ||
4517  ((baseExprLValueType = baseExpr->GetLValueType()) == NULL) ||
4518  ((indexType = index->GetType()) == NULL))
4519  return NULL;
4520 
4521  // regularize to a PointerType
4522  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(baseExprLValueType) != NULL) {
4523  const Type *refTarget = baseExprLValueType->GetReferenceTarget();
4524  baseExprLValueType = PointerType::GetUniform(refTarget);
4525  }
4526  AssertPos(pos, CastType<PointerType>(baseExprLValueType) != NULL);
4527 
4528  // Find the type of thing that we're indexing into
4529  const Type *elementType;
4530  const SequentialType *st =
4531  CastType<SequentialType>(baseExprLValueType->GetBaseType());
4532  if (st != NULL)
4533  elementType = st->GetElementType();
4534  else {
4535  const PointerType *pt =
4536  CastType<PointerType>(baseExprLValueType->GetBaseType());
4537  // This assertion seems overly strict.
4538  // Why does it need to be a pointer to a pointer?
4539  // AssertPos(pos, pt != NULL);
4540 
4541  if (pt != NULL) {
4542  elementType = pt->GetBaseType();
4543  }
4544  else {
4545  elementType = baseExprLValueType->GetBaseType();
4546  }
4547  }
4548 
4549  // Are we indexing into a varying type, or are we indexing with a
4550  // varying pointer?
4551  bool baseVarying;
4552  if (CastType<PointerType>(baseExprType) != NULL)
4553  baseVarying = baseExprType->IsVaryingType();
4554  else
4555  baseVarying = baseExprLValueType->IsVaryingType();
4556 
4557  // The return type is uniform iff. the base is a uniform pointer / a
4558  // collection of uniform typed elements and the index is uniform.
4559  if (baseVarying == false && indexType->IsUniformType())
4560  lvalueType = PointerType::GetUniform(elementType);
4561  else
4562  lvalueType = PointerType::GetVarying(elementType);
4563 
4564  // Finally, if we're indexing into an SOA type, then the resulting
4565  // pointer must (currently) be a slice pointer; we don't allow indexing
4566  // the soa-width-wide structs directly.
4567  if (elementType->IsSOAType())
4568  lvalueType = lvalueType->GetAsSlice();
4569 
4570  return lvalueType;
4571 }
4572 
4573 
4574 Expr *
4575 IndexExpr::Optimize() {
4576  if (baseExpr == NULL || index == NULL)
4577  return NULL;
4578  return this;
4579 }
4580 
4581 
4582 Expr *
4583 IndexExpr::TypeCheck() {
4584  const Type *indexType;
4585  if (baseExpr == NULL || index == NULL ||
4586  ((indexType = index->GetType()) == NULL)) {
4587  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4588  return NULL;
4589  }
4590 
4591  const Type *baseExprType = baseExpr->GetType();
4592  if (baseExprType == NULL) {
4593  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4594  return NULL;
4595  }
4596 
4597  if (!CastType<SequentialType>(baseExprType->GetReferenceTarget())) {
4598  if (const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(baseExprType)) {
4599  if (Type::Equal(AtomicType::Void, pt->GetBaseType())) {
4600  Error(pos, "Illegal to dereference void pointer type \"%s\".",
4601  baseExprType->GetString().c_str());
4602  return NULL;
4603  }
4604  }
4605  else {
4606  Error(pos, "Trying to index into non-array, vector, or pointer "
4607  "type \"%s\".", baseExprType->GetString().c_str());
4608  return NULL;
4609  }
4610  }
4611 
4612  bool isUniform = (index->GetType()->IsUniformType() &&
4613  !g->opt.disableUniformMemoryOptimizations);
4614 
4615  if (!isUniform) {
4616  // Unless we have an explicit 64-bit index and are compiling to a
4617  // 64-bit target with 64-bit addressing, convert the index to an int32
4618  // type.
4619  // The range of varying index is limited to [0,2^31) as a result.
4620  if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(indexType->GetAsUniformType(),
4621  AtomicType::UniformInt64) == false ||
4622  g->target->is32Bit() ||
4623  g->opt.force32BitAddressing) {
4624  const Type *indexType = AtomicType::VaryingInt32;
4625  index = TypeConvertExpr(index, indexType, "array index");
4626  if (index == NULL)
4627  return NULL;
4628  }
4629  } else { // isUniform
4630  // For 32-bit target:
4631  // force the index to 32 bit.
4632  // For 64-bit target:
4633  // We don't want to limit the index range.
4634  // We sxt/zxt the index to 64 bit right here because
4635  // LLVM doesn't distinguish unsigned from signed (both are i32)
4636  //
4637  // However, the index can be still truncated to signed int32 if
4638  // the index type is 64 bit and --addressing=32.
4639  bool force_32bit = g->target->is32Bit() ||
4640  (g->opt.force32BitAddressing &&
4641  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(indexType->GetAsUniformType(),
4642  AtomicType::UniformInt64));
4643  const Type *indexType = force_32bit ?
4644  AtomicType::UniformInt32 : AtomicType::UniformInt64;
4645  index = TypeConvertExpr(index, indexType, "array index");
4646  if (index == NULL)
4647  return NULL;
4648  }
4649 
4650  return this;
4651 }
4652 
4653 
4654 int
4655 IndexExpr::EstimateCost() const {
4656  if (index == NULL || baseExpr == NULL)
4657  return 0;
4658 
4659  const Type *indexType = index->GetType();
4660  const Type *baseExprType = baseExpr->GetType();
4661 
4662  if ((indexType != NULL && indexType->IsVaryingType()) ||
4663  (CastType<PointerType>(baseExprType) != NULL &&
4664  baseExprType->IsVaryingType()))
4665  // be pessimistic; some of these will later turn out to be vector
4666  // loads/stores, but it's too early for us to know that here.
4667  return COST_GATHER;
4668  else
4669  return COST_LOAD;
4670 }
4671 
4672 
4673 void
4674 IndexExpr::Print() const {
4675  if (!baseExpr || !index || !GetType())
4676  return;
4677 
4678  printf("[%s] index ", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
4679  baseExpr->Print();
4680  printf("[");
4681  index->Print();
4682  printf("]");
