4683  pos.Print();
4684 }
4685 
4686 
4687 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4688 // MemberExpr
4689 
4690 /** Map one character ids to vector element numbers. Allow a few different
4691  conventions--xyzw, rgba, uv.
4692 */
4693 static int
4694 lIdentifierToVectorElement(char id) {
4695  switch (id) {
4696  case 'x':
4697  case 'r':
4698  case 'u':
4699  return 0;
4700  case 'y':
4701  case 'g':
4702  case 'v':
4703  return 1;
4704  case 'z':
4705  case 'b':
4706  return 2;
4707  case 'w':
4708  case 'a':
4709  return 3;
4710  default:
4711  return -1;
4712  }
4713 }
4714 
4715 //////////////////////////////////////////////////
4716 // StructMemberExpr
4717 
4718 class StructMemberExpr : public MemberExpr
4719 {
4720 public:
4721  StructMemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p,
4722  SourcePos idpos, bool derefLValue);
4723 
4724  const Type *GetType() const;
4725  const Type *GetLValueType() const;
4726  int getElementNumber() const;
4727  const Type *getElementType() const;
4728 
4729 private:
4730  const StructType *getStructType() const;
4731 };
4732 
4733 
4734 StructMemberExpr::StructMemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p,
4735  SourcePos idpos, bool derefLValue)
4736  : MemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos, derefLValue) {
4737 }
4738 
4739 
4740 const Type *
4741 StructMemberExpr::GetType() const {
4742  if (type != NULL)
4743  return type;
4744 
4745  // It's a struct, and the result type is the element type, possibly
4746  // promoted to varying if the struct type / lvalue is varying.
4747  const Type *exprType, *lvalueType;
4748  const StructType *structType;
4749  if (expr == NULL ||
4750  ((exprType = expr->GetType()) == NULL) ||
4751  ((structType = getStructType()) == NULL) ||
4752  ((lvalueType = GetLValueType()) == NULL)) {
4753  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4754  return NULL;
4755  }
4756 
4757  const Type *elementType = structType->GetElementType(identifier);
4758  if (elementType == NULL) {
4759  Error(identifierPos,
4760  "Element name \"%s\" not present in struct type \"%s\".%s",
4761  identifier.c_str(), structType->GetString().c_str(),
4762  getCandidateNearMatches().c_str());
4763  return NULL;
4764  }
4765  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(lvalueType->GetBaseType(), elementType));
4766 
4767  bool isSlice = (CastType<PointerType>(lvalueType) &&
4768  CastType<PointerType>(lvalueType)->IsSlice());
4769  if (isSlice) {
4770  // FIXME: not true if we allow bound unif/varying for soa<>
4771  // structs?...
4772  AssertPos(pos, elementType->IsSOAType());
4773 
4774  // If we're accessing a member of an soa structure via a uniform
4775  // slice pointer, then the result type is the uniform variant of
4776  // the element type.
4777  if (lvalueType->IsUniformType())
4778  elementType = elementType->GetAsUniformType();
4779  }
4780 
4781  if (lvalueType->IsVaryingType())
4782  // If the expression we're getting the member of has an lvalue that
4783  // is a varying pointer type (be it slice or non-slice), then the
4784  // result type must be the varying version of the element type.
4785  elementType = elementType->GetAsVaryingType();
4786 
4787  type = elementType;
4788  return type;
4789 }
4790 
4791 
4792 const Type *
4793 StructMemberExpr::GetLValueType() const {
4794  if (lvalueType != NULL)
4795  return lvalueType;
4796 
4797  if (expr == NULL) {
4798  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4799  return NULL;
4800  }
4801 
4802  const Type *exprLValueType = dereferenceExpr ? expr->GetType() :
4803  expr->GetLValueType();
4804  if (exprLValueType == NULL) {
4805  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4806  return NULL;
4807  }
4808 
4809  // The pointer type is varying if the lvalue type of the expression is
4810  // varying (and otherwise uniform)
4811  const PointerType *ptrType =
4812  (exprLValueType->IsUniformType() ||
4813  CastType<ReferenceType>(exprLValueType) != NULL) ?
4814  PointerType::GetUniform(getElementType()) :
4815  PointerType::GetVarying(getElementType());
4816 
4817  // If struct pointer is a slice pointer, the resulting member pointer
4818  // needs to be a frozen slice pointer--i.e. any further indexing with
4819  // the result shouldn't modify the minor slice offset, but it should be
4820  // left unchanged until we get to a leaf SOA value.
4821  if (CastType<PointerType>(exprLValueType) &&
4822  CastType<PointerType>(exprLValueType)->IsSlice())
4823  ptrType = ptrType->GetAsFrozenSlice();
4824 
4825  lvalueType = ptrType;
4826  return lvalueType;
4827 }
4828 
4829 
4830 int
4831 StructMemberExpr::getElementNumber() const {
4832  const StructType *structType = getStructType();
4833  if (structType == NULL)
4834  return -1;
4835 
4836  int elementNumber = structType->GetElementNumber(identifier);
4837  if (elementNumber == -1)
4838  Error(identifierPos,
4839  "Element name \"%s\" not present in struct type \"%s\".%s",
4840  identifier.c_str(), structType->GetString().c_str(),
4841  getCandidateNearMatches().c_str());
4842 
4843  return elementNumber;
4844 }
4845 
4846 
4847 const Type *
4848 StructMemberExpr::getElementType() const {
4849  const StructType *structType = getStructType();
4850  if (structType == NULL)
4851  return NULL;
4852 
4853  return structType->GetElementType(identifier);
4854 }
4855 
4856 
4857 /** Returns the type of the underlying struct that we're returning a member
4858  of. */
4859 const StructType *
4860 StructMemberExpr::getStructType() const {
4861  const Type *type = dereferenceExpr ? expr->GetType() :
4862  expr->GetLValueType();
4863  if (type == NULL)
4864  return NULL;
4865 
4866  const Type *structType;
4867  const ReferenceType *rt = CastType<ReferenceType>(type);
4868  if (rt != NULL)
4869  structType = rt->GetReferenceTarget();
4870  else {
4871  const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(type);
4872  AssertPos(pos, pt != NULL);
4873  structType = pt->GetBaseType();
4874  }
4875 
4876  const StructType *ret = CastType<StructType>(structType);
4877  AssertPos(pos, ret != NULL);
4878  return ret;
4879 }
4880 
4881 
4882 //////////////////////////////////////////////////
4883 // VectorMemberExpr
4884 
4885 class VectorMemberExpr : public MemberExpr
4886 {
4887 public:
4888  VectorMemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p,
4889  SourcePos idpos, bool derefLValue);
4890 
4891  llvm::Value *GetValue(FunctionEmitContext* ctx) const;
4892  llvm::Value *GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext* ctx) const;
4893  const Type *GetType() const;
4894  const Type *GetLValueType() const;
4895 
4896  int getElementNumber() const;
4897  const Type *getElementType() const;
4898 
4899 private:
4900  const VectorType *exprVectorType;
4901  const VectorType *memberType;
4902 };
4903 
4904 
4905 VectorMemberExpr::VectorMemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p,
4906  SourcePos idpos, bool derefLValue)
4907  : MemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos, derefLValue) {
4908  const Type *exprType = e->GetType();
4909  exprVectorType = CastType<VectorType>(exprType);
4910  if (exprVectorType == NULL) {
4911  const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(exprType);
4912  if (pt != NULL)
4913  exprVectorType = CastType<VectorType>(pt->GetBaseType());
4914  else {
4915  AssertPos(pos, CastType<ReferenceType>(exprType) != NULL);
4916  exprVectorType =
4917  CastType<VectorType>(exprType->GetReferenceTarget());
4918  }
4919  AssertPos(pos, exprVectorType != NULL);
4920  }
4921  memberType = new VectorType(exprVectorType->GetElementType(),
4922  identifier.length());
4923 }
4924 
4925 
4926 const Type *
4927 VectorMemberExpr::GetType() const {
4928  if (type != NULL)
4929  return type;
4930 
4931  // For 1-element expressions, we have the base vector element
4932  // type. For n-element expressions, we have a shortvec type
4933  // with n > 1 elements. This can be changed when we get
4934  // type<1> -> type conversions.
4935  type = (identifier.length() == 1) ?
4936  (const Type *)exprVectorType->GetElementType() :
4937  (const Type *)memberType;
4938 
4939  const Type *lvType = GetLValueType();
4940  if (lvType != NULL) {
4941  bool isSlice = (CastType<PointerType>(lvType) &&
4942  CastType<PointerType>(lvType)->IsSlice());
4943  if (isSlice) {
4944 //CO AssertPos(pos, type->IsSOAType());
4945  if (lvType->IsUniformType())
4946  type = type->GetAsUniformType();
4947  }
4948 
4949  if (lvType->IsVaryingType())
4950  type = type->GetAsVaryingType();
4951  }
4952 
4953  return type;
4954 }
4955 
4956 
4957 llvm::Value *
4958 VectorMemberExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext* ctx) const {
4959  if (identifier.length() == 1) {
4960  return MemberExpr::GetLValue(ctx);
4961  } else {
4962  return NULL;
4963  }
4964 }
4965 
4966 
4967 const Type *
4968 VectorMemberExpr::GetLValueType() const {
4969  if (lvalueType != NULL)
4970  return lvalueType;
4971 
4972  if (identifier.length() == 1) {
4973  if (expr == NULL) {
4974  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4975  return NULL;
4976  }
4977 
4978  const Type *exprLValueType = dereferenceExpr ? expr->GetType() :
4979  expr->GetLValueType();
4980  if (exprLValueType == NULL)
4981  return NULL;
4982 
4983  const VectorType *vt = NULL;
4984  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(exprLValueType) != NULL)
4985  vt = CastType<VectorType>(exprLValueType->GetReferenceTarget());
4986  else
4987  vt = CastType<VectorType>(exprLValueType->GetBaseType());
4988  AssertPos(pos, vt != NULL);
4989 
4990  // we don't want to report that it's e.g. a pointer to a float<1>,
4991  // but a pointer to a float, etc.
4992  const Type *elementType = vt->GetElementType();
4993  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(exprLValueType) != NULL)
4994  lvalueType = new ReferenceType(elementType);
4995  else {
4996  const PointerType *ptrType = exprLValueType->IsUniformType() ?
4997  PointerType::GetUniform(elementType) :
4998  PointerType::GetVarying(elementType);
4999  // FIXME: replicated logic with structmemberexpr....
5000  if (CastType<PointerType>(exprLValueType) &&
5001  CastType<PointerType>(exprLValueType)->IsSlice())
5002  ptrType = ptrType->GetAsFrozenSlice();
5003  lvalueType = ptrType;
5004  }
5005  }
5006 
5007  return lvalueType;
5008 }
5009 
5010 
5011 llvm::Value *
5012 VectorMemberExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
5013  if (identifier.length() == 1) {
5014  return MemberExpr::GetValue(ctx);
5015  }
5016  else {
5017  std::vector<int> indices;
5018 
5019  for (size_t i = 0; i < identifier.size(); ++i) {
5020  int idx = lIdentifierToVectorElement(identifier[i]);
5021  if (idx == -1)
5022  Error(pos,
5023  "Invalid swizzle charcter '%c' in swizzle \"%s\".",
5024  identifier[i], identifier.c_str());
5025 
5026  indices.push_back(idx);
5027  }
5028 
5029  llvm::Value *basePtr = NULL;
5030  const Type *basePtrType = NULL;
5031  if (dereferenceExpr) {
5032  basePtr = expr->GetValue(ctx);
5033  basePtrType = expr->GetType();
5034  }
5035  else {
5036  basePtr = expr->GetLValue(ctx);
5037  basePtrType = expr->GetLValueType();
5038  }
5039 
5040  if (basePtr == NULL || basePtrType == NULL) {
5041  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
5042  return NULL;
5043  }
5044 
5045  // Allocate temporary memory to tore the result
5046  llvm::Value *resultPtr = ctx->AllocaInst(memberType->LLVMType(g->ctx),
5047  "vector_tmp");
5048 
5049  // FIXME: we should be able to use the internal mask here according
5050  // to the same logic where it's used elsewhere
5051  llvm::Value *elementMask = ctx->GetFullMask();
5052 
5053  const Type *elementPtrType = basePtrType->IsUniformType() ?
5054  PointerType::GetUniform(exprVectorType->GetElementType()) :
5055  PointerType::GetVarying(exprVectorType->GetElementType());
5056 
5057  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
5058  for (size_t i = 0; i < identifier.size(); ++i) {
5059  char idStr[2] = { identifier[i], '\0' };
5060  llvm::Value *elementPtr = ctx->AddElementOffset(basePtr, indices[i],
5061  basePtrType,
5062  LLVMGetName(basePtr, idStr));
5063  llvm::Value *elementValue =
5064  ctx->LoadInst(elementPtr, elementMask, elementPtrType);
5065 
5066  const char *resultName = LLVMGetName(resultPtr, idStr);
5067  llvm::Value *ptmp = ctx->AddElementOffset(resultPtr, i, NULL, resultName);
5068  ctx->StoreInst(elementValue, ptmp);
5069  }
5070 
5071  return ctx->LoadInst(resultPtr, LLVMGetName(basePtr, "_swizzle"));
5072  }
5073 }
5074 
5075 
5076 int
5077 VectorMemberExpr::getElementNumber() const {
5078  int elementNumber = lIdentifierToVectorElement(identifier[0]);
5079  if (elementNumber == -1)
5080  Error(pos, "Vector element identifier \"%s\" unknown.",
5081  identifier.c_str());
5082  return elementNumber;
5083 }
5084 
5085 
5086 const Type *
5087 VectorMemberExpr::getElementType() const {
5088  return memberType;
5089 }
5090 
5091 
5092 
5093 MemberExpr *
5094 MemberExpr::create(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p, SourcePos idpos,
5095  bool derefLValue) {
5096  // FIXME: we need to call TypeCheck() here so that we can call
5097  // e->GetType() in the following. But really we just shouldn't try to
5098  // resolve this now but just have a generic MemberExpr type that
5099  // handles all cases so that this is unnecessary.
5100  e = ::TypeCheck(e);
5101 
5102  const Type *exprType;
5103  if (e == NULL || (exprType = e->GetType()) == NULL)
5104  return NULL;
5105 
5106  const ReferenceType *referenceType = CastType<ReferenceType>(exprType);
5107  if (referenceType != NULL) {
5108  e = new RefDerefExpr(e, e->pos);
5109  exprType = e->GetType();
5110  Assert(exprType != NULL);
5111  }
5112 
5113  const PointerType *pointerType = CastType<PointerType>(exprType);
5114  if (pointerType != NULL)
5115  exprType = pointerType->GetBaseType();
5116 
5117  if (derefLValue == true && pointerType == NULL) {
5118  const Type *targetType = exprType->GetReferenceTarget();
5119  if (CastType<StructType>(targetType) != NULL)
5120  Error(p, "Member operator \"->\" can't be applied to non-pointer "
5121  "type \"%s\". Did you mean to use \".\"?",
5122  exprType->GetString().c_str());
5123  else
5124  Error(p, "Member operator \"->\" can't be applied to non-struct "
5125  "pointer type \"%s\".", exprType->GetString().c_str());
5126  return NULL;
5127  }
5128  if (derefLValue == false && pointerType != NULL &&
5129  CastType<StructType>(pointerType->GetBaseType()) != NULL) {
5130  Error(p, "Member operator \".\" can't be applied to pointer "
5131  "type \"%s\". Did you mean to use \"->\"?",
5132  exprType->GetString().c_str());
5133  return NULL;
5134  }
5135 
5136  if (CastType<StructType>(exprType) != NULL)
5137  return new StructMemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos, derefLValue);
5138  else if (CastType<VectorType>(exprType) != NULL)
5139  return new VectorMemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos, derefLValue);
5140  else if (CastType<UndefinedStructType>(exprType)) {
5141  Error(p, "Member operator \"%s\" can't be applied to declared "
5142  "but not defined struct type \"%s\".", derefLValue ? "->" : ".",
5143  exprType->GetString().c_str());
5144  return NULL;
5145  }
5146  else {
5147  Error(p, "Member operator \"%s\" can't be used with expression of "
5148  "\"%s\" type.", derefLValue ? "->" : ".",
5149  exprType->GetString().c_str());
5150  return NULL;
5151  }
5152 }
5153 
5154 
5155 MemberExpr::MemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p, SourcePos idpos,
5156  bool derefLValue)
5157  : Expr(p), identifierPos(idpos) {
5158  expr = e;
5159  identifier = id;
5160  dereferenceExpr = derefLValue;
5161  type = lvalueType = NULL;
5162 }
5163 
5164 
5165 llvm::Value *
5166 MemberExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
5167  if (!expr)
5168  return NULL;
5169 
5170  llvm::Value *lvalue = GetLValue(ctx);
5171  const Type *lvalueType = GetLValueType();
5172 
5173  llvm::Value *mask = NULL;
5174  if (lvalue == NULL) {
5175  if (m->errorCount > 0)
5176  return NULL;
5177 
5178  // As in the array case, this may be a temporary that hasn't hit
5179  // memory; get the full value and stuff it into a temporary array
5180  // so that we can index from there...
5181  llvm::Value *val = expr->GetValue(ctx);
5182  if (!val) {
5183  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
5184  return NULL;
5185  }
5186  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
5187  const Type *exprType = expr->GetType();
5188  llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->AllocaInst(exprType->LLVMType(g->ctx),
5189  "struct_tmp");
5190  ctx->StoreInst(val, ptr);
5191 
5192  int elementNumber = getElementNumber();
5193  if (elementNumber == -1)
5194  return NULL;
5195 
5196  lvalue = ctx->AddElementOffset(ptr, elementNumber,
5197  PointerType::GetUniform(exprType));
5198  lvalueType = PointerType::GetUniform(GetType());
5199  mask = LLVMMaskAllOn;
5200  }
5201  else {
5202  Symbol *baseSym = GetBaseSymbol();
5203  AssertPos(pos, baseSym != NULL);
5204  mask = lMaskForSymbol(baseSym, ctx);
5205  }
5206 
5207  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
5208  std::string suffix = std::string("_") + identifier;
5209  return ctx->LoadInst(lvalue, mask, lvalueType,
5210  LLVMGetName(lvalue, suffix.c_str()));
5211 }
5212 
5213 
5214 const Type *
5215 MemberExpr::GetType() const {
5216  return NULL;
5217 }
5218 
5219 
5220 Symbol *
5221 MemberExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
5222  return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
5223 }
5224 
5225 
5226 int
5227 MemberExpr::getElementNumber() const {
5228  return -1;
5229 }
5230 
5231 
5232 llvm::Value *
5233 MemberExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
5234  const Type *exprType;
5235  if (!expr || ((exprType = expr->GetType()) == NULL))
5236  return NULL;
5237 
5238  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
5239  llvm::Value *basePtr = dereferenceExpr ? expr->GetValue(ctx) :
5240  expr->GetLValue(ctx);
5241  if (!basePtr)
5242  return NULL;
5243 
5244  int elementNumber = getElementNumber();
5245  if (elementNumber == -1)
5246  return NULL;
5247 
5248  const Type *exprLValueType = dereferenceExpr ? expr->GetType() :
5249  expr->GetLValueType();
5250  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
5251  llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->AddElementOffset(basePtr, elementNumber,
5252  exprLValueType,
5253  basePtr->getName().str().c_str());
5254  if (ptr == NULL) {
5255  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
5256  return NULL;
5257  }
5258 
5259  ptr = lAddVaryingOffsetsIfNeeded(ctx, ptr, GetLValueType());
5260 
5261  return ptr;
5262 }
5263 
5264 
5265 Expr *
5266 MemberExpr::TypeCheck() {
5267  return expr ? this : NULL;
5268 }
5269 
5270 
5271 Expr *
5272 MemberExpr::Optimize() {
5273  return expr ? this : NULL;
5274 }
5275 
5276 
5277 int
5278 MemberExpr::EstimateCost() const {
5279  const Type *lvalueType = GetLValueType();
5280  if (lvalueType != NULL && lvalueType->IsVaryingType())
5281  return COST_GATHER + COST_SIMPLE_ARITH_LOGIC_OP;
5282  else
5283  return COST_SIMPLE_ARITH_LOGIC_OP;
5284 }
5285 
5286 
5287 void
5288 MemberExpr::Print() const {
5289  if (!expr || !GetType())
5290  return;
5291 
5292  printf("[%s] member (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
5293  expr->Print();
5294  printf(" . %s)", identifier.c_str());
5295  pos.Print();
5296 }
5297 
5298 
5299 /** There is no structure member with the name we've got in "identifier".
5300  Use the approximate string matching routine to see if the identifier is
5301  a minor misspelling of one of the ones that is there.
5302  */
5303 std::string
5304 MemberExpr::getCandidateNearMatches() const {
5305  const StructType *structType = CastType<StructType>(expr->GetType());
5306  if (!structType)
5307  return "";
5308 
5309  std::vector<std::string> elementNames;
5310  for (int i = 0; i < structType->GetElementCount(); ++i)
5311  elementNames.push_back(structType->GetElementName(i));
5312  std::vector<std::string> alternates = MatchStrings(identifier, elementNames);
5313  if (!alternates.size())
5314  return "";
5315 
5316  std::string ret = " Did you mean ";
5317  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < alternates.size(); ++i) {
5318  ret += std::string("\"") + alternates[i] + std::string("\"");
5319  if (i < alternates.size() - 1) ret += ", or ";
5320  }
5321  ret += "?";
5322  return ret;
5323 }
5324 
5325 
5326 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5327 // ConstExpr
5328 
5329 ConstExpr::ConstExpr(const Type *t, int8_t i, SourcePos p)
5330  : Expr(p) {
5331  type = t;
5332  type = type->GetAsConstType();
5333  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformInt8->GetAsConstType()));
5334  int8Val[0] = i;
5335 }
5336 
5337 
5338 ConstExpr::ConstExpr(const Type *t, int8_t *i, SourcePos p)
5339  : Expr(p) {
5340  type = t;
5341  type = type->GetAsConstType();
5342  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformInt8->GetAsConstType()) ||
5343  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt8->GetAsConstType()));
5344  for (int j = 0; j < Count(); ++j)
5345  int8Val[j] = i[j];
5346 }
5347 
5348 
5349 ConstExpr::ConstExpr(const Type *t, uint8_t u, SourcePos p)
5350  : Expr(p) {
5351  type = t;
5352  type = type->GetAsConstType();
5353  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt8->GetAsConstType()));
5354  uint8Val[0] = u;
5355 }
5356 
5357

5359  : Expr(p) {
5360  type = t;
5361  type = type->GetAsConstType();
5362  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt8->GetAsConstType()) ||
5363  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt8->GetAsConstType()));
5364  for (int j = 0; j < Count(); ++j)
5365  uint8Val[j] = u[j];
5366 }

5434  (CastType<EnumType>(type) != NULL &&
5435  type->IsUniformType()));

5437 }

5445  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt32->GetAsConstType()) ||
5446  (CastType<EnumType>(type) != NULL));
5447  for (int j = 0; j < Count(); ++j)
5448  uint32Val[j] = u[j];
5449 }

5539 
5540 
5541 ConstExpr::ConstExpr(const Type *t, bool *b, SourcePos p)
5542  : Expr(p) {
5543  type = t;
5544  type = type->GetAsConstType();
5545  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformBool->GetAsConstType()) ||
5546  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingBool->GetAsConstType()));
5547  for (int j = 0; j < Count(); ++j)
5548  boolVal[j] = b[j];
5549 }
5550 
5551 
5552 ConstExpr::ConstExpr(ConstExpr *old, double *v)
5553  : Expr(old->pos) {
5554  type = old->type;
5555 
5556  AtomicType::BasicType basicType = getBasicType();
5557 
5558  switch (basicType) {
5559  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5560  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5561  boolVal[i] = (v[i] != 0.);
5562  break;
5563  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5564  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5565  int8Val[i] = (int)v[i];
5566  break;
5567  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5568  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5569  uint8Val[i] = (unsigned int)v[i];
5570  break;
5571  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5572  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5573  int16Val[i] = (int)v[i];
5574  break;
5575  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5576  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5577  uint16Val[i] = (unsigned int)v[i];
5578  break;
5579  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5580  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5581  int32Val[i] = (int)v[i];
5582  break;
5583  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5584  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5585  uint32Val[i] = (unsigned int)v[i];
5586  break;
5587  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5588  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5589  floatVal[i] = (float)v[i];
5590  break;
5591  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5592  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5593  doubleVal[i] = v[i];
5594  break;
5595  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5596  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5597  // For now, this should never be reached
5598  FATAL("fixme; we need another constructor so that we're not trying to pass "
5599  "double values to init an int64 type...");
5600  default:
5601  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5602  }
5603 }
5604 
5605 
5606 ConstExpr::ConstExpr(ConstExpr *old, SourcePos p)
5607  : Expr(p) {
5608  type = old->type;
5609 
5610  AtomicType::BasicType basicType = getBasicType();
5611 
5612  switch (basicType) {
5613  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5614  memcpy(boolVal, old->boolVal, Count() * sizeof(bool));
5615  break;
5616  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5617  memcpy(int8Val, old->int8Val, Count() * sizeof(int8_t));
5618  break;
5619  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5620  memcpy(uint8Val, old->uint8Val, Count() * sizeof(uint8_t));
5621  break;
5622  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5623  memcpy(int16Val, old->int16Val, Count() * sizeof(int16_t));
5624  break;
5625  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5626  memcpy(uint16Val, old->uint16Val, Count() * sizeof(uint16_t));
5627  break;
5628  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5629  memcpy(int32Val, old->int32Val, Count() * sizeof(int32_t));
5630  break;
5631  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5632  memcpy(uint32Val, old->uint32Val, Count() * sizeof(uint32_t));
5633  break;
5634  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5635  memcpy(floatVal, old->floatVal, Count() * sizeof(float));
5636  break;
5637  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5638  memcpy(doubleVal, old->doubleVal, Count() * sizeof(double));
5639  break;
5640  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5641  memcpy(int64Val, old->int64Val, Count() * sizeof(int64_t));
5642  break;
5643  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5644  memcpy(uint64Val, old->uint64Val, Count() * sizeof(uint64_t));
5645  break;
5646  default:
5647  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5648  }
5649 
5650 }
5651 
5652 
5653 AtomicType::BasicType
5654 ConstExpr::getBasicType() const {
5655  const AtomicType *at = CastType<AtomicType>(type);
5656  if (at != NULL)
5657  return at->basicType;
5658  else {
5659  AssertPos(pos, CastType<EnumType>(type) != NULL);
5660  return AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32;
5661  }
5662 }
5663 
5664 
5665 const Type *
5666 ConstExpr::GetType() const {
5667  return type;
5668 }
5669 
5670 
5671 llvm::Value *
5672 ConstExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
5673  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
5674  bool isVarying = type->IsVaryingType();
5675 
5676  AtomicType::BasicType basicType = getBasicType();
5677 
5678  switch (basicType) {
5679  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5680  if (isVarying)
5681  return LLVMBoolVector(boolVal);
5682  else
5683  return boolVal[0] ? LLVMTrue : LLVMFalse;
5684  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5685  return isVarying ? LLVMInt8Vector(int8Val) :
5686  LLVMInt8(int8Val[0]);
5687  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5688  return isVarying ? LLVMUInt8Vector(uint8Val) :
5689  LLVMUInt8(uint8Val[0]);
5690  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5691  return isVarying ? LLVMInt16Vector(int16Val) :
5692  LLVMInt16(int16Val[0]);
5693  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5694  return isVarying ? LLVMUInt16Vector(uint16Val) :
5695  LLVMUInt16(uint16Val[0]);
5696  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5697  return isVarying ? LLVMInt32Vector(int32Val) :
5698  LLVMInt32(int32Val[0]);
5699  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5700  return isVarying ? LLVMUInt32Vector(uint32Val) :
5701  LLVMUInt32(uint32Val[0]);
5702  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5703  return isVarying ? LLVMFloatVector(floatVal) :
5704  LLVMFloat(floatVal[0]);
5705  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5706  return isVarying ? LLVMInt64Vector(int64Val) :
5707  LLVMInt64(int64Val[0]);
5708  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5709  return isVarying ? LLVMUInt64Vector(uint64Val) :
5710  LLVMUInt64(uint64Val[0]);
5711  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5712  return isVarying ? LLVMDoubleVector(doubleVal) :
5713  LLVMDouble(doubleVal[0]);
5714  default:
5715  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5716  return NULL;
5717  }
5718 }
5719 
5720 
5721 /* Type conversion templates: take advantage of C++ function overloading
5722  rules to get the one we want to match. */
5723 
5724 /* First the most general case, just use C++ type conversion if nothing
5725  else matches */
5726 template <typename From, typename To> static inline void
5727 lConvertElement(From from, To *to) {
5728  *to = (To)from;
5729 }
5730 
5731 
5732 /** When converting from bool types to numeric types, make sure the result
5733  is one or zero.
5734  */
5735 template <typename To> static inline void
5736 lConvertElement(bool from, To *to) {
5737  *to = from ? (To)1 : (To)0;
5738 }
5739 
5740 
5741 /** When converting numeric types to bool, compare to zero. (Do we
5742  actually need this one??) */
5743 template <typename From> static inline void
5744 lConvertElement(From from, bool *to) {
5745  *to = (from != 0);
5746 }
5747 
5748 
5749 /** And bool -> bool is just assignment */
5750 static inline void
5751 lConvertElement(bool from, bool *to) {
5752  *to = from;
5753 }
5754 
5755 
5756 /** Type conversion utility function
5757  */
5758 template <typename From, typename To> static void
5759 lConvert(const From *from, To *to, int count, bool forceVarying) {
5760  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
5761  lConvertElement(from[i], &to[i]);
5762 
5763  if (forceVarying && count == 1)
5764  for (int i = 1; i < g->target->getVectorWidth(); ++i)
5765  to[i] = to[0];
5766 }
5767 
5768 
5769 int
5770 ConstExpr::GetValues(int64_t *ip, bool forceVarying) const {
5771  switch (getBasicType()) {
5772  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: lConvert(boolVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5773  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: lConvert(int8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5774  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: lConvert(uint8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5775  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: lConvert(int16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5776  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5777  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: lConvert(int32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5778  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5779  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: lConvert(floatVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5780  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5781  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: lConvert(int64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5782  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5783  default:
5784  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5785  }
5786  return Count();
5787 }
5788 
5789 
5790 int
5791 ConstExpr::GetValues(uint64_t *up, bool forceVarying) const {
5792  switch (getBasicType()) {
5793  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: lConvert(boolVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5794  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: lConvert(int8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5795  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: lConvert(uint8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5796  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: lConvert(int16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5797  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5798  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: lConvert(int32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5799  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5800  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: lConvert(floatVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5801  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5802  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: lConvert(int64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5803  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5804  default:
5805  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5806  }
5807  return Count();
5808 }
5809 
5810 
5811 int
5812 ConstExpr::GetValues(double *d, bool forceVarying) const {
5813  switch (getBasicType()) {
5814  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: lConvert(boolVal, d, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5815  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: lConvert(int8Val, d, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5816  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: lConvert(uint8Val, d, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5817  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: lConvert(int16Val, d, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5818  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, d, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5819  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: lConvert(int32Val, d, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5820  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, d, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5821  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: lConvert(floatVal, d, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5822  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, d, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5823  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: lConvert(int64Val, d, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5824  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, d, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5825  default:
5826  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5827  }
5828  return Count();
5829 }
5830 
5831 
5832 int
5833 ConstExpr::GetValues(float *fp, bool forceVarying) const {
5834  switch (getBasicType()) {
5835  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: lConvert(boolVal, fp, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5836  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: lConvert(int8Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5837  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: lConvert(uint8Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5838  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: lConvert(int16Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5839  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5840  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: lConvert(int32Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5841  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5842  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: lConvert(floatVal, fp, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5843  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, fp, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5844  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: lConvert(int64Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5845  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5846  default:
5847  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5848  }
5849  return Count();
5850 }

5853 int
5854 ConstExpr::GetValues(bool *b, bool forceVarying) const {
5855  switch (getBasicType()) {
5856  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: lConvert(boolVal, b, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5857  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: lConvert(int8Val, b, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5858  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: lConvert(uint8Val, b, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5859  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: lConvert(int16Val, b, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5860  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, b, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5861  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: lConvert(int32Val, b, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5862  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, b, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5863  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: lConvert(floatVal, b, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5864  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, b, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5865  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: lConvert(int64Val, b, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5866  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, b, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5867  default:
5868  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5869  }
5870  return Count();
5871 }

5874 int
5875 ConstExpr::GetValues(int8_t *ip, bool forceVarying) const {
5876  switch (getBasicType()) {
5877  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: lConvert(boolVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5878  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: lConvert(int8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5879  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: lConvert(uint8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5880  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: lConvert(int16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5881  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5882  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: lConvert(int32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5883  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5884  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: lConvert(floatVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5885  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5886  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: lConvert(int64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5887  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5888  default:
5889  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5890  }
5891  return Count();
5892 }

5895 int
5896 ConstExpr::GetValues(uint8_t *up, bool forceVarying) const {
5897  switch (getBasicType()) {
5898  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: lConvert(boolVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5899  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: lConvert(int8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5900  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: lConvert(uint8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5901  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: lConvert(int16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5902  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5903  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: lConvert(int32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5904  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5905  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: lConvert(floatVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5906  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5907  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: lConvert(int64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5908  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5909  default:
5910  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5911  }
5912  return Count();
5913 }

5916 int
5917 ConstExpr::GetValues(int16_t *ip, bool forceVarying) const {
5918  switch (getBasicType()) {
5919  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: lConvert(boolVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5920  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: lConvert(int8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5921  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: lConvert(uint8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5922  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: lConvert(int16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5923  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5924  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: lConvert(int32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5925  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5926  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: lConvert(floatVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5927  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5928  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: lConvert(int64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5929  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5930  default:
5931  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5932  }
5933  return Count();
5934 }

5936 
5937 int
5938 ConstExpr::GetValues(uint16_t *up, bool forceVarying) const {
5939  switch (getBasicType()) {
5940  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: lConvert(boolVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5941  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: lConvert(int8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5942  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: lConvert(uint8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5943  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: lConvert(int16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5944  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5945  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: lConvert(int32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5946  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5947  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: lConvert(floatVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5948  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5949  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: lConvert(int64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5950  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5951  default:
5952  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5953  }
5954  return Count();
5955 }

5957 
5958 int
5959 ConstExpr::GetValues(int32_t *ip, bool forceVarying) const {
5960  switch (getBasicType()) {
5961  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: lConvert(boolVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5962  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: lConvert(int8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5963  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: lConvert(uint8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5964  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: lConvert(int16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5965  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5966  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: lConvert(int32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5967  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5968  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: lConvert(floatVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5969  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5970  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: lConvert(int64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5971  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5972  default:
5973  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5974  }
5975  return Count();
5976 }
5977 
5978 
5979 int
5980 ConstExpr::GetValues(uint32_t *up, bool forceVarying) const {
5981  switch (getBasicType()) {
5982  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: lConvert(boolVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5983  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: lConvert(int8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5984  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: lConvert(uint8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5985  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: lConvert(int16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5986  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5987  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: lConvert(int32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5988  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5989  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: lConvert(floatVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5990  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5991  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: lConvert(int64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5992  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5993  default:
5994  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5995  }
5996  return Count();
5997 }
5998 
5999 
6000 int
6001 ConstExpr::Count() const {
6002  return GetType()->IsVaryingType() ? g->target->getVectorWidth() : 1;
6003 }
6004 
6005 
6006 llvm::Constant *
6007 ConstExpr::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
6008  // Caller shouldn't be trying to stuff a varying value here into a
6009  // constant type.
6010  if (type->IsUniformType())
6011  AssertPos(pos, Count() == 1);
6012 
6013  type = type->GetAsNonConstType();
6014  if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformBool) ||
6015  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingBool)) {
6016  bool bv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6017  GetValues(bv, type->IsVaryingType());
6018  if (type->IsUniformType())
6019  return bv[0] ? LLVMTrue : LLVMFalse;
6020  else
6021  return LLVMBoolVector(bv);
6022  }
6023  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformInt8) ||
6024  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt8)) {
6025  int8_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6026  GetValues(iv, type->IsVaryingType());
6027  if (type->IsUniformType())
6028  return LLVMInt8(iv[0]);
6029  else
6030  return LLVMInt8Vector(iv);
6031  }
6032  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt8) ||
6033  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt8)) {
6034  uint8_t uiv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6035  GetValues(uiv, type->IsVaryingType());
6036  if (type->IsUniformType())
6037  return LLVMUInt8(uiv[0]);
6038  else
6039  return LLVMUInt8Vector(uiv);
6040  }
6041  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformInt16) ||
6042  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt16)) {
6043  int16_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6044  GetValues(iv, type->IsVaryingType());
6045  if (type->IsUniformType())
6046  return LLVMInt16(iv[0]);
6047  else
6048  return LLVMInt16Vector(iv);
6049  }
6050  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt16) ||
6051  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt16)) {
6052  uint16_t uiv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6053  GetValues(uiv, type->IsVaryingType());
6054  if (type->IsUniformType())
6055  return LLVMUInt16(uiv[0]);
6056  else
6057  return LLVMUInt16Vector(uiv);
6058  }
6059  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformInt32) ||
6060  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt32)) {
6061  int32_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6062  GetValues(iv, type->IsVaryingType());
6063  if (type->IsUniformType())
6064  return LLVMInt32(iv[0]);
6065  else
6066  return LLVMInt32Vector(iv);
6067  }
6068  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt32) ||
6069  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt32) ||
6070  CastType<EnumType>(type) != NULL) {
6071  uint32_t uiv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6072  GetValues(uiv, type->IsVaryingType());
6073  if (type->IsUniformType())
6074  return LLVMUInt32(uiv[0]);
6075  else
6076  return LLVMUInt32Vector(uiv);
6077  }
6078  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformFloat) ||
6079  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingFloat)) {
6080  float fv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6081  GetValues(fv, type->IsVaryingType());
6082  if (type->IsUniformType())
6083  return LLVMFloat(fv[0]);
6084  else
6085  return LLVMFloatVector(fv);
6086  }
6087  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformInt64) ||
6088  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt64)) {
6089  int64_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6090  GetValues(iv, type->IsVaryingType());
6091  if (type->IsUniformType())
6092  return LLVMInt64(iv[0]);
6093  else
6094  return LLVMInt64Vector(iv);
6095  }
6096  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt64) ||
6097  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt64)) {
6098  uint64_t uiv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6099  GetValues(uiv, type->IsVaryingType());
6100  if (type->IsUniformType())
6101  return LLVMUInt64(uiv[0]);
6102  else
6103  return LLVMUInt64Vector(uiv);
6104  }
6105  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformDouble) ||
6106  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingDouble)) {
6107  double dv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6108  GetValues(dv, type->IsVaryingType());
6109  if (type->IsUniformType())
6110  return LLVMDouble(dv[0]);
6111  else
6112  return LLVMDoubleVector(dv);
6113  }
6114  else if (CastType<PointerType>(type) != NULL) {
6115  // The only time we should get here is if we have an integer '0'
6116  // constant that should be turned into a NULL pointer of the
6117  // appropriate type.
6118  llvm::Type *llvmType = type->LLVMType(g->ctx);
6119  if (llvmType == NULL) {
6120  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
6121  return NULL;
6122  }
6123 
6124  int64_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6125  GetValues(iv, type->IsVaryingType());
6126  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
6127  if (iv[i] != 0)
6128  // We'll issue an error about this later--trying to assign
6129  // a constant int to a pointer, without a typecast.
6130  return NULL;
6131 
6132  return llvm::Constant::getNullValue(llvmType);
6133  }
6134  else {
6135  Debug(pos, "Unable to handle type \"%s\" in ConstExpr::GetConstant().",
6136  type->GetString().c_str());
6137  return NULL;
6138  }
6139 }
6140 
6141 
6142 Expr *
6143 ConstExpr::Optimize() {
6144  return this;
6145 }
6146 
6147 
6148 Expr *
6149 ConstExpr::TypeCheck() {
6150  return this;
6151 }
6152 
6153 
6154 int
6155 ConstExpr::EstimateCost() const {
6156  return 0;
6157 }
6158 
6159 
6160 void
6161 ConstExpr::Print() const {
6162  printf("[%s] (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
6163  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i) {
6164  switch (getBasicType()) {
6165  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6166  printf("%s", boolVal[i] ? "true" : "false");
6167  break;
6168  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6169  printf("%d", (int)int8Val[i]);
6170  break;
6171  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6172  printf("%u", (int)uint8Val[i]);
6173  break;
6174  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6175  printf("%d", (int)int16Val[i]);
6176  break;
6177  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6178  printf("%u", (int)uint16Val[i]);
6179  break;
6180  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6181  printf("%d", int32Val[i]);
6182  break;
6183  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6184  printf("%u", uint32Val[i]);
6185  break;
6186  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6187  printf("%f", floatVal[i]);
6188  break;
6189  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6190  printf("%"PRId64, int64Val[i]);
6191  break;
6192  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6193  printf("%"PRIu64, uint64Val[i]);
6194  break;
6195  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6196  printf("%f", doubleVal[i]);
6197  break;
6198  default:
6199  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
6200  }
6201  if (i != Count() - 1)
6202  printf(", ");
6203  }
6204  printf(")");
6205  pos.Print();
6206 }
6207 
6208 
6209 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
6210 // TypeCastExpr
6211 
6212 TypeCastExpr::TypeCastExpr(const Type *t, Expr *e, SourcePos p)
6213  : Expr(p) {
6214  type = t;
6215  expr = e;
6216 }
6217 
6218 
6219 /** Handle all the grungy details of type conversion between atomic types.
6220  Given an input value in exprVal of type fromType, convert it to the
6221  llvm::Value with type toType.
6222  */
6223 static llvm::Value *
6224 lTypeConvAtomic(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *exprVal,
6225  const AtomicType *toType, const AtomicType *fromType,
6226  SourcePos pos) {
6227  llvm::Value *cast = NULL;
6228 
6229  std::string opName = exprVal->getName().str();
6230  switch (toType->basicType) {
6231  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: opName += "_to_bool"; break;
6232  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: opName += "_to_int8"; break;
6233  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: opName += "_to_uint8"; break;
6234  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: opName += "_to_int16"; break;
6235  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: opName += "_to_uint16"; break;
6236  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: opName += "_to_int32"; break;
6237  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: opName += "_to_uint32"; break;
6238  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: opName += "_to_int64"; break;
6239  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: opName += "_to_uint64"; break;
6240  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: opName += "_to_float"; break;
6241  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: opName += "_to_double"; break;
6242  default: FATAL("Unimplemented");
6243  }
6244  const char *cOpName = opName.c_str();
6245 
6246  switch (toType->basicType) {
6247  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: {
6248  llvm::Type *targetType =
6249  fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::FloatType :
6250  LLVMTypes::FloatVectorType;
6251  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6252  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6253  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() &&
6254  LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType)
6255  // If we have a bool vector of non-i1 elements, first
6256  // truncate down to a single bit.
6257  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6258  // And then do an unisgned int->float cast
6259  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::UIToFP, // unsigned int
6260  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6261  break;
6262  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6263  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6264  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6265  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6266  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::SIToFP, // signed int to float
6267  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6268  break;
6269  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6270  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6271  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6272  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6273  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6274  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from unsigned int to float is slow. "
6275  "Use \"int\" if possible");
6276  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::UIToFP, // unsigned int to float
6277  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6278  break;
6279  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6280  // No-op cast.
6281  cast = exprVal;
6282  break;
6283  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6284  cast = ctx->FPCastInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6285  break;
6286  default:
6287  FATAL("unimplemented");
6288  }
6289  break;
6290  }
6291  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: {
6292  llvm::Type *targetType =
6293  fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::DoubleType :
6294  LLVMTypes::DoubleVectorType;
6295  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6296  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6297  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() &&
6298  LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType)
6299  // truncate bool vector values to i1s
6300  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6301  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::UIToFP, // unsigned int to double
6302  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6303  break;
6304  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6305  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6306  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6307  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6308  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::SIToFP, // signed int
6309  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6310  break;
6311  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6312  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6313  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6314  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6315  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::UIToFP, // unsigned int
6316  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6317  break;
6318  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6319  cast = ctx->FPCastInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6320  break;
6321  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6322  cast = exprVal;
6323  break;
6324  default:
6325  FATAL("unimplemented");
6326  }
6327  break;
6328  }
6329  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: {
6330  llvm::Type *targetType =
6331  fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int8Type :
6332  LLVMTypes::Int8VectorType;
6333  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6334  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6335  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() &&
6336  LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType)
6337  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6338  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6339  break;
6340  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6341  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6342  cast = exprVal;
6343  break;
6344  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6345  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6346  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6347  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6348  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6349  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6350  cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6351  break;
6352  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6353  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6354  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6355  break;
6356  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6357  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6358  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6359  break;
6360  default:
6361  FATAL("unimplemented");
6362  }
6363  break;
6364  }
6365  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: {
6366  llvm::Type *targetType =
6367  fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int8Type :
6368  LLVMTypes::Int8VectorType;
6369  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6370  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6371  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() &&
6372  LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType)
6373  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6374  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6375  break;
6376  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6377  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6378  cast = exprVal;
6379  break;
6380  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6381  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6382  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6383  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6384  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6385  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6386  cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6387  break;
6388  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6389  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6390  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int is slow. "
6391  "Use \"int\" if possible");
6392  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
6393  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6394  break;
6395  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6396  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6397  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int is slow. "
6398  "Use \"int\" if possible");
6399  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
6400  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6401  break;
6402  default:
6403  FATAL("unimplemented");
6404  }
6405  break;
6406  }
6407  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: {
6408  llvm::Type *targetType =
6409  fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int16Type :
6410  LLVMTypes::Int16VectorType;
6411  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6412  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6413  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() &&
6414  LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType)
6415  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6416  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6417  break;
6418  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6419  cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6420  break;
6421  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6422  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6423  break;
6424  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6425  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6426  cast = exprVal;
6427  break;
6428  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6429  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6430  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6431  break;
6432  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6433  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6434  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6435  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6436  cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6437  break;
6438  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6439  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6440  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6441  break;
6442  default:
6443  FATAL("unimplemented");
6444  }
6445  break;
6446  }
6447  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: {
6448  llvm::Type *targetType =
6449  fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int16Type :
6450  LLVMTypes::Int16VectorType;
6451  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6452  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6453  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() &&
6454  LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType)
6455  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6456  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6457  break;
6458  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6459  cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6460  break;
6461  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6462  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6463  break;
6464  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6465  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6466  cast = exprVal;
6467  break;
6468  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6469  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6470  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int is slow. "
6471  "Use \"int\" if possible");
6472  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
6473  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6474  break;
6475  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6476  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6477  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6478  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6479  cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6480  break;
6481  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6482  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6483  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int is slow. "
6484  "Use \"int\" if possible");
6485  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
6486  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6487  break;
6488  default:
6489  FATAL("unimplemented");
6490  }
6491  break;
6492  }
6493  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: {
6494  llvm::Type *targetType =
6495  fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int32Type :
6496  LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType;
6497  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6498  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6499  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() &&
6500  LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType)
6501  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6502  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6503  break;
6504  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6505  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6506  cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6507  break;
6508  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6509  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6510  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6511  break;
6512  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6513  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6514  cast = exprVal;
6515  break;
6516  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6517  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6518  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6519  break;
6520  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6521  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6522  cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6523  break;
6524  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6525  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6526  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6527  break;
6528  default:
6529  FATAL("unimplemented");
6530  }
6531  break;
6532  }
6533  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: {
6534  llvm::Type *targetType =
6535  fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int32Type :
6536  LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType;
6537  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6538  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6539  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() &&
6540  LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType)
6541  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6542  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6543  break;
6544  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6545  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6546  cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6547  break;
6548  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6549  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6550  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6551  break;
6552  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6553  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6554  cast = exprVal;
6555  break;
6556  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6557  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6558  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int is slow. "
6559  "Use \"int\" if possible");
6560  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
6561  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6562  break;
6563  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6564  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6565  cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6566  break;
6567  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6568  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6569  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int is slow. "
6570  "Use \"int\" if possible");
6571  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
6572  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6573  break;
6574  default:
6575  FATAL("unimplemented");
6576  }
6577  break;
6578  }
6579  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: {
6580  llvm::Type *targetType =
6581  fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int64Type :
6582  LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType;
6583  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6584  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6585  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() &&
6586  LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType)
6587  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6588  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6589  break;
6590  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6591  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6592  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6593  cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6594  break;
6595  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6596  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6597  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6598  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6599  break;
6600  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6601  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6602  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6603  break;
6604  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6605  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6606  cast = exprVal;
6607  break;
6608  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6609  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6610  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6611  break;
6612  default:
6613  FATAL("unimplemented");
6614  }
6615  break;
6616  }
6617  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: {
6618  llvm::Type *targetType =
6619  fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int64Type :
6620  LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType;
6621  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6622  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6623  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() &&
6624  LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType)
6625  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6626  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6627  break;
6628  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6629  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6630  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6631  cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6632  break;
6633  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6634  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6635  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6636  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6637  break;
6638  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6639  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6640  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int64 is slow. "
6641  "Use \"int64\" if possible");
6642  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // signed int
6643  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6644  break;
6645  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6646  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6647  cast = exprVal;
6648  break;
6649  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6650  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6651  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int64 is slow. "
6652  "Use \"int64\" if possible");
6653  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // signed int
6654  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6655  break;
6656  default:
6657  FATAL("unimplemented");
6658  }
6659  break;
6660  }
6661  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: {
6662  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6663  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6664  cast = exprVal;
6665  break;
6666  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6667  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: {
6668  llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt8(0) :
6669  (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt8Vector((int8_t)0);
6670  cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
6671  exprVal, zero, cOpName);
6672  break;
6673  }
6674  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6675  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: {
6676  llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt16(0) :
6677  (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt16Vector((int16_t)0);
6678  cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
6679  exprVal, zero, cOpName);
6680  break;
6681  }
6682  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6683  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: {
6684  llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt32(0) :
6685  (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt32Vector(0);
6686  cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
6687  exprVal, zero, cOpName);
6688  break;
6689  }
6690  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: {
6691  llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMFloat(0.f) :
6692  (llvm::Value *)LLVMFloatVector(0.f);
6693  cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::FCmp, llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_ONE,
6694  exprVal, zero, cOpName);
6695  break;
6696  }
6697  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6698  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: {
6699  llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt64(0) :
6700  (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt64Vector((int64_t)0);
6701  cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
6702  exprVal, zero, cOpName);
6703  break;
6704  }
6705  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: {
6706  llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMDouble(0.) :
6707  (llvm::Value *)LLVMDoubleVector(0.);
6708  cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::FCmp, llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_ONE,
6709  exprVal, zero, cOpName);
6710  break;
6711  }
6712  default:
6713  FATAL("unimplemented");
6714  }
6715 
6716  if (fromType->IsUniformType()) {
6717  if (toType->IsVaryingType() &&
6718  LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType != LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType) {
6719  // extend out to an bool as an i8/i16/i32 from the i1 here.
6720  // Then we'll turn that into a vector below, the way it
6721  // does for everyone else...
6722  cast = ctx->SExtInst(cast, LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType->getElementType(),
6723  LLVMGetName(cast, "to_i_bool"));
6724  }
6725  }
6726  else
6727  // fromType->IsVaryingType())
6728  cast = ctx->I1VecToBoolVec(cast);
6729 
6730  break;
6731  }
6732  default:
6733  FATAL("unimplemented");
6734  }
6735 
6736  // If we also want to go from uniform to varying, replicate out the
6737  // value across the vector elements..
6738  if (toType->IsVaryingType() && fromType->IsUniformType())
6739  return ctx->SmearUniform(cast);
6740  else
6741  return cast;
6742 }
6743 
6744 
6745 // FIXME: fold this into the FunctionEmitContext::SmearUniform() method?
6746 
6747 /** Converts the given value of the given type to be the varying
6748  equivalent, returning the resulting value.
6749  */
6750 static llvm::Value *
6751 lUniformValueToVarying(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *value,
6752  const Type *type) {
6753  // nothing to do if it's already varying
6754  if (type->IsVaryingType())
6755  return value;
6756 
6757  // for structs/arrays/vectors, just recursively make their elements
6758  // varying (if needed) and populate the return value.
6759  const CollectionType *collectionType = CastType<CollectionType>(type);
6760  if (collectionType != NULL) {
6761  llvm::Type *llvmType =
6762  type->GetAsVaryingType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
6763  llvm::Value *retValue = llvm::UndefValue::get(llvmType);
6764 
6765  for (int i = 0; i < collectionType->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
6766  llvm::Value *v = ctx->ExtractInst(value, i, "get_element");
6767  v = lUniformValueToVarying(ctx, v, collectionType->GetElementType(i));
6768  retValue = ctx->InsertInst(retValue, v, i, "set_element");
6769  }
6770  return retValue;
6771  }
6772 
6773  // Otherwise we must have a uniform atomic or pointer type, so smear
6774  // its value across the vector lanes.
6775  Assert(CastType<AtomicType>(type) != NULL ||
6776  CastType<PointerType>(type) != NULL);
6777  return ctx->SmearUniform(value);
6778 }
6779 
6780 
6781 llvm::Value *
6782 TypeCastExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
6783  if (!expr)
6784  return NULL;
6785 
6786  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
6787  const Type *toType = GetType(), *fromType = expr->GetType();
6788  if (toType == NULL || fromType == NULL) {
6789  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
6790  return NULL;
6791  }
6792 
6793  if (Type::Equal(toType, AtomicType::Void)) {
6794  // emit the code for the expression in case it has side-effects but
6795  // then we're done.
6796  (void)expr->GetValue(ctx);
6797  return NULL;
6798  }
6799 
6800  const PointerType *fromPointerType = CastType<PointerType>(fromType);
6801  const PointerType *toPointerType = CastType<PointerType>(toType);
6802  const ArrayType *toArrayType = CastType<ArrayType>(toType);
6803  const ArrayType *fromArrayType = CastType<ArrayType>(fromType);
6804  if (fromPointerType != NULL) {
6805  if (toArrayType != NULL) {
6806  return expr->GetValue(ctx);
6807  }
6808  else if (toPointerType != NULL) {
6809  llvm::Value *value = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6810  if (value == NULL)
6811  return NULL;
6812 
6813  if (fromPointerType->IsSlice() == false &&
6814  toPointerType->IsSlice() == true) {
6815  // Convert from a non-slice pointer to a slice pointer by
6816  // creating a slice pointer structure with zero offsets.
6817  if (fromPointerType->IsUniformType())
6818  value = ctx->MakeSlicePointer(value, LLVMInt32(0));
6819  else
6820  value = ctx->MakeSlicePointer(value, LLVMInt32Vector(0));
6821 
6822  // FIXME: avoid error from unnecessary bitcast when all we
6823  // need to do is the slice conversion and don't need to
6824  // also do unif->varying conversions. But this is really
6825  // ugly logic.
6826  if (value->getType() == toType->LLVMType(g->ctx))
6827  return value;
6828  }
6829 
6830  if (fromType->IsUniformType() && toType->IsUniformType())
6831  // bitcast to the actual pointer type
6832  return ctx->BitCastInst(value, toType->LLVMType(g->ctx));
6833  else if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && toType->IsVaryingType()) {
6834  // both are vectors of ints already, nothing to do at the IR
6835  // level
6836  return value;
6837  }
6838  else {
6839  // Uniform -> varying pointer conversion
6840  AssertPos(pos, fromType->IsUniformType() && toType->IsVaryingType());
6841  if (fromPointerType->IsSlice()) {
6842  // For slice pointers, we need to smear out both the
6843  // pointer and the offset vector
6844  AssertPos(pos, toPointerType->IsSlice());
6845  llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->ExtractInst(value, 0);
6846  llvm::Value *offset = ctx->ExtractInst(value, 1);
6847  ptr = ctx->PtrToIntInst(ptr);
6848  ptr = ctx->SmearUniform(ptr);
6849  offset = ctx->SmearUniform(offset);
6850  return ctx->MakeSlicePointer(ptr, offset);
6851  }
6852  else {
6853  // Otherwise we just bitcast it to an int and smear it
6854  // out to a vector
6855  value = ctx->PtrToIntInst(value);
6856  return ctx->SmearUniform(value);
6857  }
6858  }
6859  }
6860  else {
6861  AssertPos(pos, CastType<AtomicType>(toType) != NULL);
6862  if (toType->IsBoolType()) {
6863  // convert pointer to bool
6864  llvm::Type *lfu =
6865  fromType->GetAsUniformType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
6866  llvm::PointerType *llvmFromUnifType =
6867  llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::PointerType>(lfu);
6868 
6869  llvm::Value *nullPtrValue =
6870  llvm::ConstantPointerNull::get(llvmFromUnifType);
6871  if (fromType->IsVaryingType())
6872  nullPtrValue = ctx->SmearUniform(nullPtrValue);
6873 
6874  llvm::Value *exprVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6875  llvm::Value *cmp =
6876  ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
6877  exprVal, nullPtrValue, "ptr_ne_NULL");
6878 
6879  if (toType->IsVaryingType()) {
6880  if (fromType->IsUniformType())
6881  cmp = ctx->SmearUniform(cmp);
6882  cmp = ctx->I1VecToBoolVec(cmp);
6883  }
6884 
6885  return cmp;
6886  }
6887  else {
6888  // ptr -> int
6889  llvm::Value *value = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6890  if (value == NULL)
6891  return NULL;
6892 
6893  if (toType->IsVaryingType() && fromType->IsUniformType())
6894  value = ctx->SmearUniform(value);
6895 
6896  llvm::Type *llvmToType = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
6897  if (llvmToType == NULL)
6898  return NULL;
6899  return ctx->PtrToIntInst(value, llvmToType, "ptr_typecast");
6900  }
6901  }
6902  }
6903 
6904  if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toType, fromType))
6905  // There's nothing to do, just return the value. (LLVM's type
6906  // system doesn't worry about constiness.)
6907  return expr->GetValue(ctx);
6908 
6909  if (fromArrayType != NULL && toPointerType != NULL) {
6910  // implicit array to pointer to first element
6911  Expr *arrayAsPtr = lArrayToPointer(expr);
6912  if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(arrayAsPtr->GetType(), toPointerType) == false) {
6913  AssertPos(pos, PointerType::IsVoidPointer(toPointerType) ||
6914  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(arrayAsPtr->GetType()->GetAsVaryingType(),
6915  toPointerType) == true);
6916  arrayAsPtr = new TypeCastExpr(toPointerType, arrayAsPtr, pos);
6917  arrayAsPtr = ::TypeCheck(arrayAsPtr);
6918  AssertPos(pos, arrayAsPtr != NULL);
6919  arrayAsPtr = ::Optimize(arrayAsPtr);
6920  AssertPos(pos, arrayAsPtr != NULL);
6921  }
6922  AssertPos(pos, Type::EqualIgnoringConst(arrayAsPtr->GetType(), toPointerType));
6923  return arrayAsPtr->GetValue(ctx);
6924  }
6925 
6926  // This also should be caught during typechecking
6927  AssertPos(pos, !(toType->IsUniformType() && fromType->IsVaryingType()));
6928 
6929  if (toArrayType != NULL && fromArrayType != NULL) {
6930  // cast array pointer from [n x foo] to [0 x foo] if needed to be able
6931  // to pass to a function that takes an unsized array as a parameter
6932  if (toArrayType->GetElementCount() != 0 &&
6933  (toArrayType->GetElementCount() != fromArrayType->GetElementCount()))
6934  Warning(pos, "Type-converting array of length %d to length %d",
6935  fromArrayType->GetElementCount(), toArrayType->GetElementCount());
6936  AssertPos(pos, Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toArrayType->GetBaseType(),
6937  fromArrayType->GetBaseType()));
6938  llvm::Value *v = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6939  llvm::Type *ptype = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
6940  return ctx->BitCastInst(v, ptype); //, "array_cast_0size");
6941  }
6942 
6943  const ReferenceType *toReference = CastType<ReferenceType>(toType);
6944  const ReferenceType *fromReference = CastType<ReferenceType>(fromType);
6945  if (toReference && fromReference) {
6946  const Type *toTarget = toReference->GetReferenceTarget();
6947  const Type *fromTarget = fromReference->GetReferenceTarget();
6948 
6949  const ArrayType *toArray = CastType<ArrayType>(toTarget);
6950  const ArrayType *fromArray = CastType<ArrayType>(fromTarget);
6951  if (toArray && fromArray) {
6952  // cast array pointer from [n x foo] to [0 x foo] if needed to be able
6953  // to pass to a function that takes an unsized array as a parameter
6954  if(toArray->GetElementCount() != 0 &&
6955  (toArray->GetElementCount() != fromArray->GetElementCount()))
6956  Warning(pos, "Type-converting array of length %d to length %d",
6957  fromArray->GetElementCount(), toArray->GetElementCount());
6958  AssertPos(pos, Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toArray->GetBaseType(),
6959  fromArray->GetBaseType()));
6960  llvm::Value *v = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6961  llvm::Type *ptype = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
6962  return ctx->BitCastInst(v, ptype); //, "array_cast_0size");
6963  }
6964 
6965  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(toTarget, fromTarget) ||
6966  Type::Equal(toTarget, fromTarget->GetAsConstType()));
6967  return expr->GetValue(ctx);
6968  }
6969 
6970  const StructType *toStruct = CastType<StructType>(toType);
6971  const StructType *fromStruct = CastType<StructType>(fromType);
6972  if (toStruct && fromStruct) {
6973  // The only legal type conversions for structs are to go from a
6974  // uniform to a varying instance of the same struct type.
6975  AssertPos(pos, toStruct->IsVaryingType() && fromStruct->IsUniformType() &&
6976  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toStruct,
6977  fromStruct->GetAsVaryingType()));
6978 
6979  llvm::Value *origValue = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6980  if (!origValue)
6981  return NULL;
6982  return lUniformValueToVarying(ctx, origValue, fromType);
6983  }
6984 
6985  const VectorType *toVector = CastType<VectorType>(toType);
6986  const VectorType *fromVector = CastType<VectorType>(fromType);
6987  if (toVector && fromVector) {
6988  // this should be caught during typechecking
6989  AssertPos(pos, toVector->GetElementCount() == fromVector->GetElementCount());
6990 
6991  llvm::Value *exprVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6992  if (!exprVal)
6993  return NULL;
6994 
6995  // Emit instructions to do type conversion of each of the elements
6996  // of the vector.
6997  // FIXME: since uniform vectors are represented as
6998  // llvm::VectorTypes, we should just be able to issue the
6999  // corresponding vector type convert, which should be more
7000  // efficient by avoiding serialization!
7001  llvm::Value *cast = llvm::UndefValue::get(toType->LLVMType(g->ctx));
7002  for (int i = 0; i < toVector->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
7003  llvm::Value *ei = ctx->ExtractInst(exprVal, i);
7004 
7005  llvm::Value *conv = lTypeConvAtomic(ctx, ei, toVector->GetElementType(),
7006  fromVector->GetElementType(), pos);
7007  if (!conv)
7008  return NULL;
7009  cast = ctx->InsertInst(cast, conv, i);
7010  }
7011  return cast;
7012  }
7013 
7014  llvm::Value *exprVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
7015  if (!exprVal)
7016  return NULL;
7017 
7018  const EnumType *fromEnum = CastType<EnumType>(fromType);
7019  const EnumType *toEnum = CastType<EnumType>(toType);
7020  if (fromEnum)
7021  // treat it as an uint32 type for the below and all will be good.
7022  fromType = fromEnum->IsUniformType() ? AtomicType::UniformUInt32 :
7023  AtomicType::VaryingUInt32;
7024  if (toEnum)
7025  // treat it as an uint32 type for the below and all will be good.
7026  toType = toEnum->IsUniformType() ? AtomicType::UniformUInt32 :
7027  AtomicType::VaryingUInt32;
7028 
7029  const AtomicType *fromAtomic = CastType<AtomicType>(fromType);
7030  // at this point, coming from an atomic type is all that's left...
7031  AssertPos(pos, fromAtomic != NULL);
7032 
7033  if (toVector) {
7034  // scalar -> short vector conversion
7035  llvm::Value *conv = lTypeConvAtomic(ctx, exprVal, toVector->GetElementType(),
7036  fromAtomic, pos);
7037  if (!conv)
7038  return NULL;
7039 
7040  llvm::Value *cast = NULL;
7041  llvm::Type* toTypeLLVM = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
7042  if (llvm::isa<llvm::VectorType>(toTypeLLVM)) {
7043  // Example uniform float => uniform float<3>
7044  cast = ctx->BroadcastValue(conv, toTypeLLVM);
7045  }
7046  else if (llvm::isa<llvm::ArrayType>(toTypeLLVM)) {
7047  // Example varying float => varying float<3>
