7048  cast = llvm::UndefValue::get(toType->LLVMType(g->ctx));
7049  for (int i = 0; i < toVector->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
7050  // Here's InsertInst produces InsertValueInst.
7051  cast = ctx->InsertInst(cast, conv, i);
7052  }
7053  }
7054  else {
7055  FATAL("TypeCastExpr::GetValue: problem with cast");
7056  }
7057 
7058  return cast;
7059  }
7060  else if (toPointerType != NULL) {
7061  // int -> ptr
7062  if (toType->IsVaryingType() && fromType->IsUniformType())
7063  exprVal = ctx->SmearUniform(exprVal);
7064 
7065  llvm::Type *llvmToType = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
7066  if (llvmToType == NULL)
7067  return NULL;
7068 
7069  return ctx->IntToPtrInst(exprVal, llvmToType, "int_to_ptr");
7070  }
7071  else {
7072  const AtomicType *toAtomic = CastType<AtomicType>(toType);
7073  // typechecking should ensure this is the case
7074  AssertPos(pos, toAtomic != NULL);
7075 
7076  return lTypeConvAtomic(ctx, exprVal, toAtomic, fromAtomic, pos);
7077  }
7078 }
7079 
7080 
7081 llvm::Value *
7082 TypeCastExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7083  if (GetLValueType() != NULL) {
7084  return GetValue(ctx);
7085  }
7086  else {
7087  return NULL;
7088  }
7089 }
7090 
7091 
7092 const Type *
7093 TypeCastExpr::GetType() const {
7094  // Here we try to resolve situation where (base_type) can be treated as
7095  // (uniform base_type) of (varying base_type). This is a part of function
7096  // TypeCastExpr::TypeCheck. After implementation of operators we
7097  // have to have this functionality here.
7098  const Type *toType = type, *fromType = expr->GetType();
7099  if (toType == NULL || fromType == NULL)
7100  return NULL;
7101  if (toType->HasUnboundVariability()) {
7102  if (fromType->IsUniformType()) {
7103  toType = type->ResolveUnboundVariability(Variability::Uniform);
7104  } else {
7105  toType = type->ResolveUnboundVariability(Variability::Varying);
7106  }
7107  }
7108  AssertPos(pos, toType->HasUnboundVariability() == false);
7109  return toType;
7110 }
7111 
7112 
7113 const Type *
7114 TypeCastExpr::GetLValueType() const {
7115  AssertPos(pos, type->HasUnboundVariability() == false);
7116  if (CastType<PointerType>(GetType()) != NULL) {
7117  return type;
7118  }
7119  else {
7120  return NULL;
7121  }
7122 }
7123 
7124 
7125 static const Type *
7126 lDeconstifyType(const Type *t) {
7127  const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(t);
7128  if (pt != NULL)
7129  return new PointerType(lDeconstifyType(pt->GetBaseType()),
7130  pt->GetVariability(), false);
7131  else
7132  return t->GetAsNonConstType();
7133 }
7134 
7135 
7136 Expr *
7137 TypeCastExpr::TypeCheck() {
7138  if (expr == NULL)
7139  return NULL;
7140 
7141  const Type *toType = type, *fromType = expr->GetType();
7142  if (toType == NULL || fromType == NULL)
7143  return NULL;
7144 
7145  if (toType->HasUnboundVariability() && fromType->IsUniformType()) {
7146  TypeCastExpr *tce = new TypeCastExpr(toType->GetAsUniformType(),
7147  expr, pos);
7148  return ::TypeCheck(tce);
7149  }
7150  type = toType = type->ResolveUnboundVariability(Variability::Varying);
7151 
7152  fromType = lDeconstifyType(fromType);
7153  toType = lDeconstifyType(toType);
7154 
7155  // Anything can be cast to void...
7156  if (Type::Equal(toType, AtomicType::Void))
7157  return this;
7158 
7159  if (Type::Equal(fromType, AtomicType::Void) ||
7160  (fromType->IsVaryingType() && toType->IsUniformType())) {
7161  Error(pos, "Can't type cast from type \"%s\" to type \"%s\"",
7162  fromType->GetString().c_str(), toType->GetString().c_str());
7163  return NULL;
7164  }
7165 
7166  // First some special cases that we allow only with an explicit type cast
7167  const PointerType *fromPtr = CastType<PointerType>(fromType);
7168  const PointerType *toPtr = CastType<PointerType>(toType);
7169  if (fromPtr != NULL && toPtr != NULL)
7170  // allow explicit typecasts between any two different pointer types
7171  return this;
7172 
7173  const AtomicType *fromAtomic = CastType<AtomicType>(fromType);
7174  const AtomicType *toAtomic = CastType<AtomicType>(toType);
7175  const EnumType *fromEnum = CastType<EnumType>(fromType);
7176  const EnumType *toEnum = CastType<EnumType>(toType);
7177  if ((fromAtomic || fromEnum) && (toAtomic || toEnum))
7178  // Allow explicit casts between all of these
7179  return this;
7180 
7181  // ptr -> int type casts
7182  if (fromPtr != NULL && toAtomic != NULL && toAtomic->IsIntType()) {
7183  bool safeCast = (toAtomic->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT64 ||
7184  toAtomic->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64);
7185  if (g->target->is32Bit())
7186  safeCast |= (toAtomic->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT32 ||
7187  toAtomic->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32);
7188  if (safeCast == false)
7189  Warning(pos, "Pointer type cast of type \"%s\" to integer type "
7190  "\"%s\" may lose information.",
7191  fromType->GetString().c_str(),
7192  toType->GetString().c_str());
7193  return this;
7194  }
7195 
7196  // int -> ptr
7197  if (fromAtomic != NULL && fromAtomic->IsIntType() && toPtr != NULL)
7198  return this;
7199 
7200  // And otherwise see if it's one of the conversions allowed to happen
7201  // implicitly.
7202  if (CanConvertTypes(fromType, toType, "type cast expression", pos) == false)
7203  return NULL;
7204 
7205  return this;
7206 }
7207 
7208 
7209 Expr *
7210 TypeCastExpr::Optimize() {
7211  ConstExpr *constExpr = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr);
7212  if (constExpr == NULL)
7213  // We can't do anything if this isn't a const expr
7214  return this;
7215 
7216  const Type *toType = GetType();
7217  const AtomicType *toAtomic = CastType<AtomicType>(toType);
7218  const EnumType *toEnum = CastType<EnumType>(toType);
7219  // If we're not casting to an atomic or enum type, we can't do anything
7220  // here, since ConstExprs can only represent those two types. (So
7221  // e.g. we're casting from an int to an int<4>.)
7222  if (toAtomic == NULL && toEnum == NULL)
7223  return this;
7224 
7225  bool forceVarying = toType->IsVaryingType();
7226 
7227  // All of the type conversion smarts we need is already in the
7228  // ConstExpr::GetValues(), etc., methods, so we just need to call the
7229  // appropriate one for the type that this cast is converting to.
7230  AtomicType::BasicType basicType = toAtomic ? toAtomic->basicType :
7231  AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32;
7232  switch (basicType) {
7233  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: {
7234  bool bv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
7235  constExpr->GetValues(bv, forceVarying);
7236  return new ConstExpr(toType, bv, pos);
7237  }
7238  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: {
7239  int8_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
7240  constExpr->GetValues(iv, forceVarying);
7241  return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
7242  }
7243  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: {
7244  uint8_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
7245  constExpr->GetValues(uv, forceVarying);
7246  return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
7247  }
7248  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: {
7249  int16_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
7250  constExpr->GetValues(iv, forceVarying);
7251  return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
7252  }
7253  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: {
7254  uint16_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
7255  constExpr->GetValues(uv, forceVarying);
7256  return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
7257  }
7258  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: {
7259  int32_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
7260  constExpr->GetValues(iv, forceVarying);
7261  return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
7262  }
7263  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: {
7264  uint32_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
7265  constExpr->GetValues(uv, forceVarying);
7266  return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
7267  }
7268  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: {
7269  float fv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
7270  constExpr->GetValues(fv, forceVarying);
7271  return new ConstExpr(toType, fv, pos);
7272  }
7273  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: {
7274  int64_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
7275  constExpr->GetValues(iv, forceVarying);
7276  return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
7277  }
7278  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: {
7279  uint64_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
7280  constExpr->GetValues(uv, forceVarying);
7281  return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
7282  }
7283  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: {
7284  double dv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
7285  constExpr->GetValues(dv, forceVarying);
7286  return new ConstExpr(toType, dv, pos);
7287  }
7288  default:
7289  FATAL("unimplemented");
7290  }
7291  return this;
7292 }
7293 
7294 
7295 int
7296 TypeCastExpr::EstimateCost() const {
7297  if (dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr) != NULL)
7298  return 0;
7299 
7300  // FIXME: return COST_TYPECAST_COMPLEX when appropriate
7301  return COST_TYPECAST_SIMPLE;
7302 }
7303 
7304 
7305 void
7306 TypeCastExpr::Print() const {
7307  printf("[%s] type cast (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
7308  expr->Print();
7309  printf(")");
7310  pos.Print();
7311 }
7312 
7313 
7314 Symbol *
7315 TypeCastExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
7316  return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
7317 }
7318 
7319 
7320 static
7321 llvm::Constant *
7322 lConvertPointerConstant(llvm::Constant *c, const Type *constType) {
7323  if (c == NULL || constType->IsUniformType())
7324  return c;
7325 
7326  // Handle conversion to int and then to vector of int or array of int
7327  // (for varying and soa types, respectively)
7328  llvm::Constant *intPtr =
7329  llvm::ConstantExpr::getPtrToInt(c, LLVMTypes::PointerIntType);
7330  Assert(constType->IsVaryingType() || constType->IsSOAType());
7331  int count = constType->IsVaryingType() ? g->target->getVectorWidth() :
7332  constType->GetSOAWidth();
7333 
7334  std::vector<llvm::Constant *> smear;
7335  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
7336  smear.push_back(intPtr);
7337 
7338  if (constType->IsVaryingType())
7339  return llvm::ConstantVector::get(smear);
7340  else {
7341  llvm::ArrayType *at =
7342  llvm::ArrayType::get(LLVMTypes::PointerIntType, count);
7343  return llvm::ConstantArray::get(at, smear);
7344  }
7345 }
7346 
7347 
7348 llvm::Constant *
7349 TypeCastExpr::GetConstant(const Type *constType) const {
7350  // We don't need to worry about most the basic cases where the type
7351  // cast can resolve to a constant here, since the
7352  // TypeCastExpr::Optimize() method generally ends up doing the type
7353  // conversion and returning a ConstExpr, which in turn will have its
7354  // GetConstant() method called. However, because ConstExpr currently
7355  // can't represent pointer values, we have to handle a few cases
7356  // related to pointers here:
7357  //
7358  // 1. Null pointer (NULL, 0) valued initializers
7359  // 2. Converting function types to pointer-to-function types
7360  // 3. And converting these from uniform to the varying/soa equivalents.
7361  //
7362  if (CastType<PointerType>(constType) == NULL)
7363  return NULL;
7364 
7365  llvm::Constant *c = expr->GetConstant(constType->GetAsUniformType());
7366  return lConvertPointerConstant(c, constType);
7367 }
7368 
7369 
7370 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7371 // ReferenceExpr
7372 
7373 ReferenceExpr::ReferenceExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p)
7374  : Expr(p) {
7375  expr = e;
7376 }
7377 
7378 
7379 llvm::Value *
7380 ReferenceExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7381  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
7382  if (expr == NULL) {
7383  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7384  return NULL;
7385  }
7386 
7387  llvm::Value *value = expr->GetLValue(ctx);
7388  if (value != NULL)
7389  return value;
7390 
7391  // value is NULL if the expression is a temporary; in this case, we'll
7392  // allocate storage for it so that we can return the pointer to that...
7393  const Type *type;
7394  llvm::Type *llvmType;
7395  if ((type = expr->GetType()) == NULL ||
7396  (llvmType = type->LLVMType(g->ctx)) == NULL) {
7397  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7398  return NULL;
7399  }
7400 
7401  value = expr->GetValue(ctx);
7402  if (value == NULL) {
7403  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7404  return NULL;
7405  }
7406 
7407  llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->AllocaInst(llvmType);
7408  ctx->StoreInst(value, ptr);
7409  return ptr;
7410 }
7411 
7412 
7413 Symbol *
7414 ReferenceExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
7415  return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
7416 }
7417 
7418 
7419 const Type *
7420 ReferenceExpr::GetType() const {
7421  if (!expr)
7422  return NULL;
7423 
7424  const Type *type = expr->GetType();
7425  if (!type)
7426  return NULL;
7427 
7428  return new ReferenceType(type);
7429 }
7430 
7431 
7432 const Type *
7433 ReferenceExpr::GetLValueType() const {
7434  if (!expr)
7435  return NULL;
7436 
7437  const Type *type = expr->GetType();
7438  if (!type)
7439  return NULL;
7440 
7441  return PointerType::GetUniform(type);
7442 }
7443 
7444 
7445 Expr *
7446 ReferenceExpr::Optimize() {
7447  if (expr == NULL)
7448  return NULL;
7449  return this;
7450 }
7451 
7452 
7453 Expr *
7454 ReferenceExpr::TypeCheck() {
7455  if (expr == NULL)
7456  return NULL;
7457  return this;
7458 }
7459 
7460 
7461 int
7462 ReferenceExpr::EstimateCost() const {
7463  return 0;
7464 }
7465 
7466 
7467 void
7468 ReferenceExpr::Print() const {
7469  if (expr == NULL || GetType() == NULL)
7470  return;
7471 
7472  printf("[%s] &(", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
7473  expr->Print();
7474  printf(")");
7475  pos.Print();
7476 }
7477 
7478 
7479 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7480 // DerefExpr
7481 
7482 DerefExpr::DerefExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p)
7483  : Expr(p) {
7484  expr = e;
7485 }
7486 
7487 
7488 llvm::Value *
7489 DerefExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7490  if (expr == NULL)
7491  return NULL;
7492  llvm::Value *ptr = expr->GetValue(ctx);
7493  if (ptr == NULL)
7494  return NULL;
7495  const Type *type = expr->GetType();
7496  if (type == NULL)
7497  return NULL;
7498 
7499  if (lVaryingStructHasUniformMember(type, pos))
7500  return NULL;
7501 
7502  Symbol *baseSym = expr->GetBaseSymbol();
7503  llvm::Value *mask = baseSym ? lMaskForSymbol(baseSym, ctx) :
7504  ctx->GetFullMask();
7505 
7506  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
7507  return ctx->LoadInst(ptr, mask, type);
7508 }
7509 
7510 
7511 llvm::Value *
7512 DerefExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7513  if (expr == NULL)
7514  return NULL;
7515  return expr->GetValue(ctx);
7516 }
7517 
7518 
7519 const Type *
7520 DerefExpr::GetLValueType() const {
7521  if (expr == NULL)
7522  return NULL;
7523  return expr->GetType();
7524 }
7525 
7526 
7527 Symbol *
7528 DerefExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
7529  return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
7530 }
7531 
7532 
7533 Expr *
7534 DerefExpr::Optimize() {
7535  if (expr == NULL)
7536  return NULL;
7537  return this;
7538 }
7539 
7540 
7541 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7542 // PtrDerefExpr
7543 
7544 PtrDerefExpr::PtrDerefExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p)
7545  : DerefExpr(e, p) {
7546 }
7547 
7548 
7549 const Type *
7550 PtrDerefExpr::GetType() const {
7551  const Type *type;
7552  if (expr == NULL || (type = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
7553  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7554  return NULL;
7555  }
7556  AssertPos(pos, CastType<PointerType>(type) != NULL);
7557 
7558  if (type->IsUniformType())
7559  return type->GetBaseType();
7560  else
7561  return type->GetBaseType()->GetAsVaryingType();
7562 }
7563 
7564 
7565 Expr *
7566 PtrDerefExpr::TypeCheck() {
7567  const Type *type;
7568  if (expr == NULL || (type = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
7569  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7570  return NULL;
7571  }
7572 
7573  if (const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(type)) {
7574  if (Type::Equal(AtomicType::Void, pt->GetBaseType())) {
7575  Error(pos, "Illegal to dereference void pointer type \"%s\".",
7576  type->GetString().c_str());
7577  return NULL;
7578  }
7579  }
7580  else {
7581  Error(pos, "Illegal to dereference non-pointer type \"%s\".",
7582  type->GetString().c_str());
7583  return NULL;
7584  }
7585 
7586  return this;
7587 }
7588 
7589 
7590 int
7591 PtrDerefExpr::EstimateCost() const {
7592  const Type *type;
7593  if (expr == NULL || (type = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
7594  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7595  return 0;
7596  }
7597 
7598  if (type->IsVaryingType())
7599  // Be pessimistic; some of these will later be optimized into
7600  // vector loads/stores..
7601  return COST_GATHER + COST_DEREF;
7602  else
7603  return COST_DEREF;
7604 }
7605 
7606 
7607 void
7608 PtrDerefExpr::Print() const {
7609  if (expr == NULL || GetType() == NULL)
7610  return;
7611 
7612  printf("[%s] *(", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
7613  expr->Print();
7614  printf(")");
7615  pos.Print();
7616 }
7617 
7618 
7619 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7620 // RefDerefExpr
7621 
7622 RefDerefExpr::RefDerefExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p)
7623  : DerefExpr(e, p) {
7624 }
7625 
7626 
7627 const Type *
7628 RefDerefExpr::GetType() const {
7629  const Type *type;
7630  if (expr == NULL || (type = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
7631  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7632  return NULL;
7633  }
7634 
7635  AssertPos(pos, CastType<ReferenceType>(type) != NULL);
7636  return type->GetReferenceTarget();
7637 }
7638 
7639 
7640 Expr *
7641 RefDerefExpr::TypeCheck() {
7642  const Type *type;
7643  if (expr == NULL || (type = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
7644  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7645  return NULL;
7646  }
7647 
7648  // We only create RefDerefExprs internally for references in
7649  // expressions, so we should never create one with a non-reference
7650  // expression...
7651  AssertPos(pos, CastType<ReferenceType>(type) != NULL);
7652 
7653  return this;
7654 }
7655 
7656 
7657 int
7658 RefDerefExpr::EstimateCost() const {
7659  if (expr == NULL)
7660  return 0;
7661 
7662  return COST_DEREF;
7663 }
7664 
7665 
7666 void
7667 RefDerefExpr::Print() const {
7668  if (expr == NULL || GetType() == NULL)
7669  return;
7670 
7671  printf("[%s] deref-reference (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
7672  expr->Print();
7673  printf(")");
7674  pos.Print();
7675 }
7676 
7677 
7678 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7679 // AddressOfExpr
7680 
7681 AddressOfExpr::AddressOfExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p)
7682  : Expr(p), expr(e) {
7683 }
7684 
7685 
7686 llvm::Value *
7687 AddressOfExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7688  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
7689  if (expr == NULL)
7690  return NULL;
7691 
7692  const Type *exprType = expr->GetType();
7693  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(exprType) != NULL ||
7694  CastType<FunctionType>(exprType) != NULL)
7695  return expr->GetValue(ctx);
7696  else
7697  return expr->GetLValue(ctx);
7698 }
7699 
7700 
7701 const Type *
7702 AddressOfExpr::GetType() const {
7703  if (expr == NULL)
7704  return NULL;
7705 
7706  const Type *exprType = expr->GetType();
7707  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(exprType) != NULL)
7708  return PointerType::GetUniform(exprType->GetReferenceTarget());
7709 
7710  const Type *t = expr->GetLValueType();
7711  if (t != NULL)
7712  return t;
7713  else {
7714  t = expr->GetType();
7715  if (t == NULL) {
7716  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7717  return NULL;
7718  }
7719  return PointerType::GetUniform(t);
7720  }
7721 }
7722 
7723 
7724 Symbol *
7725 AddressOfExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
7726  return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
7727 }
7728 
7729 
7730 void
7731 AddressOfExpr::Print() const {
7732  printf("&(");
7733  if (expr)
7734  expr->Print();
7735  else
7736  printf("NULL expr");
7737  printf(")");
7738  pos.Print();
7739 }
7740 
7741 
7742 Expr *
7743 AddressOfExpr::TypeCheck() {
7744  const Type *exprType;
7745  if (expr == NULL || (exprType = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
7746  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7747  return NULL;
7748  }
7749 
7750  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(exprType) != NULL ||
7751  CastType<FunctionType>(exprType) != NULL) {
7752  return this;
7753  }
7754 
7755  if (expr->GetLValueType() != NULL)
7756  return this;
7757 
7758  Error(expr->pos, "Illegal to take address of non-lvalue or function.");
7759  return NULL;
7760 }
7761 
7762 
7763 Expr *
7764 AddressOfExpr::Optimize() {
7765  return this;
7766 }
7767 
7768 
7769 int
7770 AddressOfExpr::EstimateCost() const {
7771  return 0;
7772 }
7773 
7774 
7775 llvm::Constant *
7776 AddressOfExpr::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
7777  const Type *exprType;
7778  if (expr == NULL || (exprType = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
7779  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7780  return NULL;
7781  }
7782 
7783  const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(type);
7784  if (pt == NULL)
7785  return NULL;
7786 
7787  const FunctionType *ft = CastType<FunctionType>(pt->GetBaseType());
7788  if (ft != NULL) {
7789  llvm::Constant *c = expr->GetConstant(ft);
7790  return lConvertPointerConstant(c, type);
7791  }
7792  else
7793  return NULL;
7794 }
7795 
7796 
7797 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7798 // SizeOfExpr
7799 
7800 SizeOfExpr::SizeOfExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p)
7801  : Expr(p), expr(e), type(NULL) {
7802 }
7803 
7804 
7805 SizeOfExpr::SizeOfExpr(const Type *t, SourcePos p)
7806  : Expr(p), expr(NULL), type(t) {
7807  type = type->ResolveUnboundVariability(Variability::Varying);
7808 }
7809 
7810 
7811 llvm::Value *
7812 SizeOfExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7813  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
7814  const Type *t = expr ? expr->GetType() : type;
7815  if (t == NULL)
7816  return NULL;
7817 
7818  llvm::Type *llvmType = t->LLVMType(g->ctx);
7819  if (llvmType == NULL)
7820  return NULL;
7821 
7822  return g->target->SizeOf(llvmType, ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
7823 }
7824 
7825 
7826 const Type *
7827 SizeOfExpr::GetType() const {
7828  return (g->target->is32Bit() || g->opt.force32BitAddressing) ?
7829  AtomicType::UniformUInt32 : AtomicType::UniformUInt64;
7830 }
7831 
7832 
7833 void
7834 SizeOfExpr::Print() const {
7835  printf("Sizeof (");
7836  if (expr != NULL)
7837  expr->Print();
7838  const Type *t = expr ? expr->GetType() : type;
7839  if (t != NULL)
7840  printf(" [type %s]", t->GetString().c_str());
7841  printf(")");
7842  pos.Print();
7843 }
7844 
7845 
7846 Expr *
7847 SizeOfExpr::TypeCheck() {
7848  // Can't compute the size of a struct without a definition
7849  if (type != NULL &&
7850  CastType<UndefinedStructType>(type) != NULL) {
7851  Error(pos, "Can't compute the size of declared but not defined "
7852  "struct type \"%s\".", type->GetString().c_str());
7853  return NULL;
7854  }
7855 
7856  return this;
7857 }
7858 
7859 
7860 Expr *
7861 SizeOfExpr::Optimize() {
7862  return this;
7863 }
7864 
7865 
7866 int
7867 SizeOfExpr::EstimateCost() const {
7868  return 0;
7869 }
7870 
7871 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7872 // SymbolExpr
7873 
7874 SymbolExpr::SymbolExpr(Symbol *s, SourcePos p)
7875  : Expr(p) {
7876  symbol = s;
7877 }
7878 
7879 
7880 llvm::Value *
7881 SymbolExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7882  // storagePtr may be NULL due to an earlier compilation error
7883  if (!symbol || !symbol->storagePtr)
7884  return NULL;
7885  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
7886 
7887  std::string loadName = symbol->name + std::string("_load");
7888  return ctx->LoadInst(symbol->storagePtr, loadName.c_str());
7889 }
7890 
7891 
7892 llvm::Value *
7893 SymbolExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7894  if (symbol == NULL)
7895  return NULL;
7896  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
7897  return symbol->storagePtr;
7898 }
7899 
7900 
7901 const Type *
7902 SymbolExpr::GetLValueType() const {
7903  if (symbol == NULL)
7904  return NULL;
7905 
7906  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(symbol->type) != NULL)
7907  return PointerType::GetUniform(symbol->type->GetReferenceTarget());
7908  else
7909  return PointerType::GetUniform(symbol->type);
7910 }
7911 
7912 
7913 Symbol *
7914 SymbolExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
7915  return symbol;
7916 }
7917 
7918 
7919 const Type *
7920 SymbolExpr::GetType() const {
7921  return symbol ? symbol->type : NULL;
7922 }
7923 
7924 
7925 Expr *
7926 SymbolExpr::TypeCheck() {
7927  return this;
7928 }
7929 
7930 
7931 Expr *
7932 SymbolExpr::Optimize() {
7933  if (symbol == NULL)
7934  return NULL;
7935  else if (symbol->constValue != NULL) {
7936  AssertPos(pos, GetType()->IsConstType());
7937  return new ConstExpr(symbol->constValue, pos);
7938  }
7939  else
7940  return this;
7941 }
7942 
7943 
7944 int
7945 SymbolExpr::EstimateCost() const {
7946  // Be optimistic and assume it's in a register or can be used as a
7947  // memory operand..
7948  return 0;
7949 }
7950 
7951 
7952 void
7953 SymbolExpr::Print() const {
7954  if (symbol == NULL || GetType() == NULL)
7955  return;
7956 
7957  printf("[%s] sym: (%s)", GetType()->GetString().c_str(),
7958  symbol->name.c_str());
7959  pos.Print();
7960 }
7961 
7962 
7963 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7964 // FunctionSymbolExpr
7965 
7966 FunctionSymbolExpr::FunctionSymbolExpr(const char *n,
7967  const std::vector<Symbol *> &candidates,
7968  SourcePos p)
7969  : Expr(p) {
7970  name = n;
7971  candidateFunctions = candidates;
7972  matchingFunc = (candidates.size() == 1) ? candidates[0] : NULL;
7973  triedToResolve = false;
7974 }
7975 
7976 
7977 const Type *
7978 FunctionSymbolExpr::GetType() const {
7979  if (triedToResolve == false && matchingFunc == NULL) {
7980  Error(pos, "Ambiguous use of overloaded function \"%s\".",
7981  name.c_str());
7982  return NULL;
7983  }
7984 
7985  return matchingFunc ? matchingFunc->type : NULL;
7986 }
7987 
7988 
7989 llvm::Value *
7990 FunctionSymbolExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7991  return matchingFunc ? matchingFunc->function : NULL;
7992 }
7993 
7994 
7995 Symbol *
7996 FunctionSymbolExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
7997  return matchingFunc;
7998 }
7999 
8000 
8001 Expr *
8002 FunctionSymbolExpr::TypeCheck() {
8003  return this;
8004 }
8005 
8006 
8007 Expr *
8008 FunctionSymbolExpr::Optimize() {
8009  return this;
8010 }
8011 
8012 
8013 int
8014 FunctionSymbolExpr::EstimateCost() const {
8015  return 0;
8016 }
8017 
8018 
8019 void
8020 FunctionSymbolExpr::Print() const {
8021  if (!matchingFunc || !GetType())
8022  return;
8023 
8024  printf("[%s] fun sym (%s)", GetType()->GetString().c_str(),
8025  matchingFunc->name.c_str());
8026  pos.Print();
8027 }
8028 
8029 
8030 llvm::Constant *
8031 FunctionSymbolExpr::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
8032  if (matchingFunc == NULL || matchingFunc->function == NULL)
8033  return NULL;
8034 
8035  const FunctionType *ft = CastType<FunctionType>(type);
8036  if (ft == NULL)
8037  return NULL;
8038 
8039  if (Type::Equal(type, matchingFunc->type) == false) {
8040  Error(pos, "Type of function symbol \"%s\" doesn't match expected type "
8041  "\"%s\".", matchingFunc->type->GetString().c_str(),
8042  type->GetString().c_str());
8043  return NULL;
8044  }
8045 
8046  return matchingFunc->function;
8047 }
8048 
8049 
8050 static std::string
8051 lGetOverloadCandidateMessage(const std::vector<Symbol *> &funcs,
8052  const std::vector<const Type *> &argTypes,
8053  const std::vector<bool> *argCouldBeNULL) {
8054  std::string message = "Passed types: (";
8055  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < argTypes.size(); ++i) {
8056  if (argTypes[i] != NULL)
8057  message += argTypes[i]->GetString();
8058  else
8059  message += "(unknown type)";
8060  message += (i < argTypes.size()-1) ? ", " : ")\n";
8061  }
8062 
8063  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < funcs.size(); ++i) {
8064  const FunctionType *ft = CastType<FunctionType>(funcs[i]->type);
8065  Assert(ft != NULL);
8066  message += "Candidate: ";
8067  message += ft->GetString();
8068  if (i < funcs.size() - 1)
8069  message += "\n";
8070  }
8071  return message;
8072 }
8073 
8074 
8075 static bool
8076 lIsMatchToNonConstReference(const Type *callType, const Type *funcArgType) {
8077  return (CastType<ReferenceType>(funcArgType) &&
8078  (funcArgType->IsConstType() == false) &&
8079  Type::Equal(callType, funcArgType->GetReferenceTarget()));
8080 }
8081 
8082 
8083 static bool
8084 lIsMatchToNonConstReferenceUnifToVarying(const Type *callType,
8085  const Type *funcArgType) {
8086  return (CastType<ReferenceType>(funcArgType) &&
8087  (funcArgType->IsConstType() == false) &&
8088  Type::Equal(callType->GetAsVaryingType(),
8089  funcArgType->GetReferenceTarget()));
8090 }
8091 
8092 /** Helper function used for function overload resolution: returns true if
8093  converting the argument to the call type only requires a type
8094  conversion that won't lose information. Otherwise return false.
8095  */
8096 static bool
8097 lIsMatchWithTypeWidening(const Type *callType, const Type *funcArgType) {
8098  const AtomicType *callAt = CastType<AtomicType>(callType);
8099  const AtomicType *funcAt = CastType<AtomicType>(funcArgType);
8100  if (callAt == NULL || funcAt == NULL)
8101  return false;
8102 
8103  if (callAt->IsUniformType() != funcAt->IsUniformType())
8104  return false;
8105 
8106  switch (callAt->basicType) {
8107  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
8108  return true;
8109  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
8110  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
8111  return (funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL);
8112  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
8113  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
8114  return (funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL &&
8115  funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_INT8 &&
8116  funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8);
8117  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
8118  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
8119  return (funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT32 ||
8120  funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32 ||
8121  funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT64 ||
8122  funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64);
8123  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
8124  return (funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE);
8125  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
8126  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
8127  return (funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT64 ||
8128  funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64);
8129  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
8130  return false;
8131  default:
8132  FATAL("Unhandled atomic type");
8133  return false;
8134  }
8135 }
8136 
8137 
8138 /** Helper function used for function overload resolution: returns true if
8139  the call argument type and the function argument type match if we only
8140  do a uniform -> varying type conversion but otherwise have exactly the
8141  same type.
8142  */
8143 static bool
8144 lIsMatchWithUniformToVarying(const Type *callType, const Type *funcArgType) {
8145  return (callType->IsUniformType() &&
8146  funcArgType->IsVaryingType() &&
8147  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(callType->GetAsVaryingType(), funcArgType));
8148 }
8149 
8150 
8151 /** Helper function used for function overload resolution: returns true if
8152  we can type convert from the call argument type to the function
8153  argument type, but without doing a uniform -> varying conversion.
8154  */
8155 static bool
8156 lIsMatchWithTypeConvSameVariability(const Type *callType,
8157  const Type *funcArgType) {
8158  return (CanConvertTypes(callType, funcArgType) &&
8159  (callType->GetVariability() == funcArgType->GetVariability()));
8160 }
8161 
8162 
8163 /* Returns the set of function overloads that are potential matches, given
8164  argCount values being passed as arguments to the function call.
8165  */
8166 std::vector<Symbol *>
8167 FunctionSymbolExpr::getCandidateFunctions(int argCount) const {
8168  std::vector<Symbol *> ret;
8169  for (int i = 0; i < (int)candidateFunctions.size(); ++i) {
8170  const FunctionType *ft =
8171  CastType<FunctionType>(candidateFunctions[i]->type);
8172  AssertPos(pos, ft != NULL);
8173 
8174  // There's no way to match if the caller is passing more arguments
8175  // than this function instance takes.
8176  if (argCount > ft->GetNumParameters())
8177  continue;
8178 
8179  // Not enough arguments, and no default argument value to save us
8180  if (argCount < ft->GetNumParameters() &&
8181  ft->GetParameterDefault(argCount) == NULL)
8182  continue;
8183 
8184  // Success
8185  ret.push_back(candidateFunctions[i]);
8186  }
8187  return ret;
8188 }
8189 
8190 
8191 static bool
8192 lArgIsPointerType(const Type *type) {
8193  if (CastType<PointerType>(type) != NULL)
8194  return true;
8195 
8196  const ReferenceType *rt = CastType<ReferenceType>(type);
8197  if (rt == NULL)
8198  return false;
8199 
8200  const Type *t = rt->GetReferenceTarget();
8201  return (CastType<PointerType>(t) != NULL);
8202 }
8203 
8204 
8205 /** This function computes the value of a cost function that represents the
8206  cost of calling a function of the given type with arguments of the
8207  given types. If it's not possible to call the function, regardless of
8208  any type conversions applied, a cost of -1 is returned.
8209  */
8210 int
8211 FunctionSymbolExpr::computeOverloadCost(const FunctionType *ftype,
8212  const std::vector<const Type *> &argTypes,
8213  const std::vector<bool> *argCouldBeNULL,
8214  const std::vector<bool> *argIsConstant) {
8215  int costSum = 0;
8216 
8217  // In computing the cost function, we only worry about the actual
8218  // argument types--using function default parameter values is free for
8219  // the purposes here...
8220  for (int i = 0; i < (int)argTypes.size(); ++i) {
8221  // The cost imposed by this argument will be a multiple of
8222  // costScale, which has a value set so that for each of the cost
8223  // buckets, even if all of the function arguments undergo the next
8224  // lower-cost conversion, the sum of their costs will be less than
8225  // a single instance of the next higher-cost conversion.
8226  int costScale = argTypes.size() + 1;
8227 
8228  const Type *fargType = ftype->GetParameterType(i);
8229  const Type *callType = argTypes[i];
8230 
8231  if (Type::Equal(callType, fargType))
8232  // Perfect match: no cost
8233  costSum += 0;
8234  else if (argCouldBeNULL && (*argCouldBeNULL)[i] &&
8235  lArgIsPointerType(fargType))
8236  // Passing NULL to a pointer-typed parameter is also a no-cost
8237  // operation
8238  costSum += 0;
8239  else {
8240  // If the argument is a compile-time constant, we'd like to
8241  // count the cost of various conversions as much lower than the
8242  // cost if it wasn't--so scale up the cost when this isn't the
8243  // case..
8244  if (argIsConstant == NULL || (*argIsConstant)[i] == false)
8245  costScale *= 128;
8246 
8247  // For convenience, normalize to non-const types (except for
8248  // references, where const-ness matters). For all other types,
8249  // we're passing by value anyway, so const doesn't matter.
8250  const Type *callTypeNC = callType, *fargTypeNC = fargType;
8251  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(callType) == NULL)
8252  callTypeNC = callType->GetAsNonConstType();
8253  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(fargType) == NULL)
8254  fargTypeNC = fargType->GetAsNonConstType();
8255 
8256  if (Type::Equal(callTypeNC, fargTypeNC))
8257  // Exact match (after dealing with references, above)
8258  costSum += 1 * costScale;
8259  // note: orig fargType for the next two...
8260  else if (lIsMatchToNonConstReference(callTypeNC, fargType))
8261  costSum += 2 * costScale;
8262  else if (lIsMatchToNonConstReferenceUnifToVarying(callTypeNC, fargType))
8263  costSum += 4 * costScale;
8264  else if (lIsMatchWithTypeWidening(callTypeNC, fargTypeNC))
8265  costSum += 8 * costScale;
8266  else if (lIsMatchWithUniformToVarying(callTypeNC, fargTypeNC))
8267  costSum += 16 * costScale;
8268  else if (lIsMatchWithTypeConvSameVariability(callTypeNC, fargTypeNC))
8269  costSum += 32 * costScale;
8270  else if (CanConvertTypes(callTypeNC, fargTypeNC))
8271  costSum += 64 * costScale;
8272  else
8273  // Failure--no type conversion possible...
8274  return -1;
8275  }
8276  }
8277 
8278  return costSum;
8279 }
8280 
8281 
8282 bool
8283 FunctionSymbolExpr::ResolveOverloads(SourcePos argPos,
8284  const std::vector<const Type *> &argTypes,
8285  const std::vector<bool> *argCouldBeNULL,
8286  const std::vector<bool> *argIsConstant) {
8287  const char *funName = candidateFunctions.front()->name.c_str();
8288  if (triedToResolve == true) {
8289  return true;
8290  }
8291 
8292  triedToResolve = true;
8293 
8294  // Functions with names that start with "__" should only be various
8295  // builtins. For those, we'll demand an exact match, since we'll
8296  // expect whichever function in stdlib.ispc is calling out to one of
8297  // those to be matching the argument types exactly; this is to be a bit
8298  // extra safe to be sure that the expected builtin is in fact being
8299  // called.
8300  bool exactMatchOnly = (name.substr(0,2) == "__");
8301 
8302  // First, find the subset of overload candidates that take the same
8303  // number of arguments as have parameters (including functions that
8304  // take more arguments but have defaults starting no later than after
8305  // our last parameter).
8306  std::vector<Symbol *> actualCandidates =
8307  getCandidateFunctions(argTypes.size());
8308 
8309  int bestMatchCost = 1<<30;
8310  std::vector<Symbol *> matches;
8311  std::vector<int> candidateCosts;
8312 
8313  if (actualCandidates.size() == 0)
8314  goto failure;
8315 
8316  // Compute the cost for calling each of the candidate functions
8317  for (int i = 0; i < (int)actualCandidates.size(); ++i) {
8318  const FunctionType *ft =
8319  CastType<FunctionType>(actualCandidates[i]->type);
8320  AssertPos(pos, ft != NULL);
8321  candidateCosts.push_back(computeOverloadCost(ft, argTypes,
8322  argCouldBeNULL,
8323  argIsConstant));
8324  }
8325 
8326  // Find the best cost, and then the candidate or candidates that have
8327  // that cost.
8328  for (int i = 0; i < (int)candidateCosts.size(); ++i) {
8329  if (candidateCosts[i] != -1 && candidateCosts[i] < bestMatchCost)
8330  bestMatchCost = candidateCosts[i];
8331  }
8332  // None of the candidates matched
8333  if (bestMatchCost == (1<<30))
8334  goto failure;
8335  for (int i = 0; i < (int)candidateCosts.size(); ++i) {
8336  if (candidateCosts[i] == bestMatchCost)
8337  matches.push_back(actualCandidates[i]);
8338  }
8339 
8340  if (matches.size() == 1) {
8341  // Only one match: success
8342  matchingFunc = matches[0];
8343  return true;
8344  }
8345  else if (matches.size() > 1) {
8346  // Multiple matches: ambiguous
8347  std::string candidateMessage =
8348  lGetOverloadCandidateMessage(matches, argTypes, argCouldBeNULL);
8349  Error(pos, "Multiple overloaded functions matched call to function "
8350  "\"%s\"%s.\n%s", funName,
8351  exactMatchOnly ? " only considering exact matches" : "",
8352  candidateMessage.c_str());
8353  return false;
8354  }
8355  else {
8356  // No matches at all
8357  failure:
8358  std::string candidateMessage =
8359  lGetOverloadCandidateMessage(matches, argTypes, argCouldBeNULL);
8360  Error(pos, "Unable to find any matching overload for call to function "
8361  "\"%s\"%s.\n%s", funName,
8362  exactMatchOnly ? " only considering exact matches" : "",
8363  candidateMessage.c_str());
8364  return false;
8365  }
8366 }
8367 
8368 
8369 Symbol *
8370 FunctionSymbolExpr::GetMatchingFunction() {
8371  return matchingFunc;
8372 }
8373 
8374 
8375 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
8376 // SyncExpr
8377 
8378 const Type *
8379 SyncExpr::GetType() const {
8380  return AtomicType::Void;
8381 }
8382 
8383 
8384 llvm::Value *
8385 SyncExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
8386  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
8387  ctx->SyncInst();
8388  return NULL;
8389 }
8390 
8391 
8392 int
8393 SyncExpr::EstimateCost() const {
8394  return COST_SYNC;
8395 }
8396 
8397 
8398 void
8399 SyncExpr::Print() const {
8400  printf("sync");
8401  pos.Print();
8402 }
8403 
8404 
8405 Expr *
8406 SyncExpr::TypeCheck() {
8407  return this;
8408 }
8409 
8410 
8411 Expr *
8412 SyncExpr::Optimize() {
8413  return this;
8414 }
8415 
8416 
8417 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
8418 // NullPointerExpr
8419 
8420 llvm::Value *
8421 NullPointerExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
8422  return llvm::ConstantPointerNull::get(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType);
8423 }
8424 
8425 
8426 const Type *
8427 NullPointerExpr::GetType() const {
8428  return PointerType::Void;
8429 }
8430 
8431 
8432 Expr *
8433 NullPointerExpr::TypeCheck() {
8434  return this;
8435 }
8436 
8437 
8438 Expr *
8439 NullPointerExpr::Optimize() {
8440  return this;
8441 }
8442 
8443 
8444 llvm::Constant *
8445 NullPointerExpr::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
8446  const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(type);
8447  if (pt == NULL)
8448  return NULL;
8449 
8450  llvm::Type *llvmType = type->LLVMType(g->ctx);
8451  if (llvmType == NULL) {
8452  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
8453  return NULL;
8454  }
8455 
8456  return llvm::Constant::getNullValue(llvmType);
8457 }
8458 
8459 
8460 void
8461 NullPointerExpr::Print() const {
8462  printf("NULL");
8463  pos.Print();
8464 }
8465 
8466 
8467 int
8468 NullPointerExpr::EstimateCost() const {
8469  return 0;
8470 }
8471 
8472 
8473 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
8474 // NewExpr
8475 
8476 NewExpr::NewExpr(int typeQual, const Type *t, Expr *init, Expr *count,
8477  SourcePos tqPos, SourcePos p)
8478  : Expr(p) {
8479  allocType = t;
8480 
8481  initExpr = init;
8482  countExpr = count;
8483 
8484  /* (The below cases actually should be impossible, since the parser
8485  doesn't allow more than a single type qualifier before a "new".) */
8486  if ((typeQual & ~(TYPEQUAL_UNIFORM | TYPEQUAL_VARYING)) != 0) {
8487  Error(tqPos, "Illegal type qualifiers in \"new\" expression (only "
8488  "\"uniform\" and \"varying\" are allowed.");
8489  isVarying = false;
8490  }
8491  else if ((typeQual & TYPEQUAL_UNIFORM) != 0 &&
8492  (typeQual & TYPEQUAL_VARYING) != 0) {
8493  Error(tqPos, "Illegal to provide both \"uniform\" and \"varying\" "
8494  "qualifiers to \"new\" expression.");
8495  isVarying = false;
8496  }
8497  else
8498  // If no type qualifier is given before the 'new', treat it as a
8499  // varying new.
8500  isVarying = (typeQual == 0) || (typeQual & TYPEQUAL_VARYING);
8501 
8502  if (allocType != NULL)
8503  allocType = allocType->ResolveUnboundVariability(Variability::Uniform);
8504 }
8505 
8506 
8507 llvm::Value *
8508 NewExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
8509  bool do32Bit = (g->target->is32Bit() || g->opt.force32BitAddressing);
8510 
8511  // Determine how many elements we need to allocate. Note that this
8512  // will be a varying value if this is a varying new.
8513  llvm::Value *countValue;
8514  if (countExpr != NULL) {
8515  countValue = countExpr->GetValue(ctx);
8516  if (countValue == NULL) {
8517  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
8518  return NULL;
8519  }
8520  }
8521  else {
8522  if (isVarying) {
8523  if (do32Bit) countValue = LLVMInt32Vector(1);
8524  else countValue = LLVMInt64Vector(1);
8525  }
8526  else {
8527  if (do32Bit) countValue = LLVMInt32(1);
8528  else countValue = LLVMInt64(1);
8529  }
8530  }
8531 
8532  // Compute the total amount of memory to allocate, allocSize, as the
8533  // product of the number of elements to allocate and the size of a
8534  // single element.
8535  llvm::Value *eltSize = g->target->SizeOf(allocType->LLVMType(g->ctx),
8536  ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
8537  if (isVarying)
8538  eltSize = ctx->SmearUniform(eltSize, "smear_size");
8539  llvm::Value *allocSize = ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Mul, countValue,
8540  eltSize, "alloc_size");
8541 
8542  // Determine which allocation builtin function to call: uniform or
8543  // varying, and taking 32-bit or 64-bit allocation counts.
8544  llvm::Function *func;
8545  if (isVarying) {
8546  if (g->target->is32Bit()) {
8547  func = m->module->getFunction("__new_varying32_32rt");
8548  } else if (g->opt.force32BitAddressing) {
8549  func = m->module->getFunction("__new_varying32_64rt");
8550  } else {
8551  func = m->module->getFunction("__new_varying64_64rt");
8552  }
8553  }
8554  else {
8555  // FIXME: __new_uniform_32rt should take i32
8556  if (allocSize->getType() != LLVMTypes::Int64Type)
8557  allocSize = ctx->SExtInst(allocSize, LLVMTypes::Int64Type,
8558  "alloc_size64");
8559  if (g->target->is32Bit()) {
8560  func = m->module->getFunction("__new_uniform_32rt");
8561  } else {
8562  func = m->module->getFunction("__new_uniform_64rt");
8563  }
8564  }
8565  AssertPos(pos, func != NULL);
8566 
8567  // Make the call for the the actual allocation.
8568  llvm::Value *ptrValue = ctx->CallInst(func, NULL, allocSize, "new");
8569 
8570  // Now handle initializers and returning the right type for the result.
8571  const Type *retType = GetType();
8572  if (retType == NULL)
8573  return NULL;
8574  if (isVarying) {
8575  if (g->target->is32Bit())
8576  // Convert i64 vector values to i32 if we are compiling to a
8577  // 32-bit target.
8578  ptrValue = ctx->TruncInst(ptrValue, LLVMTypes::VoidPointerVectorType,
8579  "ptr_to_32bit");
8580 
8581  if (initExpr != NULL) {
8582  // If we have an initializer expression, emit code that checks
8583  // to see if each lane is active and if so, runs the code to do
8584  // the initialization. Note that we're we're taking advantage
8585  // of the fact that the __new_varying*() functions are
8586  // implemented to return NULL for program instances that aren't
8587  // executing; more generally, we should be using the current
8588  // execution mask for this...
8589  for (int i = 0; i < g->target->getVectorWidth(); ++i) {
8590  llvm::BasicBlock *bbInit = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("init_ptr");
8591  llvm::BasicBlock *bbSkip = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("skip_init");
8592  llvm::Value *p = ctx->ExtractInst(ptrValue, i);
8593  llvm::Value *nullValue = g->target->is32Bit() ? LLVMInt32(0) :
8594  LLVMInt64(0);
8595  // Is the pointer for the current lane non-zero?
8596  llvm::Value *nonNull = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp,
8597  llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
8598  p, nullValue, "non_null");
8599  ctx->BranchInst(bbInit, bbSkip, nonNull);
8600 
8601  // Initialize the memory pointed to by the pointer for the
8602  // current lane.
8603  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbInit);
8604  llvm::Type *ptrType =
8605  retType->GetAsUniformType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
8606  llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->IntToPtrInst(p, ptrType);
8607  InitSymbol(ptr, allocType, initExpr, ctx, pos);
8608  ctx->BranchInst(bbSkip);
8609 
8610  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbSkip);
8611  }
8612  }
8613 
8614  return ptrValue;
8615  }
8616  else {
8617  // For uniform news, we just need to cast the void * to be a
8618  // pointer of the return type and to run the code for initializers,
8619  // if present.
8620  llvm::Type *ptrType = retType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
8621  ptrValue = ctx->BitCastInst(ptrValue, ptrType,
8622  LLVMGetName(ptrValue, "_cast_ptr"));
8623 
8624  if (initExpr != NULL)
8625  InitSymbol(ptrValue, allocType, initExpr, ctx, pos);
8626 
8627  return ptrValue;
8628  }
8629 }
8630 
8631 
8632 const Type *
8633 NewExpr::GetType() const {
8634  if (allocType == NULL)
8635  return NULL;
8636 
8637  return isVarying ? PointerType::GetVarying(allocType) :
8638  PointerType::GetUniform(allocType);
8639 }
8640 
8641 
8642 Expr *
8643 NewExpr::TypeCheck() {
8644  // It's illegal to call new with an undefined struct type
8645  if (allocType == NULL) {
8646  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
8647  return NULL;
8648  }
8649  if (CastType<UndefinedStructType>(allocType) != NULL) {
8650  Error(pos, "Can't dynamically allocate storage for declared "
8651  "but not defined type \"%s\".", allocType->GetString().c_str());
8652  return NULL;
8653  }
8654 
8655  // Otherwise we only need to make sure that if we have an expression
8656  // giving a number of elements to allocate that it can be converted to
8657  // an integer of the appropriate variability.
8658  if (countExpr == NULL)
8659  return this;
8660 
8661  const Type *countType;
8662  if ((countType = countExpr->GetType()) == NULL)
8663  return NULL;
8664 
8665  if (isVarying == false && countType->IsVaryingType()) {
8666  Error(pos, "Illegal to provide \"varying\" allocation count with "
8667  "\"uniform new\" expression.");
8668  return NULL;
8669  }
8670 
8671  // Figure out the type that the allocation count should be
8672  const Type *t = (g->target->is32Bit() || g->opt.force32BitAddressing) ?
8673  AtomicType::UniformUInt32 : AtomicType::UniformUInt64;
8674  if (isVarying)
8675  t = t->GetAsVaryingType();
8676 
8677  countExpr = TypeConvertExpr(countExpr, t, "item count");
8678  if (countExpr == NULL)
8679  return NULL;
8680 
8681  return this;
8682 }
8683 
8684 
8685 Expr *
8686 NewExpr::Optimize() {
8687  return this;
8688 }
8689 
8690 
8691 void
8692 NewExpr::Print() const {
8693  printf("new (%s)", allocType ? allocType->GetString().c_str() : "NULL");
8694 }
8695 
8696 
8697 int
8698 NewExpr::EstimateCost() const {
8699  return COST_NEW;
8700 }
Generated on Thu Dec 19 2013 21:30:52 for Intel SPMD Program Compiler by   1.8.1.2
